loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa A. is forty five years old. She is widowed and has six children, four girls and two boys. Two of her children are in junior high school. Some children have completed junior high school but due to financial constraints, they are unable to continue to the senior high school. Hawa lives with her family, in an old family house at Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a farming and commercial town. The majority of the inhabitants are either farmers or trade in farm produce.  Very few dwellers of Offinso are office workers. 

Hawa trades in maize. She buys bags of maize from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She distributes this maize to food vendors in her community and those who come from the cities to buy in the local market where she sells. She has been in business for over twenty years. She wants a loan to buy maize in large scale so that she can supply the increasing number of customers and also to increase her profit margin. She aspires to improve the living condition of the family. It is also her desire to help her children climb the academic ladder to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy maize in large quantities for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A. is 51 years old, a married woman and mother of four children. The children are currently in school. Beatrice lives at Abuakwa, a suburb of Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana with her family. Beatrice never had the privilege to attend school because of financial constraints, as is the problem for most of our mothers in Ghana. Beatrice decided to become a trader to take care of herself, because that was the only option for her at that time. She has been trading in the sale of used clothes for the past 25 years now. 

The sale of used clothing is a very big market in Ghana, as brand new cloths are very expensive for the poor. The selling of used clothing has created a market opportunity for many women like Beatrice. With the loan, she wants to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s future education and also to rent a store to trade. 

Beatrice belongs to a village bank called ‘Regina’. She is requesting a loan of GH¢500 to expand her business by increasing her inventory. This would enable her save more to support her husband in taking care of the home.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing for resale

loans.name: Rosana Elizabeth

texts.es:
ROSANA J. D. F., pertenece alo Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” bicada en el Jr. Ica Nº 126 en la ciudad D. Pucallpa del distrito D. Calleria, tiene 49 años D. edad, 04 hijos, su esposo es motokarrista, es socia D. manuela Ramos hace 06 años.

El primer prestamo que recibió fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró materiales para confeccionar adornos pequeños, los vendía ambulatoriamente, pues ellos crean solo para la salta tenia D. toda variedad, adquirió mucha clientela pues los detalles que los ponia eran muy exclusivos y llamativos especialmente para ambientar su sala.

Con este prestamo D. S/.2,800.00 Nuevos Soles, y compro 01 motokar, 01 moto lineal en mal estado, compro repuestos para cada uno D. ellos, arreglo sus asientos, toldera, pinto, ahora estan a la venta, se dedica a comprar y vender motocarros y motos, los repone y venD. con la compañía D. su esposo.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella y el gran éxito que viene teniendo con su nuevo trabajo.
texts.en:
ROSANA JIMEMEZ D. F. is a member of the communal bank 'Mujeres Valientes' located in the Jr. Ica Number 126 in the city of Pucallpa in the Calleria district. She is 49 years old, has 4 children, her husband is a buggy driver, and she has been an associate of Manuela Ramos for 6 years. The first loan she received was of s/.300.00 New Soles, with which she bought materials for making small ornaments, which she sold on the street. Since she had a large variety of designs, she acquired a large clientele because of the detailed work she put in them, which maD. them very exclusive and decorative especially to decorate a room. With this 2,800.00 New Soles loan, she is buying a motorcar, a motorcycle in need of repair, parts for both vehicles, as well as fixing their seats, canopy, and other parts and put them for sale, as she now buys and sells motorcars and motorcycles, repairs them and sells them together with her husband. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for trusting in her and for the great success she is having with her new line of work.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara 01 motokar, 01 moto lineal en mal estado, comprar repuestos para cada uno de ellos, arreglo sus asientos, toldera, pinto, ahora estan a la venta, se dedica a comprar y vender motocarros y motos, los repone y vende con la compañía de su esposo.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary B. is forty six years old. She is divorced and has given birth to five children; two daughters and three sons. She says all her children are in the junior high school and the youngest is in primary school. Being a single parent, Mary says it is difficult for her alone, to provide for the family. “Though my ex-husband is a cocoa farmer, he does not contribute to the upkeep of the children”, Mary says. She lives with her children in Offinso, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana and has to work very hard to meet the needs of the family. She is a food vendor and has a business cooking rice with stew. She sells by the road side. She buys her bags of rice in Kumasi. Mary has been in business for over ten years. Apart from selling cooked rice, Mary also sells fresh rice in cups on a table top in the market square. She wants to buy bags of rice on a larger scale so that she can cut down on cost and frequent trips to procure goods. It is Mary’s dream to sponsor all her children through school.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
ROSARIO G. D. PÉREZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias”, ubicada en el jr. Rio Pisqui Nº 362 en el Distrito D. Callería en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 49 años D. edad, 03 hijos, no tiene esposo.

El Primer préstamo que recibió fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, confeccionó un talero, compró golosinas en general, así comenzo su vida D. mujer trabajadores fuera D. su hogar, tambien comenzo a vender productos D. belleza.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprar más productos D. belleza D. Ebel, Avon, Unique, cumplió su venta, y ahora es muy conocida, sus clientes la llaman para solicitar sus pedidos.

Muy agradecida por ue Manuela Ramos le dio la oportunidad D. crecer.
texts.en:
ROSARIO G. D. PEREZ is a member of Banco Comunal "Mujeres Solidarias", located in the jr. Rio Pisqui Number 362 in the Calleria District in the city of Pucallpa. She is 49 years old, has 3 children, and no husband. The first loan she received was of S/.300.00 New Soles, with which she built a kiosk, bought candy, and thus commenced her life of working woman outsiD. the home; she also began selling beauty products. With this loan of S./1,000.00 New Soles, she plans to buy more beauty products such as Ebel, Avon, Unique, since she has met her sales quota, and is now very well-known, as her clients call her soliciting her products. She is very grateful for this growth opportunity that Manuela Ramos gave her.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar más productos de belleza de Ebel, Avon, Unique, cumplió su venta, y ahora es muy conocida, sus clientes la llaman para solicitar sus pedidos.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.es:
ROSITA U. DAVILA, pertenece al banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias” ubicado en el Jr. Cesar Calvo de Araujo Nº 946, en el Distrito de Calleria, tiene 51 años de edad, 02 hijos, su esposo es obrero.

El primer prestamo que recibio fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro productos de belleza, como perfumes, colonias, cremas, talcos, lapiz labial, esmaltes, todo en poca cantidad, vendia de casa en casa, se levantaba muy temprano,a tendia a su esposo e hijos y se iba a trabajar, su rutina diaira, adquirio muchos clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró mas productos de belleza, pues ahora ella tiene catálogos, los clientes escogen lo que desean, hacen sus pedidos, algunos llaman para confirmar lo escogido, crecia ella y sus ventas.

Agradece mucho a Manuela Ramos, por confiar y hacer de ella una mujer con decisiones y empresaria.
texts.en:
Rosita U. Davila belongs to the community bank “Mujers Solidarias” (Women in Solidarity) located at Jr. Cesar Calvo de Araujo No. 946, in the District of Calleria. She is 51 years old, with two children. Her husband works as a manual laborer. The first loan that she received, for 300.00 Nuevos Soles, was used to buy beauty products like perfume, cologne, lotions, powders, lipstick, and nail polish. She bought small amounts of everything and went house-to-house selling her items. Her daily routine was to get up very early to take care of her husband and children and then go to work. She has a lot of clients With this loan of 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles she will buy more beauty products. Now she has catalogs and her clients choose what they would like, make their orders and sometimes they call to confirm what they have selected. She has grown along with her sales. She is very greateful to Manuela Ramos for trusting her and making her a businesswoman who makes decisions.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
ROXANA D. A. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Líderes” ubicado en la Av. Miraflores Mz. 1, Lt. 11 D. distrito de callería, tiene 2 años de edad, 02 hijos menores de edad, ella vende pescado seco en la Av. Maya de Britto (1 cuadra) en el mercado Bellavista.

Su primero préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles que recibió, compró pescado fresco en diversas variedades y en poca cantidad.

Su esposo se levantaba muy temprano para la compra D. pescado, llevaba al mercado donde la señora Roxana lo esperaba para la venta.

Roxana con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprara pescado seco de primera calidad, pescado fresco como. Gamitana, doncella, paco, palometa, etc., gracias a la gran clientela que adquirió.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el gran apoyo hacia su persona, el progreso de su familia se siente realizada.
texts.en:
Roxana D. A. Rodríguez belongs to the community bank “Mujeres Lideres” (Women Leaders) located at Ave. Miraflores Mz 1, Lot 11 of the District of Calleria. She is 22 years old and has 2 young children. She sells dried fish at Ave. Maya de Britto (1st block) in the Bellavista market. Her first loan was for 300.00 Nuevo Soles and with that she bought a variety of fresh fish in small quantities. Her husband gets up very early to go buy the fish and he brings it to the market where Miss Roxana waits to sell it. Roxana is asking for 1,000.000 Nuevo Soles, which she will use to buy high quality dried fish and fresh fish like Pacu, Damselfish, Paco and Palometa. She is thankful for the many clients she has served. She is grateful for Manuela Ramos for the support they have given her and the progress she has made with her family. She feels complete.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dried fish and fresh fish

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce T. is a 36-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of three kids. Joyce says all her kids are in school. Joyce resides at a complex with her family. Joyce is from the greater Accra of Ghana but she is now in Kumasi because of her husband who works as an army officer in Kumasi. Her husband, she said, is very supportive in taking care of the kids.

Joyce is a food vendor who sells "kenkey" in her neighborhood. "Kenkey" is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy "kenkey" as breakfast, lunch, and supper. In addition, she also sells raw food like plantains and cassava at the army quarters where she lives.

Joyce wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, plantains, cassava, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to earn more income to raise her children, especially for paying for their education. Joyce belongs to a village bank called ‘Believers in Christ’. She also hopes to receive GHS 700 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to help her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood

loans.name: Sisis

texts.es:
SISIS C. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad”, tiene 43 años de edad, dos hijos, el trabajo que desempeña su esposo es independiente.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró telas, elásticos, hilos, confeccionó sábanas, vestidos para niños, vendió ambulatoriamente, la cliente crecía habían más pedidos.

La señora Sisis vive en un Asentamiento Humano llamado “Víctor Maldonado Vegazo” Mz. 11, Lt. 2 de la C.F.B. km. 7.200 del Distrito de Callería.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprara 16 metros de tela. Hilos (01 docena de cada color) elásticos 20 metros, hilos para remallar (02 docenas).

Está muy contenta, agradecida de Manuela Ramos, por la confianza que tienen con ella, ahora su familia esta muy unida.
texts.en:
Sisis C. M. belongs to the Community Bank “La Amistad” (Friendship). She is 43 years old and has 2 children. Her husband is self-employed. The first loan that she received was for 300.00 Nuevos Soles, which she used to buy fabric, elastic and thread to make linens and children’s clothes. She sold them as a street vendor and her customer base grew and she received more orders. Sisis lives in a settlement called “Victor Maldonado Vegazo” Mz. 11, Lot 2 of C.F.B. at kilometer 7.200 in the District of Calleria. With this loan of 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, she will buy 16 meters of fabric, 1 dozen spools of each color of thread, 20 meters of elastic and 2 dozen spools of thread for mending. She is very happy and grateful for Manuela Ramos, for trusting her and bringing her family together.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread and elastic

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A., Jane as most friends call her, is a 31 year old woman who lives at Haatso, a suburb of Accra, Ghana, with her husband and four children, three of whom are still in primary school.  They live in a rented apartment.  

Her husband is taxi driver and they both work hard to sustain the family.  Janet is a food vendor and sells banku.  She has been doing this for the past four years.  Banku is a locally made dish prepared from milled maize and cassava.  It is served with soup or stew.  A lot of people enjoy it here in Ghana, especially manual workers who take it in the morning as their breakfast.  

She operates this business in her house.  Janet buys her ingredients from the Accra central market.  She says that she took over this business from her late mother and, through this business, is able to support her husband and take good care of the family. 

With the loan, Janet wants to buy ingredients in bulk to avoid price hikes, which constantly reduce her profit.  She believes the loan funds will enable her to improve her income and save more to support her family, especially her kids’ education.  

She is in a group called “Choice”.  The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and provide support to each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
TERESA DE JESÚS MARTÍNEZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad ”, ubicado en el Jr. Oroya Mz. G, Lt. 02 del Asentamiento Humano “Nuevo Bolognesi” en el km. 7 del Distrito de Callería.

La señora teresa tiene 46 años de edad con 03 hijos mayores de edad, su esposo es fotógrafo.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, se compro una máquina fotográfica, rollos de películas y empezó a tomar fotografías, buscaba clientela y sobre todo los días festivos, pues lo consiguió.

El último desembolso que recibió fue de S/.1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, comprar frutas, botellas, tapas, madera para la producción de néctar y el encajonamiento, con la ayuda de sus hijos y esposo hacen la distribución necesaria a sus clientes.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos todo su apoyo que brindó a ella y a su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús Martinez belongs to the Community Bank “La Amistad” (Friendship), located at Jr. Oroya Mz G, Lot 2 in the Nuevo Bolognesi neighborhood, kilometer 7 of the District of Calleria. Teresa is 46 years old and has three grown children. Her husband is a photographer. The first loan she received was for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles and she bought a camera and film and began to take photographs. She sought out clients and during the holidays she was able to serve many customers. This loan, for S/.1,300.00 Nuevos Soles is to buy fruit, bottles and lids, and wood to make and bottle juice. With the help of her husband and children she will distribute the juice to her customers. She is grateful for all of the support Manuela Ramos has given to her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit and bottles to make and sell juice

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati F. is thirty seven years old.  She is married and has given birth to three children – two girls and a boy.  She says that currently, all of her children are in the basic school.  

She lives with her family in a rented apartment at Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  Offinso is a farming and commercial town.  The majority of the inhabitants are either farmers or trade in farm produce.  Few dwellers of Offinso are in an official occupation. 

Fati trades in maize.  She buys bags of maize from the farmers in her community and nearby villages.  She distributes to food vendors in her community and those who come from the cities to buy in the local market where she sells.  Fati has been in business for over seventeen years. 

She wants a loan to buy maize on a large scale so that she can supply to more customers and increase her profit margin.  She aspires to improve upon the standard of living of the family.  It is also Fati’s desire to help her children climb the academic ladder to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe O. Gómez  desde hace 46 años se dedica a la rotulación de negocios como también pintar viviendas, tiene un empleado el cual ha trabajado 25 años para él. El señor O. esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar un  compresor el cual es muy necesario ya que todos sus trabajos se realizan con ese equipo. Tenía uno pero de tanto reparar y reparar ya no tuvo arreglo y tendrá que comprar otro.
Es una persona muy trabajadora el cual comenta que ya teniendo su comprensor va a trabajar mucho para pagar el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Felipe O. Gómez has worked on business signs and house painting for 46 years, and has an employee who has worked for him for 25 years. Mr. O. is seeking a loan to buy a compressor, which he needs to carry out all his work. He had one, but after many repairs it still doesn't work properly, so he opted to buy another, which costs 7,500 pesos. He is a very hardworking person who says once he has his compressor, he will work a lot to pay off his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a compressor

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe

texts.es:
VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE L. B., pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad ” ubicada en el Asentamiento Humano “Víctor Maldonado Begazo” en el Jr. Oroya Mz. 10, Lt. 07 de la C.F.B. km. 7.000 del Distrito de Callería, ella tiene 41 años de edad 06 hijos, madre soltera.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, huevos, detergentes todo en poca cantidad, crecía poco a poco la bodega.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró Mouse, audios para sus computadoras.

La señora Virgen de Guadalupe gracias a su esfuerzo, empeño y la ayuda de Manuela Ramos, logró implementar en su casa cabinas de internet y telefónica, del cual tiene mucha clientela, sobre todo no deja la bodega, sigue creciendo todo gracias a Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Virgen de Guadalupe L. B. belongs to "La Amistad" community bank, located in the District of Callería. She is a 41-year-old single mother with six children. With the first loan she received, 300 soles, she bought basic necessities like rice, sugar, milk, oil, eggs and detergent, all in small quantities, expanding her store little by little. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will buy a mouse and speakers for her computers. Thanks to her effort and determination and the help of Manuela Ramos, Virgen de Guadalupe has been able to install internet and telephone booths in her home. Her store has a lot of customers, and continues to grow thanks to Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computer mouse and speakers for her internet business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel A. H. es casado, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, ellos tienen viviendo 7 años en su hogar. El señor Daniel A. trabaja como lavador en una compañía de trasportes, puesto que ocupa desde hace 2 años y le proporciona los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, además una de las hijas del señor Daniel también trabaja y ayuda con los gastos de su hogar. (En la fotografía no aparece el señor Daniel, sino aparece su esposa y 2 de sus hijos).
El señor Daniel A. está solicitando un préstamo para comprar uniformes y útiles escolares para sus hijos que se encuentran estudiando debido a que los ingresos que el percibe no son suficientes y es muy necesario comprarlos.
texts.en:
Daniel A. H. is married and has lived with his wife and four children for seven years. Daniel A. works as a washer for a transport company. He has had this job for two years and uses his income to take care of his family. One of his daughters also works and helps him with the household expenses. (Daniel is not in the photograph; his wife and two of their children are pictured.) Daniel A. is requesting a loan to buy uniforms and school supplies for his children, as these are necessities and he is unable to cover the cost with his income.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase uniforms and school supplies

loans.name: Rito

texts.es:
Rito C. M. es una persona muy humilde, como pueden apreciar su baño es de madera. 
Tiene la gran necesidad de reconstruirlo, pues su estructura es muy vieja y su funcionamiento es inestable, cada día que transcurre se presentan fallas con mayor frecuencia.
Desea adquirir el material y cubrir el pago de la mano de obra.
Como sabemos el cuarto de baño es parte de los espacios basicos de una vivienda.
Es chofer de transporte colectivo de la ciudad, este ingreso es insuficiente para realizar una obra de esta magnitud, por tal motivo solicita su colaboración para alcanzar su objetivo.
texts.en:
Rito C. M. is a very humble person, as demonstrated by the fact that he has a wooden bathroom, which he now wishes to reconstruct, as it is in very poor condition. He needs to pay for materials and labor, which costs 5,000 pesos. He is a city bus driver and will use this income to repay his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor and construction materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella A. is forty two years old.  She is divorced but has given birth to two sons.  One of them has completed junior high school while the other is in the final year.  

Stella lives with her two sons in a rented house.  They live in a farming/business community called Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  Stella says it has not been easy providing for herself as well as her two sons since her ex-husband does not show any concern.  

She trades in ‘gari’, tomatoes and vegetable cooking oil on a table top in the local market.  Gari is a local delicacy produced from cassava.  The milled cassava is thoroughly squeezed of water by putting it under pressure.  It is then fried in a hot metal pan over a strong fire.  It is either served hot with cooked beans and oil, or cold with sugar, milk and roasted groundnut. 

She buys bags of gari and cooking oil from nearby towns at affordable prices.  She distributes the gari mostly to the food vendors in her community.  Stella has been in business for three years.  She wants a loan to buy goods in large quantities so she can increase her profit margin to provide for her children.

loans.use: To buy ‘gari’ and vegetable oil

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente O. A. tiene dos cuarto que el construyó con sus propios ahorros, pero en esta momento a el se le acabaron sus fondos el cual su construcción quedo sin techo.
El necesita material para empezar aponer la  losa en esos dos cuartos que le faltan, su familia es grande el cual quiere darle comodidad y espacio.
También tiene un negocio donde vende comida y abarrotes pero lo tiene en un camión y en uno  aprovecharía para instalarse con mayo seguridad. El solicita la cantidad e $10,000 pesos.
texts.en:
Vicente O. A. built two rooms on his home with his own savings. But now, his funds have dried up, and his building doesn’t have a roof. He needs building materials to begin putting down the slab for the remaining two rooms. His family is large which is why he wants to make the home more comfortable and spacious. He also has a business where he sells food and groceries, which he runs from his truck. He would like to make the most of the loan to establish himself more securely. He’s asking to borrow 10,000 pesos.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Mario Gabriel

texts.es:
Mario Gabriel Castañeada desea solo empezar con la construcción de un cuarto para ampliarse y tener mas espacio en su casa. Él solo cuenta con habitaciónes muy pequeñas en su vivienda su anhelo es darle comodidad a su familia. Solicita su contribución para comprar material y pagar la mano de obra.
Es un trabajador de maquiladora y es el único sostén de su casa, su mujer es ama de casa y se queda al cuidado de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mario Gabriel Castañeada wants to begin building a room to enlarge the space in his home. He only has a very small room in his home for accommodating his family. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials and pay for manual labor. He is a factory worker and the sole provider for his household. His wife oversees the home and cares for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Kotime

texts.en:
Kotimi S. is fifty years old.  She is married and has given birth to five children – two daughters and three sons.  Three of her children have completed junior high school while the rest are still in school.  She says that her three children who have completed school need to go further, but are in the house due to financial constraints. 

Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops such as plantains, cassava, etc.  His income is not enough to provide for all the needs of the family.  Kotimi, therefore, works to support her husband.  She is a food vendor.  She cooks ‘tuo–zafi’ (popularly known as TZ).  It is prepared from maize flour and served hot with soup.  

She sells this food in front of her house in the mornings to her neighbors.  She procures bags of maize from farmers in her community.  Kotimi has been in business for over ten years.  

She wants a loan to buy maize in large quantities.  It is her dream to help her husband to sponsor their children to have access to tertiary education.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Jose Jaime

texts.es:
José Jaime S. S. tiene un hijo en un centro de rehabilitación a causa de un accidente que tuvo toda la familia. Ahora el muchacho necesita estar al cuidado de personas especializadas para su pronta recuperación. Este centro pide su pagos cada 4 meses el cual este señor no completa para pagar ahora el solicita la cantidad de $10,000 pesos.
El y su esposa recibe pensionados de una institución de México a ella se la dieron por su años trabajado y a el por discapacidad.
texts.en:
José Jaime S. S. has a son at a rehabilitation center following an accident the family had. Now his son needs to be cared for by specialists to speed up his recovery. This center is asking for payment every 4 months, and this man is unable to pay the full amount. He is requesting a loan of $10,000 pesos. He and his wife both receive a pension from a Mexican institution--she for her years of work and for he for his disabilities.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rehabilitation Center

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba S. is forty eight years old.  She is married and has given birth to seven children - six daughters and one son.  She says that almost all of her daughters who have completed junior high school could not continue.  However, her son was able to go further and is now in the tertiary. 

Abiba’s husband is a commercial driver.  She lives with her children and husband at Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  Abiba works very hard to support her husband provide for the family.  She is a food vendor.  She cooks rice with stew.  Abiba sells on a table top at the local market.  She buys bags of rice from Kumasi.  She has been in business for over fifteen years. 

She wants to buy bags of rice on a large scale so that she can cut down on the cost of frequent trips to procure goods.  It is her dream to help her husband so that they can put up their own structure.

loans.use: To procure bags of rice

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina A. is forty five years old.  She is married and has given birth to seven children – three boys and four girls.  She says that all of her children are currently in school.  Some are in the basic school while others are in the junior and senior high schools. 

Georgina’s husband is a cocoa farmer.  She lives with her family at Offinso, a farming/commercial town in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  She is into trading.  She trades mainly in plantains and bananas.  She buys her supplies from the farmers in her community and nearby towns.  

Georgina treks to Accra to sell the plantains to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators and the bananas to retailers.  She has been in business for seven years.  She says that when plantains becomes scarce, she buys any other food stuffs like cassava, yams, etc. 

Georgina wants to buy plantains on a large scale so that she can supply to a number of customers and increase her profit margin.  She desires to help her children to further their education.

loans.use: To procure plantains and bananas

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
La señora Dulce Maria J. C. es casada vive con su esposo, ellos son un matrimonio joven y no tienen hijos, ella se dedica a vender zapatos y bolsas por catalogo desde hace 6 meses y su esposo trabaja como mesero en un restaurante y entre los ingresos de ellos 2 cubren los gastos del hogar.
La señora Dulce Maria está solicitando un préstamo para construir una barda al frente de su casa para que de esa manera si en un futuro ellos deciden tener hijos les puedan ofrecer un hogar seguro y ellos puedan vivir tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dulce Maria J. C. is married and lives with her husband. They are a young married couple and do not have children. She has been selling shoes and purses by catalogue for the past 6 months. Her husband works as a waiter in a restaurant and between their two incomes, they cover their living expenses. Mrs. Dulce Maria is asking for a loan to build a wall in front of their house so that if, in the future they decide to have children, they can provide them a safe home where they can live in peace.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall in front of her house

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice S. is forty two years old.  She is married and has given birth to six children - three boys and three daughters.  One has completed junior high school while the rest are all in the basic and elementary schools.  

Her husband is a farmer.  He cultivates palm nuts in the community where they live.  Beatrice lives with her family in a family mud-house at Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  

Offinso is farming and commercial town.  Most of the inhabitants are either farmers or trade in farm produce.  Very few people are in an official occupation.  

Beatrice deals in palm nuts.  She procures palm nuts from the farmers in her community and her husband’s farm.  She says that, at times, she travels to nearby villages to buy palm nuts at quite affordable prices.  She then sells in the local market.  She distributes the greater part to food vendors and palm oil producers in her community.  She has been in business for five years.  

She wants a loan to buy palm nuts on a large scale so that she can supply to more customers and also trek to nearby markets to do business and increase her profit margin.  She desires to help her children climb the academic ladder to higher levels.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
El señor Eusebio B. tiene una hermosa familia para la cual desea que tengan lo mejor.
Con su ahorros le a echo mejoras a su vivienda pero en este momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para terminar la construcción de un cuarto que quiere para sus tres pequeños hijos que tiene.
 Don Eusebio está solicitando un préstamo para esa construcción y planea pagarlo con sus ingresos de chofer de camión de carga. Su deseo es que sus niños tengan su propio cuarto y vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Mr. Eusebio B. has a beautiful family for whom he wishes the best. With his savings he has made improvements to their home but at this moment he does not possess the necessary capital to finish the construction of one room that he wants for his three small children. Eusebio is requesting a loan for that construction and plans to re-pay it with his income as a heavy-load truck driver. His wish is that his children have their own room and live better.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room for his 3 small children.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La señora Erika B. V. esta separada de su esposo, ella actualmente vive con su mamá, trabaja como empleada en una empresa donde se hace ropa y con los ingresos que percibe mantiene a sus 2 hijos.
La señora Erika está solicitando un préstamo para solventar los gastos escolares de sus hijos ya que los ingresos que percibe no le son suficientes, esto permitirá que sus hijos continúen con sus estudios y en un futuro puedan llegar a ser profesionistas.
texts.en:
Erika B. V. is separated from her husband and currently lives with her mother. She is employed in a factory where they make clothing and with that income she supports her 2 children. Erika is requesting a loan to take care of her children’s school expenses given that the income that she receives is not enough. This will allow her children to continue with their studies so that in the future they may become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolás M. R. tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es acompañado, el Señor Nicolás tiene 4 hijos de los cuales su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 27 años su otro hijo de 25 años trabaja por cuenta propia su otra hija de 20 años trabaja por cuenta propia y su hijo menor de 19 años labora por cuenta propia, su compañera de vida trabaja junto con el vende productos lácteos en el mercado la Terminal en León, sus propósitos son de invertir en su capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar, sus sueños son de comparar una descremadora que tenga mas capacidad ya que esta le proporcionara mas producción para sus productos sus deseos son de mejorar su vivienda con el fin de que su familia tenga un buen lugar donde vivir y que cubra las necesidades además en sus deseos esta el sacar adelante por que le gustaría que este prevaleciera entre todos.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de productos lácteos como: crema, cuajada y leche, la ubicación de su negocio es el Valle de la Zapata, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 11 años, el inicio esta necesidad por que no estaba trabajando por lo que tuvo problema de salud y había dejado a lo que se dedicaba anteriormente que era le destace de res porque había vendido la matricula de destace para comprar el tratamiento que necesitaba por lo que se quedo sin placa entonces necesitaba otro medio de trabajo por lo que decide ofrecer la venta de los productos lácteos ya que su esposa vendía los productos y fue mucho mas fácil para el ya que su esposa le enseño los lugares donde los clientes llegaban en busca de los productos lácteos por lo que mas tarde con su esposa deciden realizar el proceso de la leche y es así como ambos trabajan en conjunto con este negocio por lo que el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que tienen que obtener mayores ingresos ya que tienen que comprar mas vacas para la producción de sus productos.
texts.en:
Nicolás M. R. is 49 years old and lives with his partner. He has 4 children: a 27- and a 25-year old son, and a 20- and 19-year old daughter. They are adults and work for themselves. Nicolás's life partner works with him selling milk products in the Terminal market in León. He intends to invest in working capital so he can bring home the bread everyday. His dreams are to buy a machine that skims milk that holds more capacity so he can increase production. His dreams are also to better his life with the goal of giving his family a good place to live and to cover the necessities. He also has dreams of providing a good life and he would like this to prevail over everything else. His source of income is the sale of milk products like cream, curd, and milk. His business is located in the Valley of the Zapata. He has had his business for 11 years. He began this business because he was not working due to a health issue. He left the work he did previously, which was the sale of beef. He sold his license in order to buy the treatment and he was left without a license. He decided to sell mik products since his wife sold the products. It was very easy for him since his wife taught him where customers went to search for milk products. Later, he and his wife decided to enter into the business of processing milk, which is their business now. The loan is for the working capital since he needs to make a higher profit and buy more cows for the production of milk products.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy cows for processing milk products

loans.name: Calixtra De Jesus

texts.es:
Calixtra de Jesús Ríos tiene la edad de 63 años, su estado civil es acompañada, Doña Calixtra tiene 8 hijos y todos son mayores de edad y trabajan por cuenta propia, su compañero de vida no labora por su edad, sus propósitos son de introducir nuevos productos en su pulpería y así tener el favoritismo de sus clientes, sus sueños son de tener otra vivienda donde su esposo y ella puedan vivir tranquilos ya que debido a la edad que tienen ambos y el negocio lo ocupan como medio de subsistencia sus deseos son de predominar en con su negocio además le gusta este negocio y quisiera mantenerlo para su bienestar además le gustaría que Dios le de mas vida para seguir trabajando y seguir disfrutando de la vida.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 15 años, Doña Calixtra inicio este negocio nació con el objetivo de  apoyar en los gastos de la familia y así ayudar a su esposo por lo que su esposo no trabaja debido a su edad por lo que empezó estableciendo con pocos productos como lo fue: golosinas, refrescos y granos básicos pero sus clientes buscaban mas productos por lo que Doña Calixtra no tenia mucho capital para invertir pero mas tarde decide realizar un préstamo y logra conseguir mas productos para su pulpería y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que mantener surtida su pulpería además quiere realizar la compra de nuevos productos y las compras las realiza en Managua y en otros departamentos.
texts.en:
Calixtra de Jesús Ríos is 63 years old and lives with her partner. She has 8 children, who are adults and work for themselves. Her partner doesn't work because of his age. She intends to introduce new products in her general store so she can attract more customers. Her dreams are to own another home where she and her husband can live tranquilly, given their age. They are dependent on their business as their means of survival. Her wishes are to dominate in the business. Moreover, she likes the business and would like to maintain it well. She would also like God to give her more time so she can continue working and enjoying life. Her source of income is her general store, which is located in her house. She has had this business for 15 years. Calixtra began this business with the objective of helping out with the expenses of the family. This is how she helps her husband, as her husband no longer works due to his age. They began establishing the business with some products like candies, drinks, and basic grains. However, her customers were looking for more products, in which Calixtra had no capital to invest. Later, she decided to take out a loan and managed to get more products for her general store and satisfy the needs of her customers. The loan is for capital to stock her general store and to buy new products and purchases from Managua and other places.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital to stock her general store and buy new products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Fernando

texts.es: El señor Juan Fernando y su esposa la señora Hilda Silvia tienen dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando, pero tiene un problema en este momento, no cuentan con el dinero necesario para la compra de útiles escolares y uniformes de la escuela. El señor Juan trabaja desde hace más de 20 años como empleado general y este trabajo representa su principal fuente de ingresos con los cuales mantiene a su familia, él solicita este préstamo debido a que su sueldo es bajo y no puede cubrir esta necesidad ya que en la escuela les están exigiendo los útiles y uniformes de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan Fernando and his wife Hilda Silvia have two children who are beginning their studies at school, but they have a problem. Right now, they do not have enough money to buy the necessary school materials and uniforms. Juan has worked for over 20 years as a general employee and this job is his principal means of income. He uses this income to take care of his family. He is requesting this loan because his salary is low and he can not cover for the required school materials and uniforms for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school materials and uniforms for his children

loans.name: Carlos Martin

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Martín G. Palacios tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es casado Dona Carlos tiene 4 hijos su edades son las siguientes una niña de 11 años de edad y cursa el 1 año de secundaria, su otra hija de 9 años cursa el 5 grado de primaria, otra niña de 7 años de edad y cursa el 2 grado de primaria y su hijo de 6 años que cursa el 1 grado de primaria, su compañera de vida labora con su esposo, sus propósitos son que con el capital de su negocio obtener mejoras para su vivienda ya que esto es lo que mas le interesa por lo que tiene una familia y que cumpla con brindarle las comodidades básicas que tiene que poseer la vivienda, sus sueños son de sacar adelante a sus hijos para que se transformen en futuros profesionales par el mañana y además puedan recompensar todo el  sacrificio que se ha hecho por ellos para que tengan una educación sus deseos son de poseer una variedad de ganado y cerdo para tener un respaldo para sus hijos y que puedan trabajar con este oficio.


La actividad económica a la que Don Carlos se dedica es el servicio de molino para moler: maíz de tortilla, pinol y carne, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 6 años, Don Carlos inicio este negocio con 1molino y con esfuerzo propio y algunos financiamientos que ha decido realizar para con su negocio ya que por medio de ellos es que su negocio ha crecido por lo que ahora tiene 2 molinos lo que le genera una mayor rentabilidad para su familia además quiere dedicarse a otro negocio como lo es el engorde de cerdo para posteriormente venderlos ya que esta seria otra fuente de ingresos pero su interés con el molino es el principal ya que los clientes siempre llegan en busca de los servicio del molino por lo que solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que darle mantenimiento a los molinos ya que actualmente el motor le esta dando problemas y piensa embobinarlo para que salga mas barato que la compra de uno nuevo.
texts.en:
Carlos Martín G. Palacios is 36 years old and is married. He has 4 children: an 11-year old daughter in grade one of secondary school, a 9-year old daughter in fifth grade in primary school, a 7-year old daughter in second grade of primary school and a 6-year old son in first grade of primary school. Carlos' source of income is his mill where he mills tortilla corn, pinol (a type of corn meal), and meat. The location of his business is in his home. He has had the business for 6 years. Carlos started his business with one mill. With enough motivation and some financing, he was able to increase his business to two mills. They generate the majority of the profit for his family. Carlos would also like to do another type of business: raising and fattening pigs for sale. It would be another means of income but his principal interest is the milling business. His customers always come looking for milling service. He is requesting financing for working capital for maintaining the mill since the motor of the mill is giving him problems. He is thinking of winding and repairing the motor as it is cheaper to do so than to buy a new one.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for maintaining a mill

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Martín Javier

texts.es:
El señor Martín Javier S.  es padre de familia, vive con su esposa y tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando.
Tuvo dos créditos anteriores con FVP los cuales pago puntualmente y gracias a ellos ha logrado mejorar a su vivienda, en este momento está solicitando un préstamo para terminar la barda trasera de su casa y así su familia estará más protegida y segura.
Don Martín es empleado de una compañía de mensajería en el departamento de entrega de paquetes a domicilio, este trabajo es su principal fuente de ingreso.
Cuando se tomo la fotografía señor Martín no se encontraba, estaba trabajando es por esa razón que su esposa la señora  María Guadalupe Rocha aparece en la foto.
texts.en:
Martín Javier S. is the father of the family. He lives with his wife and has two children who are students. He had two previous loans with FVP, which he paid punctually. Thanks to the loans, he has managed to improve his home. Now, he requests a loan to finish the back fence surrounding his house so his family can be more protected and secure. Don Martín is an employee of a messenger company. He works in the department that specializes in package delivery to homes. This job is his principal source of income. When the photo was taken, Martín was not available. This is the reason why his wife María Guadalupe Rocha appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of a fence for his home

loans.name: Guaracal Group

texts.es: Las  socias quienes conforman el grupo "Guaracal" son personas que se conocen ya que residen en el mismos barrio, están representados por la señora Marcela, todos ellos comprometidos en sus pagos y para con los integrantes del grupo. Este grupo se encuentra cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando honradez y responsabiliza con sus pagos, por lo que cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios. En general los socios se dedican a actividades comerciales D. venta D. productos como ser: venta D. ropa, cosmético, comida, arrotes en tiendas D. barrios, frutas, servicio D. transporte y servicio D. cocina. Como en todo rubro D. comercio siempre existe la demanda D. productos pero los socios cuentan con experiencia para enfrentar cualquier adversidad y sacar a flote su pequeño negocio ya que representa el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. insumos y materiales D. mejor calidad para proporcionar a sus productos un mejor acabado y una mejor calidad.
texts.en:
The members of the “Guaracal” group are people who know each other given that they resiD. in the same neighborhood. They are represented by Marcela, are all committed to making their payments, and are also committed to each other as members of the group. This group is in its second cycle, demonstrating honesty and responsibility with their payments given that they rely on their experience in solidarity groups. In general the members dedicate themselves to the sale of products such as: sale of clothing, make-up, food, groceries in neighborhood stores, fruit, transportation services, and kitchen services. Like in any industry there always exists the demand for products but the members rely on experience to confront any adversity and to keep afloat their small businesses given that they represent the means of supporting their families. The loan will be used to purchase supplies and higher quality materials to proviD. their products a better finish and a better quality.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and higher quality materials.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon Group

texts.es: El grupo " Sagrado Corazón "  esta representado por la señora lucia y conformado por personas responsables que se conocen entre si ya que residen en el mismo barrio. Todos ellos (as) se comprometen a efectuar los pagos puntuales y a cumplir con el resto de los miembros del grupo. en general los socios (as) del grupo se dedican a actividades comerciales como venta de ropa, cosmético, servicio de cocina, venta de comida, venta de abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, venta de refrescos, venta de frutas, servicio de transporte público, servicio técnicos. Como en todo rubro siempre existe la competencia de la oferta y la demanda y en especial en el rubro comercial ya que los precios de los productos fluctúan de acuerdo a la demanda de los mismos, es por esta razón que  es necesario tener los productos adecuados a la época. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de insumos y materiales para el mejoramiento de sus productos y a la mejorar de sus herramientas de trabajo para prestar un servicio más eficiente. Una mayoría de los socios (as) ya tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo que saben administrar los fondos otorgados y responder a tiempo con el compromiso que tienen con la fundación Agrocapita.
texts.en:
The “Sacred Heart” group is represented by Lucia and is composed of responsible people who know each other given that they reside in the same neighborhood. They all commit themselves to make punctual payments and to fulfill their commitments to the rest of the members of the group. In general the members of the group dedicate themselves to commercial activities such as the sale of clothing, make-up, kitchen services, the sale of food, the sale of groceries in neighborhood stores, the sale of soft drinks, the sale of fruit, public transportation services, and technical services. Like in any industry there exists the competition of supply and demand; this exists especially in the commercial industry given that the prices of products fluctuate according to the same demand. It is for this reason that it is necessary to have the most up-to-date products. The requested loan will be used to purchase supplies and materials to improve products and work tools in order to provide more efficient services. A majority of the group members already have experience working in solidarity groups, as such, they know how to administer the granted funds and how to respond punctually to the commitment that they have with the Agrocapita foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and materials to improve products and work tools.

loans.name: Amélé Agathe

texts.fr: Houngbati amélé habite le quartier d’agoè tellessou , elle a pour activité le commerce de charbons , maïs et haricots en gros et en détail et aussi par distribution, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2007 dans son son quartier, elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce premier crédit de 150000F pour s’approvisionner en sacs de charbons de bois et de sacs de haricots. Elle est mariée avec un monsieur du nom de DOVI komlavi qui exerce dans la maçonnerie, ensemble ils ont eu quatre enfants. Elle espère rentabiliser son commerce pour pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
Amélé Houngbati lives in the Agoè Tellessou district and does commerce in charcoal, corn, and beans wholesale and retail and also by distribution. She has been in this business since 2007 in her district but has never been a recipient of a WAGES loan. She is requesting this initial loan of 150,000 francs CFA for supplies of charcoal and beans. Ms. Houngbati is married to a gentleman by the name of Komlavi DOVI, who is a mason. Together they have four children. She hopes to make her commerce profitable to help her husband with household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, and charcoal

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: G. afi et une dame qui habite le quartier d’avédji, un quartier voisin d’adjidogomé à lomé. Elle exerce dans la vente de produits d’alimentation générale, ce depuis 2003, elle dresse son étalage devant son domicile. Elle demande son premier prêt de 300000F chez WAGES pour pouvoir se réapprovisionner. Elle est mariée à un journaliste avec qui elle a eu 03 enfants. Elle pourra avec son revenu épargner pour augmenter son étalage.
texts.en:
Afi G. is a woman who lives in Avédj, a district neighboring Adjidogomé in Lomé. She has been selling groceries since 2003 and sets up her display in front of her home. She is asking for her first WAGES loan of 300,000 francs for replenishing her inventory. She is married to a journalist with who she had three children. With her revenues, she will be able to save money for expanding her display of goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Kokou Messan

texts.fr: Monsieur KOKOU messan est un revendeur de FAN MILK, il tient un dépôt de Fan  à côté d’une pharmacie qui s’appelle SATIS, il a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu’il a bien et régulièrement remboursé, il sollicite un 2ème crédit d’un montant de 500000F pour augmenter son stock de FAN dans son dépôt. Il est marié à une dame qui est une revendeuse, ils ont ensemble eu 02 enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Messan KOKOU is a retailer of FAN MILK. He has a FAN outlet next to a pharmacy called SATIS. He already obtained a WAGES loan, which he repaid regularly and is requesting a second loan of 500,000 francs to increase his stock. He is married to a woman who is a retailer, and together they had two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy FAN MILK products

loans.name: Yvessin

texts.fr: Monsieur yvessin A. habite le quartier d’adidogomé à lomé, il est un homme très dynamique qui exerce le commerce de planches et de chevrons à agoè, il fait ce commerce depuis 1999, il n’est pas mariée et assume lui-même ses charges et celle de ses frères et sœurs. il demande un premier crédit de 500000F de chez WAGES pour pouvoir augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Mr Yvessin A. lives in the neighborhood of Adidogomé in Lomé. He is a very dynamic young man, who sells wood planks and rafters in Agoè. He has been in the business since 1999, he is not married and he, alone, is financially responsible for himself and his brothers and sisters. He is requesting a first loan of 500 000F from WAGES in order to increase his inventory.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood planks and rafters

loans.name: Adjano

texts.fr: Monsieur K. Adjano est un jeune homme de 26 ans qui est débrouilleur qui fait dans son quartier le commerce de sacs de farine de blé et de sucres, il a déjà obtenu de WAGES un prêt de 500000F qu’il a remboursé, il sollicite un second prêt d’un montant de 500000F pour acheter de la farine de blé et du sucre. Il n’est pas marié mais il a eu deux enfants. Il est aussi un agent commercial mais c’est pour pouvoir subvenir convenablement aux charges de ses deux enfants qu’il entamé le commerce
texts.en:
Mr. Adjano K. is a young, resourceful, 26 year old man who sells bags of wheat flour and sugar in his neighborhood. He was previously granted a WAGES loan of 500000 XOF ($1025) which he repaid. He is now requesting a second loan in the amount of 500000 XOF ($1025) to purchase wheat flour and sugar. He is not married, but has two children. Mr. K. is a sales representative, but started working in commercial business in order to suitably provide for his children.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of wheat four and sugar for resale

loans.name: Komlan John

texts.fr: Monsieur K. john est un revendeur de produits d’alimentation générale  depuis 2007 dans la rue prince à adjidogomé. Il n’a jamais obtenu de prêt de chez WAGES , son stock s’épuise c’est pour cela qu’il sollicite son 1er prêt  de 375000Fde WAGES pour pouvoir se réapprovisionner et relancer son activité. Il est marié à Une dame qui est une revendeuse, ensemble ils ont à charges 04 enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. John K. has worked as a general food retailer since 2007 on Prince Street in Adjidogomé. He has never had a WAGES loan before, but is now requesting his first loan of 375000 XOF ($775) to restock his products and reopen his business. He is married with four children and his wife also works as a retailer.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of general food products for resale

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina, vive en la avenida Luís Fuentes de la zona Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en la casa de sus padres. Actualmente se encuentra estudiando una carrera profesional en la universidad Estatal.


Tiene una pequeña tienda que da hacia la calle en la cual instaló su negocio de llamadas telefónicas y venta de tarjetas de teléfonos, con lo cual financia sus estudios. 


El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mayor cantidad de tarjetas, así mejorará sus ingresos

Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Cristina lives in Luís Fuentes Avenue, in the Rio Seco zone of the city of El Alto. She lives in her parents' home, and is currently studying a professional degree at the state university. She owns a small shop facing the street, where she runs her business offering phone calls and selling phone cards. With this business she is able to fund her studies. The loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of phone cards in order to increase her income. This is her first loan with Impro. They have evaluated her application and classified her as suitable for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase phone cards

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa,  vive en la  calle Junín de la  Zona de Alto Lima, vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos, ya que por circunstancias de la vida su esposo hizo abandono del hogar.


Ella se dedica a la compra venta de ropa de señoras en las distintas ferias de la ciudad y los días domingos se dedica a la venta de pollos en la feria  16 de julio la más grande de la ciudad, con lo cual sostiene económicamente a su familia.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mayor mercadería.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación presentada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Luisa lives in Junín St, in the Alto Lima zone, in her own home with her children. Owing to the circumstances of life, her husband abandoned their home. She works selling women's clothes in various markets around the city, and on Sundays she sells chicken in the 16 de Julio market, the largest market in the city. With this income she is able to support her family financially. The loan will be used to purchase wholesale merchandise. This is her first loan with Impro. They have evaluated her application and classified her as suitable for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Fo Koffi

texts.fr: A. fo koffi habite le quartier d’adidogomé awatamé à lomé, il et marié à AGODO Essi qui est revendeuse, fo koffi exerce comme activité le commerce de charbons de bois et de maïs en gros et en détail dans le quartier d’awatamé, il a déjà obtenu de WAGES un prêt de 400000f qu’il a bien remboursé, il sollicite maintenant un crédit 300000F pour pouvoir acheter du charbons de bois et de sacs de maïs pour rentabiliser son commerce. Il a à charges 03 personnes qui sont toutes ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fo Koffi A. lives in the Adidogomé Awatamé district in Lomé. He is married to Essi AGODO, who is a retailer. He does commerce in charcoal and corn at the wholesale and retail levels, in the Awatamé district. Having already had a WAGES loan of 400,000 francs that he has repaid, he is now requesting a loan of 300,000 francs, which will be used to buy some charcoal and sacks of corn in order to make his commerce profitable. He supports three persons, all of whom are his children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and corn

loans.name: Eddy

texts.es:
Eddy  vive en la calle Tacagua  de la zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposa, la cual por el momento se encuentra sin empleo, y sus tres pequeños hijos, en su terreno que le heredo su padre.
 
Se dedica al decorado y pintado de paredes interiores en construcciones nuevas, en diferentes sectores de la ciudad mediante contratos.


El crédito lo destinara en la compra de pintura masilla y otros, propios de su trabajo.
 
Es el  primer crédito en Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Eddy lives in Tacagua St, in the Villa Ingenio zone of the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife, who is currently unemployed, and their three small children, on land that he inherited from his father. He works on contract, painting and decorating the interior walls of newly constructed buildings in different parts of the city. The loan will be used to purchase paint, putty and other items for his work. This is his first loan with Impro. They have evaluated his application and classified him as suitable for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase painting materials

loans.name: Waldo

texts.es:
Waldo  vive en la calle Sorata  en la zona Villa Cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica al cuidado de su pequeña hija. en su terreno que le heredo su padre.
 
Se dedica al comercio de muebles y artefactos en deshuso, los cuales adquiere en las zonas centrales de la ciudad de La Paz, y los vende en sectores periféricos de la ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercaderia para su negocio.
 
Es el  primer crédito en Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Waldo lives in Sorata St, in the Villa Cooperativa zone of the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife, who cares for their young daughter, on land he inherited from his father. He works selling furniture and second hand items, which he acquires in the central zones of the city of La Paz and sells in the outlying areas of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy merchandise for his business. This is his first loan with Impro. They have evaluated his application and classified him as suitable for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Los Lirios Group

texts.en:
"Los Lirios" is a Bank of Hope located about five minutes from the Esperanza office in Los Alcarrizos. The bank's newest group (Group 4) have just finished their training with Esperanza International and have submitted their first loan applications. Gloria, Christofer, Marta, Andrea, and Evelyn will be using their loans to expand or begin the following businesses a small hair salon, wristwatch sales, a convenience store, and clothing sales. All members of this group will be investing their money directly in merchandise purchases.

In the future, these micro-entrepreneurs state that they'd love to see better lives for their children—good health-care and education, they'd like to grow their business ventures further, and some would like to continue their own studies (at the secondary and university level).

The picture provided shows these group members gathered at Marta's convenience store.

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: purchasing merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Irineo

texts.es:
Irineo se dedica a la producción y venta de leche a la Industria PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), también es profesor del área rural, es soltero, vive en casa propia que esta ubicado en la comunidad de Chijipina Chico  sección Achacachi.


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera, así podrá incrementar y mejorar sus ingresos. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Irineo produces and sells milk to the local industrial milk processing plant, PIL. He also works as a teacher in the surrounding rural area. He is unmarried, and lives in his own house, which is located in the Achacachi section of the Chijipina Chico community. The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow, with which he will be able to increase his income. This is his first loan with Impro, and his credit evaluation qualifies him to receive such a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE GANADO

loans.name: Raul Rene

texts.es:
Raúl es profesor en la comunidad de Chijipina Grande ademas se dedica a la producción y venta de leche a la Industria PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), tiene tres  hijos los cuales todavía son dependientes. Rene vive en casa propia que esta ubicado en la comunidad de Chijipina Grande sección Achacachi.


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera y así podrá incrementar sus ingresos para la mantención de su familia. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Raúl is a teacher in the Chijipina Grande community. He also produces and sells milk to the local industrial milk processing facility, PIL. He has three sons, all of whom are still dependent on him. Raúl lives in his own home, which is located in the Achacachi section of the Chijipina Grande community. The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow, which will enable him to increase his income, so that he may better provide for his family. This is Raúl's first loan working with Impro, and his credit evaluation qualifies him to receive such a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE GANADO

loans.name: Brenda Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Brenda Lucia Torrez M. tiene la edad de 28 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Brenda tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes un varón de 5 años de edad y cursa el tercer nivel de primaria su otro hijo tiene la edad de 4 meses y recientemente no estudia, sus propósitos son de seguir colaborando con la ayuda económica que ella aporta através de su negocio, sus deseos son que la actividad económica del país mejore y que por consiguiente mejore su negocio para lograr los objetivos propuestos sus sueños que Dios le de mas vida para lograr educar a sus nietos para ver que estos se preparen de forma profesional y además sepan enfrentar las difíciles situaciones que se le presenten para el día de mañana ya que quiere salir adelante y dejar de vender ambulante por las calles y realizar esta actividad en su vivienda.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de vigoron, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo de poseer el negocio es de 2 años, Doña Brenda inicio este negocio por cuenta propia ya que con el dinero que su esposo ganaba no le ajustaba lo suficiente para los gastos de su casa y todo inicio con el apoyo de su familia quienes le ayudaron con este negocio ya que su hijo mayor le ayudaba con a cargar con los productos por lo que no tenia un medio de transporte para la venta de sus productos y ambos recorrían las calles en busca de clientes que pudieran apreciar el delicioso vigoron que ofrecía en las calles por lo que mas tarde decide conseguirse un carretón para que su hijo descansara de transportar esta carga pesada todos los días por lo que ahora le ayuda a llevar el carretón y es una manera mucho mas fácil, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que realizar la compra de su materia prima como: yuca, chingaste, frito, queso, charrasca y repollo por lo que todos los días ofrece el vigoron a sus clientes y dice estar muy contenta de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas a quienes les importa el progreso de las personas y del país.
texts.en:
Brenda Lucia Torrez M. is 28 years old and married. She has 2 sons. Her eldest son is 5 years old and is in his third year of primary school. Her younger son is 4 months old. Recently, Brenda stopped her studies. Her intention is to be able to continue to provide for her family, which she is able to do thanks to the income from her business. She wishes for her country's economy to improve, and hopes that this improvement would in turn improve her business so that she may achieve the success she needs. Her dream is for God to grant her a long life so that she may be able to educate her grandchildren and see that they grow up knowing how to succeed professionally and how to handle the difficult situations that they may encounter in their lives. In the more immediate future, Brenda wishes to move forward with her business, to no longer have sell her food as a street vendor, and to be able to sell her food from her home. Brenda's business is selling the traditional food vigoron. She sells it on the street, and has run her business for 2 years. Brenda began her business on her own because the money that her husband earned was not sufficient to cover their household expenses. Everything relied on the support of her family, who helped her with the business. Her eldest son helped her to carry her food because she did not have anything that she could use to carry it when she went out to sell. She and her son would walk the streets looking for customers who would appreciate her delicious vigoron. Eventually she decided to get a cart to carry her food, because her son was growing tired from carrying it around every day. Now they carry the cart around together, and it is much easier for them to work. The loan will provide capital for her business, with which she will buy raw materials such as yucca, pinol sediment, cheese, cabbage, and a knife, so that she may continue to make and sell vigoron every day to her customers. Brenda says that she is very happy to work with Fundación León 2000 and with the friendly organizations who are concerned with the progress of the people and of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Angela Adriana

texts.es:
Ángela Adriana Núñez R. tiene la edad de 60 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Ángela tiene 5 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor tiene la edad de 42 años, su otro hijo de 39 años de edad, su hija de 35 años de edad y su hijo menor de 33 años todos trabajan por cuenta propia, su compañera de vida labora en la venta de calzado, sus propósitos son de incrementar su clientela así como su inventario y de esta forma mantenerse en el mercado, sus deseos son de tener el suficiente dinero y dejar de trabajar con el capital prestado ya si podrá independizarse económicamente y además conservara el dinero para su futuro y el de su esposo ya ambos trabajan muy duro a pesar de sus edades sus sueños son de que su familia permanezca unida con sus hijos y nietos ya que el tiempo transcurre y le gustaría vivir mas tiempo para conocerlos además quiere seguir ayudando a su hija en la crianza de sus nietos para darle la educación mas correcta.

La actividad económica a la que Doña Ángela se dedica es la venta de cosa de horno y calzado, la ubicación de ambos negocios son lugares diferentes la venta de calzado es en el Mercado Central y la venta de cosa de horno es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 3 años, Doña Ángela inicio con otro tipo de negocio como lo fue la venta de refrescos pero esto no le alcanzaba lo suficiente para sustentar a toda su familia por lo que su esposo no estaba trabajando y tuvo que buscar otra fuente de ingresos es por eso que decide que su esposo se dedique al negocio de la venta de calzado y ella se dedicaría al otro negocio como lo es la venta y elaboración de cosa de horno y así ambos podrían trabajar en conjunto con el fin de sacar a su familia adelante, el motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesitan realizar la compra de maíz, calzado escolar, payana, leña y queso por lo que sus clientes  le piden sus cosas de hornos  ya que son muy sabrosas.
texts.en:
Ángela Adriana Núñez R. is 60 years old and married. She has 5 children, whose ages are as follows: her oldest son is 42 years old, her next son is 39 years old, her daughter is 35 years old, and her youngest son is 33 years old. All of her children support themselves. Her partner sells footwear. Ángela hopes to grow her clientele as well as her inventory, and by doing so to remain competitive in the market. Her dream is to earn enough money to no longer require loans for business capital, so that she will be able to be economically independent, while also saving enough money to provide for her and her husband's future. She and her husband still both work very hard in spite of their age. Her dream is for her family to remain united, so that she may stay close to her children and grandchildren as time passes on. She would like to live longer so that she may spend even more time with her family, and wants to continue helping her daughter to raise her grandchildren, so that she can help ensure that they are brought up well. Ángela's business sells both baked goods and footwear. She sells the two items in different places; footwear is sold in the central market, and baked goods are sold out of her home. She has been running her business for 3 years. She initially sold soft drinks, but this didn't earn enough money to sustain her entire family, since her husband was not working at the time. Needing to find another source of income, she decided that her husband should sell footwear while she would make and sell baked goods. In this way, they would both be able to work toward improving their family's finances and moving them forward in the world. The purpose of the loan is to provide capital with which Ángela would purchase corn, school shoes, the children's game payana, firewood, and cheese, so that she may provide more of the delicious baked goods and other items that her customers demand.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es: Feliciana tiene 28 años, vive en la casa de su familia con sus hijos; Melisa de 13 años, Mónica de 6 y Víctor Raúl de 4, su pareja los abandonó. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica netamente a su actividad, al no poder acceder a estudios secundarios ha trabajado desde muy temprana edad, incursionando en variedad de oficios los cuales le han permitido mantener a su familia ella sola. Actualmente Feliciana ha comprado dos motocarros y un triciclo, los cuales alquila por día obteniendo muy buenos ingresos económicos. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que reparar muchas veces las averías que ocasionan los jóvenes que alquilan sus motos y su triciclo, ya que algunos suelen ser irresponsables no los cuidan. Feliciana se enteró de los préstamos de Microfinanzas Prisma y accedió a uno, y es su primera experiencia en un banco comunal, además se ha comprometido a ser muy puntual en los pagos. Ella con el dinero solicitado refaccionará sus motocarros y triciclo, si es posible comprará un triciclo más para aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Feliciana is 28 years old, lives at her family's house with her children: Melisa-13 years old, Monica-6 years old and Victor Raul-4 years old. Her partner abandoned them. She is a hard working woman and entirely dedicates herself to her activity. Being unable to get access to secondary education, she has worked since early age, doing a variety of trades that had allowed her to sustain her family by herself.

At the present time, Feliciana has bought two motocars and a tricycle which she rents on a daily basis getting very good earnings. The most difficult part of her job is repairing the damages that the drivers that rent her motos and tricycle caused. Some of them are not very responsible and don't take good care of them.

Feliciana learned about the Microfinanzas Prisma loans and applied for one. It is her first experience with a communal bank and she has committed to be on time with the payments. With the money that she is asking for, she will repair her motocars and tricycle and if possible, she will buy another tricycle to increase her earnings more.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing her motocars and possibly buying another tricycle.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina tiene 40 años, vive con su hijo Damián de 16 años de edad en su casa hecha de adobe. Desde hace un años se dedica a la venta de CDs en el mercado Pedro Vilcapaza de la ciudad de Juliaca, donde tiene un pequeño puesto, el cual es muy concurrido, ya que Agustina siempre tiene novedades de películas, series y videos musicales.
