Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede pasársela viendo películas, y así puede recomendarlas a sus clientes, ofreciendo una mejor atención. Aun así existen inconvenientes en el trabajo, en su caso es tener que viajar a otras ciudades para traer estrenos y novedades a la ciudad de Juliaca, pero ella quiere progresar y ese deseo es mucho más fuerte que esos pequeños inconvenientes. Agustina se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma y promete ser muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado viajará a las ciudades de Tacna y Cuzco para traer más mercadería para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Agustina is 40 years old and lives with her son, Damian who is 16 years old. They live in a house made out of adobe. For many years, she has been selling CDs at the Pedro Vilcapaza market in the city of Juliaca where she has a small but frequently visited stall. Agustina always have the latest novelties in movies, series and musical videos. What she likes about her job is that she can be watching movies most of the time and can make recommendations for her customers, offering them a better service. It may sound like fun but there are still inconveniences at her job, on her case is traveling to other cities to bring the latest novelties to the city of Juliaca. She wants to progress and that wish is much more stronger than the small inconveniences.

Agustina is having her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and promises to be on time with the payments. With the money, she will travel to the cities of Tacna and Cuzco to bring more merchandise to increase her sales.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 40 años, está separada de su pareja, tiene dos hijos José Luis de 17 años y Edson de 10 con los cuales vive en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a brindar servicio de limpieza en el hospital de la ciudad de Juliaca, “Essalud”, el cual debe mantener muy limpio, ya que lo requiere siendo una institución dedicada a la salud, ella sabe de la importancia de ello y pone mucho empeño en hacer bien su trabajo, lo bueno es que gracias a él puede mantener a sus hijos, ya que tiene que enfrentarse sola a la vida y sacarlos adelante. Aún así Yolanda quiere progresar y poner un negocio alterno para generarse mayores ingresos es por eso que recurre a nuestra ayuda y solicita este crédito, que es el primero que tiene con MFP.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 40 years, separated from her partner, has two sons: Jose Luis -17 years old and Edson-10 years old. She lives with them at her parents' home. She provides cleaning services at the hospital in the city of Juliaca,"Essalud". She has to keep it very clean because it is a requirement being a health institution. She knows about its importance and puts a lot of effort on doing her job very well. Thanks to her job, she can provide to her sons since she has to face life on her own and help them to become good citizens. Yolanda wants to progress by establishing an alternate business to increase her income that is why she is asking for our help. She is asking for this loan which is her first with MFP.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Starting capital for a new business

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: Reina tiene 32 años, está separada de su pareja, vive con su hijo Alex de 7 años en la casa de unos familiares. Se dedica desde hace 4 años al negocio del servicio de lavandería para mantener a su pequeño hijo debido a que debe hacerlo sola. La jornada diaria de Reina empieza desde las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 6 de la tarde, realiza el lavado de las prendas del centro de salud de la ciudad de Juliaca, las cuales debe mantener limpias durante todo el día como es necesario en un hospital, es así que luego de su trabajo regresa muy cansada, pero felizmente la remuneración es buena, dándole esperanzas a Reina de un futuro mejor. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma, el dinero solicitado le servirá de capital para un nuevo negocio que pueda desarrollar paralelo a su labor diaria.
texts.en:
Reina is 32 years old, is separated from her partner, and lives with her 7-year-old son in a multi-family house. She has been running a laundry service for 4 years, in order to provide for her young son, which she must do alone. Reina's daily routine starts at 6 in the morning and ends at 6 in the evening, since laundering clothing is at the center of health in the city of Juliaca, and clothing should be kept clean all day, as is necessary in a hospital. Because of this, her work makes her very tired, but, happily, the reward is good, giving hope to Reina for a better future. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and the money from the loan will serve as capital for a new business, which she can develop parallel to her daily work.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital for a new business

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 22 años, vive con su pareja Oscar de 26 años de edad el cual es obrero y trabaja en construcción. Ella se dedica a la venta de regalos para matrimonios, cumpleaños, etc, en la ciudad de Puno, desde hace 7 años, pero hace dos que por fin pudo poner su negocio propio, donde hoy en día trabaja arduamente. A Olga le gusta su trabajo, ya que gracias a él se siente una mujer independiente que apoya a su esposo a forjar una familia y brindarles lo mejor a sus futuros  hijos que es lo que más le gustaría. Lamentablemente en el trabajo siempre hay inconvenientes y en el caso de Olga a veces por la fragilidad de algunos artículos llegan a romperse y esto afecta al negocio, pero ella ha aprendido a ser muy cuidadosa y sabe que tendrá éxito en su trabajo  el cual espera sea mucho más grande en el futuro. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma y se compromete a ser muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería y así espera hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Olga is 22 years old, and lives with her 26-year-old partner Oscar, who is a laborer and works in construction. She has been selling gifts for weddings, birthdays, etc. in the city of Puno for 7 years, but two years ago she was able to start her own business, where she now works arduously. Olga likes her work a lot, since she has it to thank for feeling like an independent woman who supports her husband and can create a family and give the best to her future children, which is what she would most like to do. Lamentably, in work there are always inconveniences and, in Olga's case, sometimes an item is broken because it is fragile, and this affects the business, but she has learned to be very cautious and knows that she will be successful in her work, which she hopes will be much larger in the future. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she commits to being very punctual in her payments. With the loan money she will buy a larger quantity of merchandise, and with it she hopes to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing amount of merchandise

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 64 años, es viuda, vive con sus hijos Joel de 25 años y Justina de 35 años, la cual vive con su pareja. Se dedica a la venta de ropa que trae desde la ciudad de Lima para vender en la ciudad de Puno desde hace un año, tiempo en el cual sus ventas han mejorado de sobremanera debido a la variedad de prendas que trae Carmen son muy cotizadas en las “Galerías Plaza” que es donde está ubicado su stand. A Carmen siempre le ha gustado el comercio, después de que quedó viuda se ha dedicado íntegramente a este para olvidar sus penas, poniéndole mucho empeño en sacarlo adelante, lo más difícil es el batallar sola frente a todos los problemas que se le presentan, ya que sus hijos son mayores y viven sus propias vidas y aunque su apoyo es incondicional, no es lo mismo que compartirlo con tu pareja a la cual ella extraña mucho. Carmen se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma y promete ser muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de ropa para vender en al ciudad de Puno.
texts.en:
Carmen is 64 years old, is a widow, and lives with her children Joel, 25, and Justina, 35, who lives with her husband. She sells clothing that she brings from the city of Lima in order to sell in the city of Puno. She has been doing this for a year, in which time her sales have improved exceedingly, due to the variety of clothes that Carmen offers being very popular in the "Plaza Galeria" that is her stand is in. Carmen has always liked retail, and after she became a widow she has been wholly dedicated to it, in order to forget her grief, making her very determined to get ahead. The most difficult thing is to face all of the problems that face her alone, since her chlidren are older and live their own lives. And although their support is unconditional, it's just not the same as sharing it with your husband, whom she misses a lot. Carmen meets you with her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and promises to be very punctual with her payments. With the loan money she will buy a larger quantity of clothes to sell in the city of Puno.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing amount of merchandise

loans.name: Amor Y Caridad Group

texts.es: el grupo Amor y Caridad tiene como coordinadora a la Sra. Xiomara D. de 43 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboracion de tortillas y tiene la ayuda de su hija, esta actividad la realiza hace varios años, el cual ha sido el medio para poder darle sustento a su familia, brindarles educacion y procesos de salud, tambien junto a ella la Sra. Ma S. de 59 años de edad quien lucha junto a su hija quien tiene un hijo el cual no recibe ayuda de su padre y le toca trabajar moliendo harina de maiz para elaborar tortillas, ella tiene de moler mas de 20 años, tambien junto a ellas se encuentra la Sra. Aura M. de 47 años de edad quien tambien se dedica a la elaboracion de tortillas junto a sus dos hijas, negocio con el cual les brinda educacion y alimentacion, ella tambien tiene el apoyo de su esposo, tambien con ellas esta la Sra. Maria A. de 55 años de edad quien tambien se dedica al rubro de moler maiz para elaborar tortillas ella tiene la ayuda de su hija por las mañanas ya que en la tarde ella asiste al colegio, ella tiene diabetes, el estatus de vida de este grupo es de perfil pobre y solicitan credito para poder mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group "Love and Caring" has, as coordinator, Mrs. Xiomara D., 43 years old. She makes tortillas, and, with the help of her daughter, this activity has been, for many years, the means of providing for her family, giving them an education and health care. Also involved is Mrs. Ma S., 59 years old, who works together with her daughter, who has a son and doesn't get help from his father. She processes corn meal in order to make tortillas, she has been doing this for more than 20 years. Also involved is Mrs. Aura M., 47, who also makes tortillas with her two daughters, a business with which she gives her daughters education and food, she also the help of her husband. Also with them is Mrs. Maria A., 55 years old, who also processes corn for tortilla-making, with the help of her daughter in the morning, since in the afternoon she attends school. She has diabetes. The status of life of this group is in a poor state and they ask for credit in order to be able to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for tortilla production

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amigas Inseparables Group

texts.es:
el grupo Amigas Inseparables esta formado por 3 mujeres las cuales son muy luchadoras y les gusta bastante su trabajo, dichas pequeñas empresas que ellas tienen de produccion de tortillas son las que les han proporcionado el alimento y estudios a sus hijos, ellas estan muy felices de tener una pequeña empresa de la cual pueden sacar ganancias y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
el grupo se forma de la siguiente manera:
Sonia F. es la coordinadora del grupo y ella se dedica a la venta de maiz ya sea por libra o por quintales, esta actividad es muy lucrativa ya que de este producto se fabrican las tortillas que es una comida muy apetecida por nuestra poblacion, con este tipo de alimento se acompañan los tres tiempos de comida (desayuno, almuerzo y cena).
La Sra. Vera H.: ella se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, gracias a su negocio ella ha podido salir adelante.
Mayra L.: tambien ella se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, y tambien recibe ayuda de su esposo para sustentar su hogar.
todas ellas necesitan un credito para salir adelante con sus negocios ya que la situacion que esta pasando el pais es muy critica y necesitan poder reforzar sus negocios comprando mas materiales de produccion.
texts.en:
The group Amigas Inseparables ("Inseparable Friends) is formed by 3 hard working women that love their work very much. The small enterprises that they have which are dedicated to produce tortillas are the ones that provide them with the food and education for their children. They are very happy to have their small businesses which allow them an income to live and improve the quality of their lives. The group is formed by: Sonia F. who is the coordinator. She is dedicated to sell corn by the pound or by 100 pounds (quintal). This activity is very lucrative since from this product tortillas are made. This is a staple food in our diet and is very important for our people because with it, we accompany our three daily meals (breakfast, lunch, and dinner). Mrs. Vera H. is the one that is the dedicated to making and selling tortillas. Thanks to her business, she has been able to move ahead. Mayra L.: she also is dedicated to make and sell tortillas and also gets help from her husband to provide her home. All of them need a loan to move ahead with their businesses since the situation that their country is going through is critical and they need to boost their businesses by buying more materials for production.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn and materials to make tortillas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lelane

texts.en: Mrs. Lelane B., 41 years old, married and lives at San Vicente, Dapitan City. She has 5 children and 2 of them are in school. Her husband is a mere laborer. In order to help her husband,she decided to sell basic commodities in front of their house displayed in a table. This thing was materialized because of Paglaum Cooperative who have helped her in terms of financial assistance. She joined the cooperative last April 2008. She is happy enough knowing that aside from availing loan, she was able to save part of her income. Now, she applies PhP7,000 to buy goods or commodities for her sari-sari store. Hopefully this year, she will be able to build a store, so she can comfortably display her merchandise. She also wanted to see her children finish their studies and obtain successful careers in the future.

loans.use: to buy basic commodities for her sari-sari store

location.town: San Vicente, Dapitan City,Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, proviene de la comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene cuatro hijos, no posee estudios.
Trabaja desde hace un año y medio con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio de Restaurante; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, que los utilizó en comprar algunos enseres y materiales para su negocio (platos, cubiertos, etc.).
Con este préstamo de S/. 1700.00 Nuevos soles, para poder ampliar su negocio y poder adquirir mas cosas para su restaurante tales como: Ollas, utensilios de cocina, una nueva cocina a gas, mesas, sillas, platos, etc. Ello le permitirá obtener mejores ingresos principalmente en la época escolar; de esta manera podrá solventar los gastos en los estudios de sus hijos y en su hogar, finalmente agradece a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo y se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Sacuyo Community Bank, and lives in the community of Sacuyo, in the district of Acora, in the Province and Department of Puno. She is 49 years old, married, and has four children. She has not completed higher studies. She owns a restaurant, and has worked for the past year and a half with the Manuela Ramos organization. She used her first loan of S/. 500.00 nuevos soles to buy some equipment and materials for her business, such as plates, cutlery etc. With this loan of S/. 1700.00 nuevos soles, she will be able to expand her business and acquire more things for her restaurant, such as pots, kitchen utensils, a new gas kitchen, tables, chairs, plates etc. This will allow her to earn a greater income, principally during the school year. In this way she will be able to cover the cost of her children's studies and the household expenses. She is thankful for the support offered by Manuela Ramos, and is committed to punctually repaying the loan in three monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase items for her restaurant

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La señora Nicolasa es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, en el sector Totornasa, comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; de  43 años de edad, tiene dos  hijos, es casada y posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja hace un año medio con el Movimiento Manuela R. su primer préstamo fue  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra y venta de ganado engorde, también vende queso, y se siente contenta porque le permitió comprar materiales para la compra de queso.
Con este prestamo de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles podra ampliar su negocio, invirtiendo en  la compra y venta de ganado (vacuno, porcino y entre otros), además ella desea invertir en materiales para la elaboración de queso (moldes de queso, prensadora, y comprar mas litros de leche), de esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la economía de su familia; asimismo se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is a member of the “Sacuyo” cooperative bank in the Totornasa section of the Sacuyo community, located in the province of Puno. She is 43 years old, has two children, is married, and completed her primary school education. For the past year, she has worked with the Manuela R. movement. Her first loan was for 500.00 Peruvian soles which she invested into the purchase of livestock to fatten. She also sells cheese, and feels very content because the loan helped her buy her product. With this loan of 1,200.00 Peruvian soles she will be able to expand her business, investing in the purchase and sale of livestock (cows and pigs, among others). In addition, she would like to invest in materials to make cheese (molds, a press, liters of milk). This will allow her to better contribute financially toward supporting her family. Likewise, she commits to paying her loan punctually in three monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase and sale of livestock (cows and pigs, among others), and she also wishes to invest in materials for making cheese (molds, a press, and liters of milk).  In this manner, she will be able to better contribute toward supporting her family.

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
La señora Rina es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, en la comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 40 años de edad, estado civil casada y esta al cuidado de tres hijos, posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace un año medio con el Movimiento Manuela R., posee un negocio de engorde de ganado; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que compro en la alimentación de su ganado para engordarlo y luego venderlo.
Ella desea obtener un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de semillas (alfalfa, cebada y otros),  para engorde ganado vacunos; por ello viene solicitando un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, asimismo ella agradece a Manuela R. por su apoyo, ya que le permitió mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar y ayudar a la educación de sus hijos que es lo más importante para ella, finalmente se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rina is a member of the “Sacuyo” cooperative bank located in the Sacuyo community, Puno province. She is 40 years old, married, cares for three children and completed her primary school education. She has been working with the Manuela R. movement for the past 1½ years. She has a business raising livestock. Her first loan was for 500.00 Peruvian soles, an amount she used to buy feed to fatten her animals so she could later sell them. She hopes to receive a new loan to invest into purchasing seed (alfalfa and barley, among other varieties) to fatten her livestock. For this reason, she is requesting a new loan of 500.00 Peruvian soles. She thanks Manuela R. for its support as it has permitted her to improve her standard of living and, most importantly to her, educate her children. Lastly, she commits to paying her loan punctually in three monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seed (alfalfa and barley, among other varieties) to fatten her livestock.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, en la comunidad D. Sacuyo, distrito D. Acora, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 64 años D. edad, es casada y tiene siete hijos, posee estudios D. primaria completa.
Trabaja un año medio con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio D. engorD. D. ganado; su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la alimentación que es la base para realizar el engorD. D. los animales.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, capital para poder invertir en la compra D. semillas D. alfalfa, cebada, asimismo ella desea que se brinD. capacitaciones para poder invertir mejor el dinero prestado y producir ganado D. mayor peso y mejor calidad, y esto le permitirá mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su hogar y ayudar a la educación D. sus hijos y su nieto,que es lo más importante para ella, finalmente se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a member of the "Sacuyo" Community Bank in the community of Sacuyo, Acora district, Puno province, Puno Department. She is 64 years old, is married and has seven children who have completed their primary school education. For a year and a half, she has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement. She owns a business fattening livestock. Her first loan was for S. 500.00, an amount invested in feed which is necessary in order to fatten the animals. This loan of S. 500.00 will enable her to invest in the purchase of alfalfa and barley seeds. Additionally, she wishes that she is provided with training so she may invest the loaned money better and produce heavier and better quality livestock. This will allow her to improve her home's quality of life and help educate her children and her grandchild who is most important to her. Finally, she promises to repay the loan punctually in three monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds (alfalfa, barley) to fatten her cattle.

loans.name: Sahorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sahorn R. is a villager in Trapaing Ktom village, Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She is a successful pig breeder and wants to expand her business.  Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more piglets and pig feed. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Roeung Pho, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a construction worker. Mrs. Sahorn R. is 31 years old and the mother of two children who attend the local school. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Mr. Channy P. is a villager in Teuk Long village, Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Chhoeun Sreymom, sells firewood. Even though they work hard, they do not earn enough income to provide a better life for their family, which includes two young children.

In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Channy P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. His wife is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov H. is a villager in Tuol Vihear village in Kampong Speu province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. 

Her husband, Mr. Mom Lang, is a construction foreman. In his business, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy construction supplies to support his business. Thus, Mrs. Pov H. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. 

Mrs. Pov H. is 34 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to support the business.

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
Mr. Yeng Y. is a villager in Taing Banteay village in Kampong Speu. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Hong Noeum, is a healer. 

They do not earn enough income to support their household. Thus, Mr. Yeng Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. 

He is 39 years old and the father of two children who are attending the local school. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Nai

texts.en:
Mrs. Nai S. is a villager in Yous Cho village in Kampong Speu province. She sells medical supplies and owns a pharmacy in the local market.

Her husband, Mr. Seim Lan, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. He faces a problem because he usually pays a lot of money for plowing in his field. Thus, Mrs. Nai S. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox to reduce their expenses. 

She is 52 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy an ox to plow the field.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey K. is a villager in Pen Sam Ath village in Kampong Speu province. She and her husband, Mr. Horn Heng, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Even though they try to work hard, they still can not provide a better life for their family. 

Thus, Mrs. Srey K. decided to request a loan to add to her savings to buy equipment to build a house for her family. She is 43 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy equipment to build a house for her family.

loans.name: Thun

texts.en:
K. was born in 1981 in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She currently wholesales different kinds of vegetables like morning glories, cabbages, etc, and started the business more than eight years. She normally collects vegetables from farmers and transport them by taxi to sell at the Poypet Market. For another income, she also is a local rice farmer.

She is married to Veun Vong, aged 30, who is a motorbike taxi driver. The couple has no children. K.'s investment is going well and it is a profitable investment, which motivates her to continue working. In order to make the investment more successful, she is asking for a loan of $1000 to buy more vegetables for sale and to do rice farming.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for sale and to do rice farming

loans.name: Nak

texts.en:
Mrs. Nak P. is a villager in Tompong village in Kampong Speu province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Tem Vibol, sells firewood that he has bought from the other villages to resell. 

Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Nak P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more firewood for her husband's business. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. 

She is 28 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopha N. is a group leader of five who all live in Chrouy Dang village in Kandal province. She is a dessert seller. She is a 51-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is employed by the CMAC organization, while another helps in her business and the third is attending the local school. 

Mrs. Sopha N. is requesting a loan to dig a well for her family for personal use.

loans.use: To dig a well for her family for personal use.

loans.name: Pach

texts.en:
Mrs. Pach N. is a villager in Chrouy Dang village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Samrith Houch, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. They earn less income than they need to provide a better life for their family. 

Thus, Mrs. Pach N. decided to ask for a loan to better build the staircase of her house. She is 60 years old and the mother of eight children; seven children are employed in different positions while the other is attending the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To build the staircase of her house better.

loans.name: Oem

texts.en:
P. lives in Banteay Meanchey Province in Cambodia. He is 51 years old and sells jars from home. The jars are made from cements. He usually sells them to wholesalers who order a few days or a week in advance, and he can make around $8 a day from his investment.

P. is married to Mrs. Lon, 56, who works with him in making jars and also is a good housewife that cooks delicious meals for family. The couple has six children; four of them are married, and the other two are single and also assist their parents in making jars.

P. is applying for a loan to buy a motorbike and a trailer and use them to transport jars to sell directly at clients' houses. The remaining loan money will be used to buy rice to store and re-sell for profit.

P.'s wife is pictured, because he was not available for photographing.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and a trailer

loans.name: Mrs. Ouk Sorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-two people living in Srey Snom village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. All the members are shown in the picture, though some are blocked.

Mrs. Ouk S., the 43-year-old village bank president, is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more vegetables to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions. 

Her husband, Mr. Thy Chhum, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Ouk S. has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other three are attending the local school and the remaining child is too young to work or study. 

Eight members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Sam Ann Yem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-three people living in Srey Snom village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. 

Mrs. Sam Ann Y., the 37-year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to hire laborers to harvest rice on her field. She has decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. 

Her husband, Mr. Phan Vy, is a farmer who helps her. Mrs. Sam Ann Y. has four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another helps on the plantation and the others are enrolled in the local school. 

Nine members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest rice on her field.

loans.name: Teu

texts.en:
Mr. Teu P. is a villager in Thmey village in Kampong Speu province. He is a blacksmith. 

In his business, he faces an obstacle because his motor does not work. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to repair his motor. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions with this loan. 

His wife, Mrs. Men Pao, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Teu P. is 38 years old and the father of three children who are attending the local school. His wife is with him in the picture.

loans.use: To repair his motor.

loans.name: Yong

texts.en:
Mrs. Yong K. is a farmer in Kbal Chin village in Kampong Speu province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She is a 60-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a tailor while the other is attending the local school. 

Mrs. Yong K. is requesting a loan to buy cloth for her first child's business. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy cloth for her child's business.

loans.name: Min

texts.en:
M. was born in 1954 and currently lives in Banteay Meanchey Province of Cambodia, where she owns a plantation growing variety of fruits. She will sell her fruits to market sellers in 4 or 5 months after planting them.

She now has five children, three of whom are single and the other two are married. Two of her children (one daughter and one son) are employed; her daughter is a English teacher and her son is a motorcycle repairer. Her husband is a domestic veterinarian.

In order to reduce the cost of transportation, Mrs. M. has applied for a loan of $1000 to purchase a new motorcycle to use for family riding.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to use for family riding

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Mom Soeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of 18 members, is located in Kokor Pir village in Kampong Cham province. The members plan to use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Srey Mom S. is the village bank president. She was selected by the members. She is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is going well, she wants to expand by purchasing more piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family. Her husband, Mr. Heng Hay, is a coconut seller. Mrs. Srey Mom S. is a 38-year-old mother of a child who is too young to work or study.   

Nine members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Mrs. Yoeun Ros Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-four people living in Trakuon village in Kampong Cham province comprise this village bank, and they will use the loan for various purposes. 

Mrs. Yoeun R., the 49-year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. On this plantation, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to grow vegetables. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. 

Her husband, Mr. Sun Ann, is a farmer who helps on her plantation. Mrs. Yoeun R. has six children, four of whom are employed in the garment factory, while another is a comedian and the last is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Poum

texts.en:
P. is 33 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He is a domestic ox trader who buys oxen from far-away places to fatten them for a while and re-sell them for a profit. As another income, he also sells wood carvings out of his house. He can make around $8 each day from his investments, and has been involved in this since 2000.

He is a very responsible parent to his three children; all of them are teenagers and attend school. His wife's name is Nit Sinat, aged 35, and she is a vegetable grower and also a good housewife who cooks tasty meals and cares for the children.

As the oxen are P.'s most important way to earn money, he would like to ask for a loan as capital to purchase more oxen to raise for sale. P. was not available for photographing, so his wife's photo was taken instead.

loans.use: To purchase oxen to raise for sale

loans.name: Uktamjon

texts.en:
Uktamjon T. is 27 years old. He is married with two kids. He is an expert in computer services. He provides computer services such as: printing and scanning, lamination and audio-editing of video tapes and discs with records of family events of his clients. He has been in this business for 4 years already and has gained much experience.

Uktamjon tries to use modern up-to-date technologies in his work so as to satisfy the demands and requirements of his customers. For instance, now he is planning to purchase a new modern computer in order to improve the quality of his work and to expand the business. With this purpose in mind, Uktamjon is requesting 2500 Somoni for a term of 9 months. This is Uktamjon's first loan and he thanks all for support and promises not to let anyone down and to pay back the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing a new modern computer

loans.name: Phem

texts.en:
T. was born in 1968 and his wife's name is Yon, aged 48. They live together in Siem Reap Province. They make a living both by making Khmer noodles and raising pigs from home for sale. For another income, they are also rice cultivators.

The couple has five children; three of them are married and live away from the family home, and the other two are teenagers and go to school. They also assist their parents in making noodles when they are free.

In order to expand the investments and to reduce the cost of transportation, T. and Yon are asking for a loan to buy a second-hand motorbike, rice, and more piglets to supply their business activities. (Mr. T. is pictured)

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorbike, rice, and more piglets to supply their business activities.

loans.name: Kuon

texts.en:
Mr. K. lives in Siem Reap Province and is aged 49. He earns a living by working as an employed worker, carving firewood for a profit. His wife Mrs. Kimsal, 49, is a vegetable grower, as well as raising poultry from home for sale. They currently earn the amount of $4 a day to sustain their daily expenses. Together have three children, all of whom are teenagers and attend school.

To increase their income, Mr. K. and his wife have decided to request a loan of $200 to purchase more poultry like chicks and ducks to raise for sale. (K.'s wife appears in the picture because he was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase more poultry like chicks and ducks to raise for sale.

loans.name: Mrs. Sun Sae Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank group consisting of 22 members is located in Trakuon village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.  Mrs. Sun S. was selected by the group members to be the village bank president. She is a housewife who wants to start a new business; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy bananas to resell in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Un Navy, is a musician who is hired by the villagers for wedding ceremonies, parties and S. on. Mrs. Sun S. is 63 years old and the mother of six children; two of them are employed in a garment factoR., two are security workers, and two are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables.  The remaining members of the group will use their portions of the loan for their own purposes.

loans.use: To buy bananas for resale.

loans.name: Yav

texts.en:
S., 28, lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia where she owns a plot of land in front of her house for growing crops. She currently grows both rice and vegetables. She is a good mother to three children, all three of whom are still young.

To help cover the family's food needs, her husband is employed as a firewood seller. He sells firewood that he buys from the people who cut it from the forest. Since firewood is their main source of income, S. is asking for a loan for her husband to use as capital to buy more firewood to store for sale.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to store to sell

loans.name: Oteka

texts.en:
Oteka D. is 26 years old. She is married and has a child. Oteka’s business is sewing traditional women’s dresses. Three years ago, she started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances. She conducts this work with only one sewing machine right now. She sells finished clothes in the market.

Fortunately, the good service that she offers and the good materials with which she works help her to make her small factory progress. Despite her young age, Oteka already has apprentices at her tailoring shop. As a result of the large quantity of orders, she needs to acquire another machine so she may satisfy the orders. For that reason in mind, she is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni for a term of 10 months to buy a sewing machine. With your help, Oteka can grow her business and improve her family’s quality of life. She thanks you for your trust and support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Repairs on sewing workshop and purchasing a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda F. is 48 years old. She is separated from her husband and has two children. She began her business to keep herself busy and active when she found herself sad and depressed due to her separation, as well as in order to have an independent income. That is why her business is the main source of income for her family.

Mavluda has been running her own small business for 15 years. She rents a store in the local market for selling candies and different kinds of sweets. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. Mavluda is very friendly and polite which allows her to have a larger clientele. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 Somoni. She is planning to spend the loan in purchasing more goods to sell thus increasing the range of her goods so as to be able to provide for her children's needs and their school fees. Mavluda promises to repay her loan within 8 months and thanks everybody who decides to support her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing goods to increase her stock

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en:
Mavlyuda H. is 43 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. Mavlyuda's lack of a stable job and the low productivity of her husband's business didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the home and of her little daughter. This was the reason why Mavlyuda decided to start her own business 10 years ago, selling fabrics for traditional dresses. Little by little she has made her business grow, and by offering her clients the chance to pay in installments, her orders are getting bigger.

Now her business is running normally. However, she would like to continue bettering herself and her business. She is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni that she will pay back in 10 months. With this money, Mavlyuda will be able to buy seasonal fabrics for national dresses. The power to help her business grow is in your hands.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics to  increase the range of her goods

loans.name: Sabohatkhon

texts.en:
Sabohatkhon M. is 24 years old. She is married and has a child. Since she was a young girl, Sabohatkhon used to help her mother with her clothing sales business. Four years ago, Sabohatkhon began selling towels and blankets, since her husband’s income as a taxi driver was not enough to cover their family expenses. That was how she got a taste of the business and was convinced that it left her sufficient revenue.

Currently, she works in this business full-time, and thanks to her enthusiasm, she has made a name for herself in the market. However, her clients request more and more things each day, which is why Sabohatkhon is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni, which she is willing to repay in a 10-month term. With this money, Sabohatkhon will be able to purchase more towels and blankets and thereby give her business a boost.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.
