To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing towels and different kinds of blankets to increase the range of her goods

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Soung R., a 47-year-old resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, currently makes a living selling from her home a variety of groceries including cooked ingredients, canned food, plastic goods, and sweets for childR.. She also provides the national lottery service for a commission.

Soung is married and has two childR., both married and employed, one as a pig raiser and the other as a wine distiller and grocer, while her husband is a local vegetable grower. Soung's business is doing very well, so she is requesting a loan to buy more groceries in order to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Marua N., age 41, is married with three children ages 19, 13 and 8. She sells cold drinks. She started this business in 2002 and works daily from 8am until midnight. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$ 349.

This will be Marua’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first three loans to increase the stock of the drinks she sells, pay school fees as well, and she has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to increase her stock further, pay school fees, and to save the rest.

Marua will share this loan with subgroup C of the Mapatano Group. The subgroup has 4 members, who sell drinks, bites, clothes, and are food vendors. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Marua is second from left.

loans.use: To increase her stock, pay school fees, and save the rest

loans.name: Trab

texts.en:
Mr. T., born in 1978 and currently living in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, earns a living as a local building worker, making on average $3 per day, to help feed the family. Married to Hak Ly, 26, who cultivates rice and raises pigs, the couple is responsible for two young children, both attending school.

To earn additional income and enhance the success of his wife’s business, Mr. T. is requesting a $300 loan to purchase piglets to raise and rice to store for later sale, as well as some ingredients for distilling wine.

T.'s wife is pictured, as T. was unavailable.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Oimtillo

texts.ru:
Музафарова Оимтилло   1954 года рождения. После смерти мужа она осталась с ребенком. Начала  бизнес как продавщица у своей знакомой, которая продавала женские сумочки. Набрав опыта в продажи, изучая востребованность рынка, решила открыть свой бизнес. Вот уже 4 года  торгует на рынке "Ганчина " города Душанбе. Ее ассортимент товаров состоит из женских и мужских пуловер, мужских сорочек, детской одежды и женских сумочек. У нее есть постоянные клиенты. Закупает она товар в оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе.
Оимтилло хочет получить займ в сумме 3500 сомони и увеличить оборотный капитал.
texts.en:
Oimtillo Muzafarova was born in 1954. She was left with a child after her husband's death. She started her business as a salesperson at her friend's stall where she sold women's purses. As she gained experience in retail and learned the trends of the market, she decided to open her own business. It has been four years since she started selling on the Ganchina market in Dushanbe. Her inventory consists of womens and mens pullovers, mens shirts, children's clothing and womens purses. She has many regular clients. She buys the merchandise in the wholesale market Korvon in Dushanbe.

Oimtillo wants to get a loan for 3500 somoni (USD$975) to increase her working capital.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mens shirts

loans.name: Sak

texts.en: Mrs. Sak H. is a villager in Chhoer Teal village, Kandal province, Cambodia. She and her husband, Mr. Hing Vet, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate vegetables. Their field is infertile and Mrs. Sak H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her soil more productive. She is 38 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom attend the local school while the last is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru:
Сониева Махфират Исламовна родилась 1966 году. После развода с мужем осталась с 3 -мя детьми. У нее особое направление в бизнесе. Приготовление и продажа пищи. Этим делом она занимается 6 лет. Она взяла в аренду маленькое помещение в городе Душанбе, где, наняв работников, ведет свою предпринимательскую деятельность. В продаже все виды национальных блюд и кое-что из европейской кухни. Там у нее можно вкусно пообедать, выпить прохладительных напитков, покушать фруктов и овощей или просто посидеть с друзьями. 
  Узнав, о программе Кива она захотела участвовать. Махфират хочет получить займ в сумме 3500 сомони сроком на 4 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahfirat Islamovna S. was born in 1966. After the divorce with her husband she was left with three children. She has a unique direction in business which is food preparation and sale. She has been doing this for six years. She rented out a small place in Dushanbe where she hired employees and runs her business. She offers all kinds of national Tajik dishes as well as some European cuisine. One can enjoy a delicious meal at Mahfirat's place, drink cold beverages, eat some fruits and vegetables and spend some time with friends.

When she found out about Kiva she wanted to participate. Mahfirat wants to get a loan for 3500 somoni (USD$975) for a four months term.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wants to buy fixtures - shelves, cabinets and drawers

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Mrs. Sem P. was born in 1954 and she now lives in Choerng Prey village, Kandal province, Cambodia. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fruits to sell. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family. Mrs. Sem P. is a widow with one child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Ziragul

texts.ru:
Сафарова Зирагул Файзовна, 1977 года рождения, не замужем. Начала свой бизнес с продажи детской одежды. У нее 7 лет опыта в этой деятельности. Она торгует на рынке «Хайр» Вахдатского района. Последние два года она занимается продажей платков.  У нее в ассортименте летние и зимние платки, красивые шарфы, шали. У Зирагул есть постоянные клиенты, которые, приходя к ней, хотят видеть новые товары. Она постоянно обновляет свой товар, чтоб не потерять постоянных клиентов. Покупает свой товар на оптовом рынке Корвон.
Зирагул хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 2000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ziragul Fayzovna S. was born in 1977 and is unmarried. She started out selling children's clothing, and she has seven years experience doing so. She trades at the Hayr market in Vahdat region. However, for the past two years Ziragul has sold scarves. She has a wide assortment of summer and winter headscarves, beautiful neck scarves and shawls. Ziragul has regular customers who come to her wanting to see what's new. She is continually updating her inventory in order to keep her regular customers. She buys her goods at the Korvon wholesale market. With the assistance of the Kiva program, Ziragul would like to take out a 6-month loan in the amount of 2000 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of scarves

loans.name: Proeng

texts.en: Mrs. Proeng S. is a 62-year-old widow who lives in Choer Teal village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she grows vegetables. She faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer to support her field, so she has decided to ask for a loan. Mrs. Proeng S. has two children. One child repairs motorbikes. The other is a farmer who helps his mother in her work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her field.

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Esther J. age 42 is married with three children ages 23, 14 and 10. She owns a genge  (fruits and vegetable stand). She started this business in 2005 and works daily from 8am until 6pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $175. 

This will be Esther’s fouth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the three previous loans to increase the stock of her genge and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to expand her genge by purchasing more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Esther will share this loan with subgroup A of the Mapatano group. The subgroup has 8 members, who run shops, grocery, hardware, sell clothes and are photographers. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Esther in 1st on the right front row.

loans.use: To increase on her genge (fruits and vegetable stand).

loans.name: Oeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeung S. is a villager in Roka village in Kandal province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store in the village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries for her business. 

Her husband, Mr. Mon Sam Ath, is a construction worker. Mrs. Oeung S. has seven children. One child is a construction worker, two other stay at home to do housework, two attend the local school, and the remaining two are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her business.

loans.name: Dilbarniso

texts.ru:
Халимова Дилбарнисо Самандаровна, 1984 года рождения, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Чтобы пополнить семейный бюджет дополнительным доходом решила заняться предпринимательской деятельностью. Она арендовала торговую точку на рынке «Хайр», города Вахдат, для продажи женской одежды. Наращивая свой опыт предпринимателя, вырученные деньги с бизнеса, пускала в оборот. Данный момент в продаже имеются подарочные платки, разнообразные шали и шарфы.  Свои товары Дилбарнисо закупает на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. В этом бизнесе у нее 6 лет опыта.
 Для увеличения ассортимента хочет участвовать в программе «Кива» и получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони для увеличения товаров.
texts.en:
Dilbarniso Samandarovna H., born in 1984, is married and the mother of two children. Dilbarniso went into business in order to supplement her family income, and she rents a stall in Bahdat's Hayr city market in order to sell women's clothing. Building on her experience as an entrepreneur, she plows money back into the business. At the moment she has headscarves, neck scarves and shawls for sale as gifts. Dilbarniso purchases her goods at the Korvon wholesale market in the city of Dushanbe. She has six years of experience in this endeavor. To increase the range of goods in her inventory, she wants to participate in Kiva's program and to take out a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni in order to purchase good.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of scarves

loans.name: Chak

texts.en:
Chak L., a 44-year-old resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, has four children, two single and two married. All of her children are employed, while her husband, Mr. Son, 48, makes a living as a local carpenter constructing furniture for sale. Mrs. L. currently raises pigs, distills Khmer wine for sale, and grows rice.

Mrs. L. is asking for a loan for her husband to buy more pieces of wood and other materials for his carpentry business. The family believes that the loan will help them increase their income to better sustain the family.

loans.use: To buy more pieces of wood and other materials for her husband's carpentry business.

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Mr. Phen S. is a villager in Roka village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he grows rice. His wife, Mrs. Pao Nim, is a pig breeder. Even though they try to work hard, they earn less income than they need to support their household. 

They want to start a new business using rice to make the wine to sell. Thus, Mr. Phen S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice and wine making supplies to make the wine. He hopes to increase his income and improve their living conditions. 

He is 59 years old and the father of five children. One child is employed in garment factory, two ohters help the parents with their work, and the remaining two attend the local school. His wife is presented with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more rice and wine making supplies

loans.name: Mealea

texts.en:
Mrs. Mealea M. is a villager in Chhoer Teal Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Say Vuthy, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow both rice and vegetables. They face a problem because the soil on their field is infertile and is damaging their crops. Thus, Mrs. Mealea M. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more fertilizer to support the field and to make her crops more productive. 

She is 36 years old and the mother of three children. Two children are enrolled in the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer to support her field and to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Bunthat

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthat C. lives in Preak Doung Village in Kandal Province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he grows rice and vegetables. He faces an obstacle because his field is infertile and insects have damaged his crops.

His wife, Mrs. Ya Chan Noeun, sells vegetables in the local market. Mr. Bunthat C. is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to support his field. He will use the rest of loan to buy more vegetables for his wife's business. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. 

He is 42 years old and the father of three children who attend the local school. His wife is presented with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to support his field.

loans.name: Isiaka

texts.en: Isiaka B. is 60 years old and married with nine children. He lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. He produces and sells palm kernel oil. He needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase additional palm kernel to produce more oil to sell. He is incredibly  grateful to everyone that has made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernel oil to sell

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn P. was born in 1962. She now lives in Choerng Prey Bey village in Kandal province. She is a fruit seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she has decided to ask a loan to purchase more fruit to resell. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family.

Her husband, Mr. Phorn Chork, helps with his wife's business. Mrs. Thorn P. has four children.Two children are employed in a garment factory. The others attend the local school. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthorn N. lives in Preak Traeng Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Nal Phun, are fruit sellers. Because their business is going well, they want to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Chanthorn N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan. 

She is 32 years old and the mother of three children. Two of her children are enrolled in the local school. The youngest child is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to resell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Saven

texts.en:
Mrs. Saven V. lives in Dey Eth Kos Phos Village in Kandal Province. She sells Khmer cake. Her husband, Mr. Sam Mao, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows vegetables. He faces an obstacle because his field is infertile and insects have damaged his crops.

To deal with these problems, Mrs. Saven V. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support her field and make her crops more productive. She is 41 years old and the mother of three children who attend the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to support her field and make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Ayomi

texts.en: Ayoni E. is 60 years old and married with five children. She produces and sells palm kernel oil. She has been in this business for nine years. She needs a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more palm kernel to produce more poil to sell. She says thanks to all who have made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernel to produce palm kernel oil to sell

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheak N. is a villager in Preak Svay Village in Kandal Province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Leng Malin, repairs TVs and VCDs. Because he does not have enough money to buy TV and VCD supplies, Mrs. Sopheak N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy the supplies for her husband's business. 

She hopes to increase their income and provide a better life for their family. She is 24 years old and the mother of three children. One child attends the local school. The other two are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy TV and VCD supplies

loans.name: Cheourn

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheourn N. is a villager in Porpeal Khae Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she grows rice to earn a living. She now faces a small problem because the soil in her field is infertile soil and is damaging her crops. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Cheourn N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her field. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel for the pump that waters her field. 

Her husband, Mr. Uon Arn, helps her on her farm. Mrs. Cheourn N. is 58 years old and the mother of six children. Four of her children are employed by different businesses. The others attend the local school. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel for her water pump

loans.name: Koun

texts.en:
Koun S., 69, pictured with his two daughters, is a widower who lives with his three children in the Kampong Cham province. 
He grows rice and is able to make US$1.5 everyday and is aided by his daughters who work as a grocery seller and a rice farmer. Both of them make a combined income of around US$10 profit a day. 
All of Koun S.’s children are married but still live with him. Koun S. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 for his daughter to expand her grocery store by adding more products to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To expand grocery store

loans.name: Spean

texts.en:
Spean L., 50, of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, makes a living selling various products from her home including vegetables, fruits, and groceries. She is the widowed mother of four children, three married and one single, the latter assisting her in her business.

L. hopes to improve her investment and so is requesting a $500 loan from HKL. The loan will be used to buy additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Dun

texts.en:
Dun N., 49, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. 
Since 2005, she and her husband have been selling soup from their home to earn a living and are able to make about US$7 per day. They are supported by two of their children working as electricians. This couple together have three children. 
Mrs. Dun N. would like to take out a loan of US$800 to expand her small shop selling soup.

loans.use: To expand her shop selling soup.

loans.name: Mrs. Phan Pen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan P. is the leader of a group of six entrepreneurs who live in Tareab Duonsar Village in Kandal Province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. 

Her husband, Mr. Pum Ly, is a construction worker. He now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy construction supplies for his business. Thus, Mrs. Phan P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy construction supplies for her husband's business. 

She is 38 years old and the mother of five children. Four of her children attend the local school. The youngest is just one year old.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for her husband's business.

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
Chhorn K. is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two young children in the Kampong Cham province. 
She sells various kinds of vegetables in the market and is able to make about US$8 in revenue each day. Her husband operates a moto-taxi, earning approximately US$2 of profit a day. 
Mrs. Chhorn K. would like to request a loan of $1000 to expand her vegetable stand by increasing the amount of produce to meet her clients' demands.
(Mrs. K. is pictured with her husband and young child)

loans.use: To increase the amount of produce to sell in her vegetable stand.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim S., 24, is married and lives with her husband and young child in the Kampong Cham province. 
Since 2006, she has been raising ducks for eggs to earn a living and is able to make $8 everyday, while her husband has a business selling soil. He digs the land and transports it to sell at construction sites. On average, he makes $3 of profit a day. 
Lim S. is asking a loan of $1000 to expand her livestock by raising more ducks and to purchase a stock of gas (fuel) to refill her husband’s truck.

loans.use: To breed more ducks and purchase gas (fuel).

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov S. is married and sells vegetables in a busy market earning around $2 of profit each day. 
She is 47 years old and lives with her husband and six of her children in the Kampong Cham province. Her husband is a security guard in the market and makes $8 a day. Four of their children are vegetable vendors like their mother and one is a student. 
Mrs. Nov S. would like to take out a loan to expand her vegetable stand by increasing her stock.
Nov S. is pictured with her husband.

loans.use: To expand the vegetable stand and increase stock.

loans.name: Eang

texts.en: Eang H., 44, is married and lives with her husband in the province of Kampong Cham. She grows and sells rice to earn a living and is able to make about $4 every day. Her husband owns a grinding machine and uses it to provide a service to the local farmers. On average, he makes around $1.50 per day. This couple together has three children, one of whom is a garment factory worker. Eang H. would like to take out a loan to purchase a truck to transport the grinding machine from house to house, and invest in a new business of selling wood.

loans.use: To purchase truck and sell wood.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Yi N., 44, is married and lives with her husband in the province of Kampong Cham. She works growing rice, which she has done since 1987, and is able to make around $2 each day, while her husband works digging pump wells in the village to earn approximately $6 every day. This couple together has six children, one of whom is a garment factory worker and four of whom are students. Mrs. Yi N. would like to take out a loan to purchase more tools for her husband to dig wells.

loans.use: To purchase digging tools (to dig wells).

loans.name: Lina's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lina Y. is the leader of a group of four entrepreneurs who live in Sdao Kanlaeng Village in Kandal Province. She sells vegetables in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy vegetables to resell.  

Her husband, Mr. P. Laveng, is employed in a garment factory, and he also can make a little salary to support the family. Mrs. Lina Y. is 27 years old and the mother of two children. One child is enrolled in the local school. Her other child is just five years old.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Асакалов Джамшед Булбулович  - предприниматель. Ему  33 года  и у него 2 детей. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность он начал в 2002 году с небольшого количества мужской одежды. Данный момент он торгует фруктами на оптовом рынке "Станция" города Вахдат. У него много клиентов. Каждый день с ближайших районов приезжают клиенты, чтоб закупит у него товар. В ее ассортименте разные сорта яблок, груш, мандаринов, апельсинов и лимон. 
Для увеличения ассортимента и товарооборота, то есть хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев
texts.en:
Jamshed Bulbulovich A. is a businessman. He is 33 years old and has two children. He started his business in 2002 with a small amount of mens clothing. At this time he sells fruits on the wholesale market Stantsiya (Station) in the town of Vahdat. He has many customers. Every day a lot of customers come from the nearby regions to buy his goods. In his assortment there are different varieties of apples, pears, mandarins, oranges and lemons. To increase the assortment and circulation of goods he wants to get a loan for 2000 somoni (USD$550) for a 6 months term.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits

loans.name: Krin

texts.en: Krin V. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. One child is at home, two are in school, and two others are employed as garment factory workers. Krin makes her living by raising pigs and selling them to the market, and earns around $1.50 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer and contributes his entire income to the household every day. Krin V. hopes to use this loan to expand her livestock by adding more pigs.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Abdusaid

texts.ru: Хафизов Абдусаид Шукурович 1958 года рождения. Живет с женой и 3 детьми в селе.  Два года назад он начал свое дело в сфере животноводства. Он откармливает скот и продает. Ему иногда помогает жена. Для покупки еще одного теленка ей нужны дополнительные средства. Он купит телят, чтоб откормить ее и продать по выгодной цене. Абдусаид  хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони сроком на 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdusaid Shukurovich Hafizov was born in 1958. He lives in a village with his wife and three children. Two years ago he started his own business in the field of animal husbandry. He breeds and resells cattle. Sometimes his wife helps him. He needs additional financing to buy another calf. He buys calves, then feeds and grows them and then resells at a better price. Abdusaid wants to take part in the Kiva program and get a loan for 3000 somoni (USD$825) for an eight month term.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four people led by Mrs. S., who was born in 1962 and has been making brooms for more than two years from her home. Daily, she normally makes about 10 or 15 brooms which she sells to villagers and the market seller.

She is the mother of four children, two of whom are employed; all are single. Her husband, Nary, 50, is a local fisherman who currently catches fish from Tunle Sap Lake and sells them at the market. His ability to catch fish has recently been compromised due to aging equipment, so Mrs. S. is requesting a loan to buy more fishing tools.

The other three borrowers are: P., a fisherman who needs a loan to buy nets and traps; P., a fisherwoman who is requesting a loan to purchase fishing tools; R., a fisherwoman who is requesting a loan to buy additional fishing equipment. The borrowers all live in Chong Kneas Commune in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy more fishing equipment.

loans.name: Choun

texts.en: Choun L., 45, lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She is the mother of two children. L. sells roasted duck at the local market. Her business typically generates about US$ 5.50 in revenue per day. Two of her children are students and sometime help her in selling. Her husband, pictured here, stays at home raising pigs and is able to make US$ 2 each day. Choun L. hopes to use this loan to expand her husband's livestock by adding more pigs. The rest is to be used to increase the number of roasted ducks for sale.

loans.use: Selling roasted duck and raising pigs

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba’s principal occupation is the cultivation and production of vegetables. She is an excellent and admirable farmer who received from her husband the techniques and secrets of this beautiful activity, skills that have allowed her to develop multiple agricultural capabilities and have especially granted her the possibility of maintaining her loving family in these times of numerous financial problems.

Nasiba has two children who have been her aid in the most difficult moments of her life and are her principal motivation to progress. For this reason, she wishes to contribute to the dreams of each one of her children by furnishing their small home in the best way possible in order to open a small store there to cover her household’s expenses.

Nasiba requests your help in the form of a loan that will allow her to obtain greater revenues this year for the purpose of reaching each one of her goals. She is asking a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 11 months in order to purchase the seeds and mineral fertilizer, to be able to sow corn, and also with part of the loan she wants to buy cattle. Nasiba expresses her gratitude to everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this group of four entrepreneurs is Mrs. Chanthy K.. All of the members live in Sdao Kanlaeng Village in Kandal Province. 

Mrs. Chanthy K. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she grows rice. She faces a small problem because the soil in her field is infertile and is damaging her crops, so Mrs. Chanthy K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her field and to make her crop more productive. 

Her husband, Mr. Khav Narin, helps her on her farm. Mrs. Chanthy K. is 29 years old and the mother of a six-month-old child.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field and make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Koem

texts.en: Koem L., 43, is a widow living in the Kampong Cham province with her two children. One child is at home and one is in school. She has had a business selling noodles and porridge in the village since 1999 to earn a living and is able to make US$ 10 in revenue each day. L. is asking for a loan of US$ 800 to purchase utensils and reinvest in her business to attract more customers.

loans.use: To purchase utensils

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru:
Шарипова Гулрухсор Саидовна родилась в 1984 году. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Одна из преуспевающих микропредпринимателей в районе Вахдат. Начала свой бизнес с торговли национальных платьев. Она у себя дома шьет национальные платья и продает их на рынке «Хайр» города Вахдат. В ее ассортименте товара, также имеются мужские чапаны(национальное пальто). Для сырья, некоторые комплектующие ее продукта, и некоторые готовые изделия в качестве ассортимента Гулрухсор покупает на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. 
Хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев для увеличения оборотного капитала.
texts.en:
Gulruhsor Saidovna S. was born in 1984. She is married and has two children. She is one of the successful micro entrepreneurs in the Vahdat region. She started her business with selling national Tajik dresses. She makes these dresses at home and then sells them on the Hayr market in the town of Vahdat. In her inventory there are also mens national coats. She buys raw materials and other supplies as well as ready-made goods to add variety to her inventory on the Korvon market in Dushanbe. Gulruhsor wants to get a loan for 2000 somoni (USD$550) for a six month term to increase her working capital.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials, threads and furniture

loans.name: Begmurat

texts.en:
Begmurat D. is 30 years old. He is married with 3 children. Begmurat is an optimistic, hard-working father. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. Begmurat has been in agro-business for more than 7 years. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city.

Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time-taking job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. With this purpose he is requesting a loan of 1200 USD which he has committed to repay within 11 months. With the desire to realize his plan, Begmurat appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en: Khoem N., 52, is a widow and has a business purchasing and re-selling rice in the village. On average, she makes  approximately US$ 20 in revenue per day and is aided in supporting the family by one of her daughters who works as a garment factory worker. To make more money, she is requesting a loan to purchase more rice for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for re-sale

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Yun S., 26, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store, and typically makes about US$ 2 every day, while her husband, Mex Chongheng, 34, pictured here, is a professional tailor. He earns on average about US$ 2 a day. This couple has two children, one of whom is a student. Yun S. is asking for a loan to add her grocery’s inventory.

loans.use: to add her grocery’s inventory

loans.name: Abdurazzok

texts.en:
Abdurazzok S. is 43 years old. He is married and has three children. Abdurazzok has a middle special education. His specialization is accounting. But he went over to agro-business because the salary was small. And with that small salary he has to feed his family and pay for his children’s education.

Abdurazzok works hard to cultivate his produce such as wheat, onions, carrots, and other vegetables. He works from early morning till late at night, hoping to have a rich harvest. Abdurazzok sells his produce in the market where it is always in high demand due to its good quality. He also raises cattle.

His works fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and grow his business. Today Abdurazzok is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for a term of 11 months to buy greater quantities of fertilizer and also calves. Let's help Abdurazzok as he works hard to improve the quality of life for his family!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer and calves

loans.name: Mrs. Malen Phoung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan, which consists of twenty-four members, is located in Preak Traeng village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Malen P. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Song Sun, are vegetable farmers who own a hectar to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this farming, they face a problem because they do not have enough vegetable seeds to grow, so Mrs. Malen P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetable seeds for cultivation. She hopes to increase her revenue and support the family well. Mrs. Malen P. is 29 years old and the mother of two children, who are at home because they are too young to work or study. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more vegetable seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael I. is 31 years old and married with one child. She lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. She sells rechargeable phone cards. She started this business in 2007. She would like to expand this business. She needs the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thank you to everyone that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom S. is a villager in Sdao Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Yun Yoeurn, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, they face a problem because their field is infertile soil, so Mrs. Sokhom S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive, and she will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel to support the pump to water the crop. Mrs. Sokhom S. is 29 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the others are too young to work or study because they are four and five years old. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Kholmurat

texts.en:
Kholmurat A. is 43 years old. He is married with four children. Kholmurat is raising and selling cattle. He purchases calves in the central market, feeds them well, and then re-sells them at higher prices in the local market. Being in this business for 5 years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up early every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them.

His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate stable and considerable income for his large family. Currently, Kholmurat is planning to expand his business and to purchase cattle. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 2500 Somoni for the term of 11 months. You could become an important part in Kholmurat family's life; he deeply appreciates the trust and support you give him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves to expand his business

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en: Sourn S. is 64 years old and works with her husband growing rice and vegetables. She is the mother of four children and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. One of her children is a student and three are professional tailors. Sourn S. is asking for a loan to purchase a sewing machine for her children to operate a tailor shop.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria E. is 42 years old and married with two children. Her eldest child is 25 and her youngest child is18 and attends the University of Ibadan. She sells clothes, bags and rechargeable phone cards. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase additional clothes and bags to sell. Victoria says thank you to everyone that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and bags to sell

loans.name: Tith

texts.en: Tith S., 40 years old, is a true entrepreneur who has business selling various kinds of fruit in a busy market. She lives with her husband and children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. As a fruit seller, S. can typically make about US$ 10 per day, while her husband works as a policeman and can make about US$ 8 per day. With the loan, the family hopes to buy more fruit in order to expand the family business. In the future, S. hopes to further expand the business and also to send her three children to university.

loans.use: To expand her fruit stand

loans.name: Gulmat

texts.en:
Gulmat R. is 40 years old. He is married with 2 children. From the time he was young, Gulmat was learning to work in a small business with his parents. With a lot of sacrifice, he became a main producer in agriculture in the area where he lived. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progressing more and more.

With the income he was able to open a dispensary in his house and also raise cattle successfully. His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children, hoping to see them as professionals, ethical and hard-working. For this reason he is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni for the term of 11 months. He wants this loan to buy livestock, as raising and selling animals generates an excellent profit margin. Be an important part of the growth of Gulmat’s business!

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Sou C. works selling lotus at a busy market and is able to make US$ 7 every day. He lives with his wife, Bak Leakena, pictured here, who has a business selling various kinds of fruit in the same market. On average, she makes around US$ 5 per day. This couple has five children. Sou C. is asking for a loan to expand his wife's fruit stand and increase the number of lotus he has for sale.

loans.use: To expand fruit stand and increase the number of lotus he has for sale

loans.name: Munisuishola

texts.en: Y. Munisuishola is 56 years old and married with four children. She lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. Y. sells frozen foods and plastics. She hopes to expand his business. She needs a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase additional frozen foods to increase output. She says thank you to everyone that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Turakul

texts.en:
Turakul D. is 47 years old. He learned his profession of farming from his father when he was young. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progressing more and more. In addition, he also buys and sells cattle to raise more profit.

With his previous loans, he purchased two more cattle. He sold them already and purchased two calves which he is rearing to sell. Today he wants to expand his business and buy more cattle and fertilizer for his land. He is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni which he promising to repay within 8 months. From the profit of his business Turakul wants educate his children at the university. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is 57 years old and married with six children. She sells plastics like plates, bowls, and cups at Oge market in Ibadan, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase additional plastics to sell. She says thank you to everyone that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sorphorn Chhearn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people who all live in Tep Archun village in Kandal province make up the village bank, and they will use the loan that they obtain for different purposes. Mrs. Sorphorn C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members, and she is a farmer who grows corn on a small piece of land. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because she does not have any animals to plow the field, so she decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field for cultivaT. corn. Her husband, Mr. Nheob Leang, helps her in the plantation. Mrs. Sorphorn C. is 34 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. 

This is a village bank loan consisT. of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field for cultivating corn.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima K. is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of 6 children. Since she was very young, Salima worked on a small farm, and now, along with her children she works cultivating wheat, corn, and vegetables. When their crop comes in, they transport it to the capital for sale. This activity has helped to pay the economic expenses of her family and give an education to her children.

Today she needs a loan to prepare her land for the upcoming season. With this desire in mind, she asks your consideration to receive her family in your kind heart. She requests 2500 Somoni for the term of 8 months. Salima wants to thank everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Morm S. is 35 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She raises and sells cows, making around $5 per day, while her husband works to supplement the family’s income as a policeman. He earns $5 a day as well. S. would like to take out a loan to purchase more cows for sale.

loans.use: To purchase cows.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Shaidullo

texts.en:
“Responsible fatherhood” is a term that has been converted into concrete fact in Shaidullo’s life. He has always responded satisfactorily to his role as provider for his five children, for whom he cares with much love, in the company of his wife, who is always supportive of him.

Shaidullo works in agricultural activities and has some cattle. He cultivates potatoes, onions, carrots, and other vegetables, subject to the season. At the moment, he is working intensively at his agricultural activities and taking care of his fields. His wife is helping take care of the cows and also sells their milk. They do all this hard work because they want to give an education to each of their two children. They would also like to open a small business some day; until then they will continue working in their fields.

To do this, Shaidullo is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni for the term of 8 months to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. Let’s support Shaidullo in his continuous efforts to provide for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Try

texts.en: Try R., 54, is married with four children and lives in Kampong Cham province. She works grinding and selling rice, making around US$6 each day. Her husband works as a staff member in an organization and is able to generate US$5 each day. Try R. is asking for a loan to purchase rice. She will purchase rice, take off the husks, and resell the rice to turn over a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice and grind for resale.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Mrs. Sareth Sem Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan, which consists of fourteen people, is located in Tep Archun village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sareth S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She owns a small store where she sells fruits and cakes. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit and cake to re-sell. She hopes to increase her income while she is using this loan. She is a 46-yE.-old widow with two children, one of whom is a laborer, while the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fruit and cake to re-sell.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo S. is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She is a good housewife who lives at home doing housework and cooking for her family members. Her husband, Phorn Vannak, is a construction foreman and eventually he makes $6 a day. This couple has two school-aged children. Keo S. is asking for a loan to purchase construction tools for her husband, and the rest will be used to make repairs to their leaking roof.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools and repair leaking roof.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Yokub

texts.en:
Yokub T. is 50 years old. He is married with 3 children. Yokub is an optimistic, hard-working father. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. Yokub has been in agro-business for more than 8 years. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city.

Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time-consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix up his house and save enough money for the future weddings of his children. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni which he has committed to repay within 8 months. With the desire to realize his plan, Yokub appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution! More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men S. K., 35, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband work collecting palm juice, refining it to sugar, and then selling it to the market to earn approximately US$5 every day. This couple together has two school-aged children.

Men S. K. would like to take out a loan to purchase farmland to grow rice for additional profits that she will use to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase farmland to grow rice.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Som S., 41, is married with two children and resides in the province of Kampong Cham. She runs a grocery store from her home and is able to make $8 in revenue every day. Her husband is a policeman and makes $5 per day. Mrs. Som S. would like to take out a loan to expand her grocery store by adding more products to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Mrs. Srorn Chhay  Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank, which is located in Tep Archun village in Kandal province, consists of fourteen people, and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Srorn C. is the village bank president. She is a grocer in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. She hopes to increase her income in order to provide a better life for the family. She is a 38-year-old widow with a child who is enrolled in the local school. Mrs. Kong Don, who is a group guarantor, is also presented in the picture with the village bank members.

loans.use: To ask loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun S. A., 40, is married and lives in the province of Kampong Cham. She grows and sells yams to earn a living , something she has done since 2007, and is able to make $1.50 a day. She lives with her husband, four children and her parents. Her husband is a blacksmith and makes about $4 each day. Sun is asking for a loan to purchase more steel for her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase steel for her husband's blacksmith business.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Moa Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan, which consists of seventeen people, is located in Tep Archun village in Kandal province, and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Mom M. is the village bank president. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Aside from this business, she is a farmer who cultivates rice on a 1-hectar field. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough rice seeds to cultivate, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds to deal with her problem. Her husband, Mr. Phin Meng, is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Mom M. is 36 years old and the mother of two children who are all attendI. the local school. Mrs. Koe Sovannary and Mrs. C. Sotheary who are group guarantors are also shown in the picture with the village bank loan members.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy rice seeds to deal with her problem.

loans.name: Jimoh

texts.en: Jimoh A. is 42 years old and married with four children. Jimoh sells building materials. He is a hardworking man and hopes to pull his family out of poverty. He needs a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. He is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthy Seoun Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nineteen people who all live in Tep Archun village in Kandal province make up the village bank loan. Mrs. Chanthy S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Chhoeurn Sovann, are vegetable sellers in the local market. Aside from this business, they are farmers who grow corn on a small plot of land. In this farming, they now face a small problem because they do not have enough money to buy corn seeds to cultivate. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Chanthy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy corn seeds. She is 44 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a laborer, while the remaining two are attending the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy corn seeds for her purpose.

loans.name: Olayinka

texts.en: Olayinka A. is 41 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a commercial driver. They live in Ibadan, Nigeria. Olayinka sells ground nut oil in wholesale and retail and she hopes to expand her business. She would like a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase additional groundnut oil to sell. She says thank you to everyone that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more ground nut oil to sell

loans.name: Fatimo

texts.en: Fatimo L. is 52 years old and married with four children. Fatimo lives in Bodija, Ibadan, Nigeria. She sells provisions like noodles, bathing soap, detergents, toothbrush, etc. She hopes to expand her business. She needs a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Azamat

texts.en:
Azamat is a responsible family man and father who cares for his family with great attention. He comes from an agricultural family and today it is these activities which provide a major source of income which allows him to support his 3 sons.

Azamat has a friendly family who always try to help each other. In the picture you can see his sons, as Azamat himself was absent from his home. His dream is to see his sons succeed and it is in order to achieve this that his efforts know no limit. In this case, his wish is to improve his seeding and to care for his animals, for which he needs a loan. Your help is very important for this hard-working and humble worker!
