With this seventh loan she plans to buy, 50kg. of fresh fish, packages of Attieke (cassava root), 100kg. of potatoes, 20kg. of beef, bananas, plantains (Aloko), etc. She buys her merchandise in the market and resells it for cash or credit to a clientele made up of young single people, mostly hourly workers whose buildings are not far from the market.She expects to earn a monthly profit of 200,000 FCFA which will be used for personal expenses, contribute to family expenses, loan payments, and investment in her business.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish, packages of Attieke (cassava root), potatoes, beef, bananas, plantains (Aloko) etc.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Cette dame réside dans le quartier de totsi où elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale, elle  n’a jamais demandé de crédit à wages et demande son premier crédit d’un montant de 300000F pour l’achat des produits d’alimentation générale (lait, sucre, boîte de conserve de sardines etc…).elle a besoin d’acheter des marchandises pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle est mariée et à 04 enfants, son mari est un géomètre.
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Totsi district, where she sells foodstuffs. She has never had a loan from WAGES; she is requesting her first-ever loan in the amount of 300,000 F to be used to purchase foodstuffs (milk, sugar, tinned foods including sardines, etc.). She needs to buy this merchandise to satisfy the demand of her clientele. She is married with 4 children, and her husband is a land surveyor.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Kalifa

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Kalifa T. a 25 ans, célibataire et père d’un garçon, il réside dans la grande famille traditionnelle avec ses parents et ses cadets à Kaboïla II, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur T. est un électricien de profession et en parallèle avec sa profession, il mène l’activité d’achat-vente des appareils  électroniques (TV,Minie Chaîne, DVD, etc) à Mancourani I où se situe son atélier. Il mène cette activité depuis maintenant trois (03) ans.
 Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant six (06) mois avec laquelle elle est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Monsieur T. vend ses appareil dans son atélier de réparation à ses clients composés généralement de ceux qui sollicitent ses services.
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter 1  TV, 2 Minies Chaînes, 3 DVD, 5 battéries, etc. Il s’approvisionne au Ghana avant de les revendre sur place.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Kalifa T., age 25, is unmarried and the father of a boy. He resides in a large traditional family with his parents and younger siblings in Kaboïla II, Sikasso’s downtown (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He is an electrician by trade, and concurrent to this, he does commerce in electronic equipment (TV, Minie Chaîne, DVD, etc.) in Mancourani I, where his workshop is located. He has been in this commerce for three years now.

To satisfy his burgeoning customer base, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso six months ago and is on his first individual loan. He sells equipment in his repair shop generally to people who ask for his services. With this initial loan, he plans to buy a TV, two Minies Chaînes, three DVD, five batteries, etc. He gets his supplies in Ghana and resells them locally. He envisions realizing a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase his working capital, to help with family expenses, and to pay the loan interest.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electronic equipment (TV,Mine Chaîne, DVD, etc).

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es pequeña agricultora y productora de leche de vaca, que  comercializa a PIL (Planta industrializados de leche) de donde recibe un pago cada quince días, siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos. Tiene su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad Villandrani Provincia Los Andes a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la construcción de establo para las vacas lecheras; de esa forma podrá cuidar adecuadamente sus ganados que son su fuente de ingreso.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del prestamos solicitado.
texts.en:
Virginia is a small farmer and producer of cow's milk, which she sells to PIL (a dairy processing plant) who pay her every fifteen days. This activity is her main source of income with which she covers the expenses of her three children. She owns her own home located in the Villandrani neighborhood in the Los Andes province, two hours from the city of La Paz. The loan proceeds will go towards the construction of a stable for her dairy cows; this way she will be able to properly take care of her livestock which are the source of her income. This is her first loan with Impro, the credit evaluation qualifies her to be approved for the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a stable for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Douglas Anastasio

texts.es: El Sr., Douglas tiene un negocio de un pequeño comedor donde ofrece ricas fritanga, refrescos a si como  alquiler de teléfono desde hace siete años ha estado en las ventas, su esposa le apoya día a día para salir adelante y mejorar  sus vida en lo personal, como en el negocio, Don Douglas tiene 37 años de edad, reside en Villa Alemania de los semáforos Iván Montenegro 4 cuadras al sur, en la capital de Managua, le tiene una niña de 13 años de edad que ya va al colegio, el cual desea apoyar con sus estudio para que tenga un futuro mejor. Este es su primer crédito en Afodenic el cual esta motivado ya que espera poder con este crédito invertir en granos básicos, carnes y otros productos para incrementar sus ventas y promocionar nuevos y ricos platillos que espera sea de mucho beneficios, para seguir trabajando. Sus planes a corto plazo es poder comprar sillas de plástico y mesa para dar mejor servicios a sus clientes, y mejorar el ambiente.
texts.en:
Douglas has a small restaurant where he offers delicious fried foods and soft drinks and he also rents a telephone. He has had this business for seven years. His wife helps him everyday to get ahead and improve their personal lives and the business. Douglas is 37 years old and lives in Villa Alemania, four blocks to the south of the traffic lights on Iván Montenegro, in the capital, Managua. He has a 13 year old daughter who attends high school. He wants to continue to support her in her studies so that she can have a better future. This is his first loan with Afodenic. He hopes to use it to buy basic grains, meat, and other products in order to increase his sales and to promote new and delicious meals that he hopes will sell well, so that he can continue working. His short-term plans are to buy plastic chairs and a table in order to provide better service to his customers and to improve the ambience.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, vegetables, and meat so as to improve sales

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo trabaja de transportista; tiene una movilidad de servicio publico Taxi inter- ciudad La Paz El Alto, actividad que es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su hija. Viven su casa propia ubicada en la zona de Villa Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara al mantenimiento del motor (cambio de caja de cambios) para continuar trabajando con su herramienta de trabajo (Taxi).
 
Es el segundo crédito via Kiva, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle otro préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Guillermo works as a driver; he has a public service vehicle, Taxi, between the cities of La Paz and El Alto. This activity is his main source of income which cover the support of his daughter. He lives in his own home in the Villa Exaltacion zone of the city of EL Alto. The loan proceeds will be used for the maintenance of the vehicle motor (replacement of the gear box) which will allow him to continue using his main work tool (Taxi). This is his second loan through Kiva. His good credit record allows the approval of another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the gear box of his taxi.

loans.name: Lassina

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lassina O. a 35 ans, marié et père de trois (03) enfants, il réside avec sa famille à Wayerma II, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur O. a mené plusieurs activités sans succès. Il  opta finalement de s’initier et s’installer dans le domaine du commerce dont il dispose une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où il mène cette activité d’achat et vente des articles divers (Cigarette, bonbon, allumette, Chewing Gum, lait en poudre, Thé, sucre, savon, etc) il y a maintenant trois (03) ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité par sa clienèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant six (06) mois avec qui  il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Monsieur O. vend ses marchandises au comptant ou à crédits à une clientèle composée des voisins.
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter 3 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 2 carton du thé, 1 sac du sucre, 5 paquets de bonbon, 10 paquet de Chewing Gum, 30 paquets d’allumettes, 5 cartons de savon, etc. Il sapprovisionne auprès des commerçants grossistes de place avant de les revendre en détail.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Lassina O. is 35 years old, married and the father of three children. He lives with his family in Wayerma II, the main city in Sikasso (the third administrative region in the Republic of Mail).Mr. O. has attempted several business, without success. He finally established himself, three years ago, in commerce, by setting up a shop, in front of his house, where he buys and sells a variety of articles, namely cigarettes, candies, matches, chewing gum, powered milk, tea, soap, etc. He is widely sought out by his clients for the quality of his products. To meet the needs of his ever increasing clientele, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwasa microbank six months ago, and he is now requesting his first individual loan. Mr. O. sells his merchandise for cash or credit to a clientele made up mostly of neighbors. With his first loan he would like to buy 3 cases of a variety of cigarettes, 2 cartons of tea, 1sack of sugar, 5 packages of candies, 10 packages of chewing gum, 30 packages of matches, 5 cartons of soap, etc. He buys from wholesalers in the neighborhood before selling at retail. With this loan, he expects to earn a profit of 70,000 FCFA which he will use mainly to increase his business operating funds, contribute to family expenses and make loan payments.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of articles for resale ( cigarettes, candies, matches, chewing gum, powered milk, tea, sugar, soap, etc )

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
Aldo trabaja como chofer asalariado en el Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa de Trufi inter ciudad La Paz – El Alto. Esta actividad de chofer es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus seis hijos de 12, 10, 8, 6, 5, y 2 años de edad respectivamente. Vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinará para poder completar el monto que le falta para la compra una movilidad a medio uso y de esa forma trabajar como dueño de su propio taxi e incrementar sus ingresos familiares.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Aldo works as a driver in the Eduardo Avaroa de Trufi inter-city union of La Paz. His job as a driver is his principal means of income with which he covers the care of his six children of 12, 10, 8, 6, 5 and 2 years of age, respectively. He rents a house located in the Pasankeri zone of the city La Paz. He will use the loan money to be able to complete the amount he lacks to buy a car. Then he will be able to work as the owner of his own taxi and will allow him to increase his household income. This is his first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation has granted him the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a taxi to work as his own boss

loans.name: Naima

texts.en: Naima M. is married and an enterprising Tanzanian woman. She runs a salon and cosmetics shop at Temeke Mikoroshini in Dar es Salaam. In Dar es Salaam, the services and products provided by salon and cosmetic shops are in high demand, especially by women because of the hot temperatures. Naima M. sells the majority of her products and services Friday through Sunday. She purchases her products in Kariakoo where the big cosmetic shops are located. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000. ($450) to buy additional supplies to expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Bashiru

texts.en:
Bashiru T. is 35 years old. She is married with 4 children. She lives in Iba, Lagos state, Nigeria.

Bashiru has a multi-faceted business. She has two grinding machines that she uses to grind tomatoes, beans, pepper and corn. She also sells foodstuffs.

Bashiru is an LAPO client. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She wants to increase her business and thereby her profitability.

She says thank you to LAPO Microfinance and to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio es albañil, trabaja en la ciudad de El Alto y también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos para su posterior comercialización; esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con  que cubre la manutención de sus cuatro hijos y esposa. Tiene su casa propia ubicada en la zona peri urbana de la ciudad de El Alto, Zona San Felipe de Seke.

El crédito lo destinará para comprar crías de cerdo (cerdos recien nacidos) para su posterior comercialización y generar mayores ingresos económicos.
 
Es el Cuarto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite facilitarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Gregorio is a builder whow orks in the city of El Alto and he is also dedicated to raising pigs for later sale; this activity is his primary source of income with which he suports is four children and his wife. He has his own house located in the suburban zne of the city of El Alto, Zona San Felipe de Seke. This loan will be destined to buy piglets for his later sale and to generate better economic income. This is his fourth loan with Impro. His good payment behavior facilitates the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying piglets for his business

loans.name: Orlando Cornelio

texts.es: Don Orlando desde hace diesiciete años, ofrece sus servicios de sastre en su casa de habitación, adquirió conocimiento en trajes Gomes y trajes Guido en donde laboro por mucho años, lo cual permitió confeccionarse en su trabajo. Tiene 53 años de edad, reside en el barrio Omar Trajillos de enitel jardines de Veracruz ½ c abajo, su esposa le tiene dos hijos que estudian. Con este crédito es el segundo el cual va invertir, en materia prima como: telas, hilos, encajes y otros para realizar sus trabajo, que espera sea de mucho beneficios ya que va hacer para esta temporada de regreso a clase muchos uniformes que es lo que mas se vende, también a corto plazo es comprar otra maquina de coser industrial con mas puntadas para dar cada día mejor servicio y mejores modelos de vestir a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Orlando has been offering his services as a tailor from his home for the past 17 years. He learned this skill in Gomes Suits and Guido Suits, where he worked for many years and which allowed him to perfect his work. He is 53 years old, and lives in the Omar Trajillos neighborhood, ½ a block from Enitel in Jardines de Veracruz. His wife has two children who are studying. This is his second loan, which he will invest in raw materials, such as: fabrics, threads, laces, and other notions that he needs for his work. He hopes that he will be able to make good sales, as he is going to make a many school uniforms for the upcoming back-to-school season, since uniforms are what sell best. Also, in the short-term, he is going to buy an industrial sewing machine with more stitch styles so that he can provide better service and better models of clothing to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, threads, and lace in order to increase his clothing production

loans.name: Marietou

texts.fr:
Marietou T.  a 46 ans et vit dans une grande famille avec son époux et ses six (6) enfants (3 garçons et 3 filles) à Mancourani I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Marietou T. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente des  fruits (orange) il y a maintenant dix neuf (19) ans. Elle mène son activité au nouveau marche de Médine Sikasso. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant cinq (5) ans. Après 5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 7ème prêt individuel, tous ses prêts precedents ont ete correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 1 chargement de camion “10 tonne” d’orange. Elle s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso avant de les revendre en détail et en gros à une clientèle composée généralement des forains venant d’autres villes du pays mais d’ailleurs (DAKAR) en république sénégalaise.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Marietou T., age 46, lives in a large family with her husband and six children (three boys and three girls) in Mancourani I, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having done many kinds of work without success, she got started in this work buying and selling fruit (oranges) nine months ago. She works at the new marketplace of Médine Sikasso.

Concerned about doing better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago now. After five solidarity loans (group loans) in a women’s association in her district, she is on her seventh individual loan. All her preceding loans have been correctly repaid. She plans to use this loan to buy a 10-tonne truck-load of oranges. She gets her supplies in towns surrounding Sikasso and then resells them retail and wholesale to customers composed generally of market vendors from other cities in the country and elsewhere (DAKAR) in the Republic of Senegal.

With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her working capital, to help with family expenses, and to pay the loan interest.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit (oranges)

loans.name: Adijat

texts.en:
Adijat lives in Akesan, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 40 years old and married with 2 children.

Adijat runs a shop from her home where she sells drinks. This arrangement means she does not have to pay for shop rent. She opens her shop daily from 6am to 11pm.

She is a client of LAPO. She needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all who will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
Celso es una persona de la tercera edad y por esta condición no es considerado sujeto de crédito en otras instituciones; tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde trabaja con su esposa, de donde proviene su ingresos económicos para la manutención de sus dos hijos de 12,16 años de edad que dependen de la pareja, su domicilio esta  ubicado en la zona de los Andes de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería (arroz, azucar,harina, sodas, pan, etc.), de esa forma podrá surtir su tienda con diferentes productos para satisfacer a su clientela.
 
Es el cuarto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Celso is an older gentleman and, given his age, other institutions do not consider him credit-worthy. He has a general store where he works with his wife, generating income to support two children ages 12 and 16 who depend on the couple. Their home is located in the Los Andes zone of the city of El Alto. The loan would be used to purchase merchandise (rice, sugar, flour, sodas, bread, etc.), which will allow him to stock his store with different types of products to satisfy customer demand. This is his fourth loan with Impro. The good repayment history he demonstrated to our institution permits him access to another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar, flour, sodas, bread, etc. for his general store.

loans.name: Dele

texts.en:
Dele is 46 years old and married with 4 children.

She is a hairstylist who also sells weaveons and hair extensions. She hopes to expand this business. In order to do so, she needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more weaveons and hair extensions to sell. She hopes this will help to attract more customers to her shop.

Dele is a client of LAPO. She says thank you to all who will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more weavons and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Madame  Salimata T.  a 40 ans, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants (3 garçons et 1 fille) dans la grande famille traditionnelle à Fama, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Salimata T.   après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, cette brave femme s’est initiée à la fabrique des savons traditionnels (savons noirs) il y a maintenant cinq (05) ans qu’elle a appris auprès d’une voisine. Elle mène son activité dans son domicile de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée  pour la qualité de ses produits.
 Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant un (1) ans. Elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel, le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 6 futs des déchets d’huile de coton (pates noires) et 3 sacs de soude caustique. Après fabrication des savons à base de déchets d’huile de coton et de soude caustique, elle les revend en détail à une clientèe composée généralement des femmes de sa localité..
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Salimata T., age 40, resides with her husband and their children (three boys and one girl) in a large traditional family in Fama (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having done many kinds of work unsuccessfully, she got started making traditional soap (black soaps) five years ago from a neighbor who taught her. Ms. T. works in her home in Sikasso, where she is in high demand because of the quality of her products.

To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso a year ago. She is on her second individual loan. The preceding one was correctly repaid. She plans to use this loan to buy 6 barrels of waste cotton oil (black paste) and 3 sacks of caustic soda. After making the soap from the waste cotton oil and caustic soda, she resells it retail to customers composed generally of women in her town.

With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to help with family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make soap to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson trabaja como portero en la Federación de Lecheras de La Paz, tambien es pequeño microempresario y vende queso de leche; tiene una hija de 10 años y su esposa. La familia vive en su casa ubicada en la zona de 12 de octubre de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para incrementar su capital, comprar mayor cantidad de leche y producir mas quesos de esa forma podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite facilitarle otro préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Wilson works as a doorman at the Dairy Federation of La Paz, and is also a micro-entrepeneur who sells cheese. He is married and has a 10-year old daughter. The family lives in a home located in the 12th of October zone of the city of El Alto. The loan would be used to increase his working capital, to buy a greater quantity of milk, and produce more chees so he can meet the demand for his product at the market. This is his second loan with Impro. His good repayment history permits us to facilitate another loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk for his business making cheeses.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: El sr. Juan A. tiene 40 años de edad, reside en el barrio Hugo Chávez con su esposa y dos hijos de 17 y 5 años de edad que van al colegio. Su esposa le ayuda en su negocio, el tiene una micelania la cual con mucho esfuerzos ha podido sobresalir con sus ventas, y con ayuda de su esposa, son cinco años lo cual inicio con ahorros y préstamos que  han sido de mucho beneficios para mantener surtida su mecelania, con este es su sexto préstamo,  en donde va invertir en productos de consumos diarios para la demanda de sus clientes. Sus objetivos es hacer su negocio en distribuidora y poder tener mejores ingresos, para ayudar a sus hijos a terminar sus estudios, y tener un mejor patrimonio para su familia
texts.en:
Juan A. is 40 years old. He lives in the Hugo Chávez neighborhood with his wife and two children, who are 17 and 5 years old and are in school. His wife helps him with the business. He has a general store and with much effort he has been able to excel in sales. He began the business five years ago with savings and loans, which have been useful to keep the store well-stocked. This will be his sixth loan. He will invest it in basic goods of daily use, which is what his customers want to buy. His goal is to turn his business into a distributor and thereby have improved income, to help his children finish their studies, and to have a better financial future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic goods of daily use

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula estudia en la Universidad Nuestra Señora de La Paz; en sus tiempos libres vende perfumes y cosméticos, Su esposo es empleado de una clínica
Vive en la zona de Alto obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz, en la casa de sus abuelos.
El crédito será destinado para educación ( pago de matricula y mensualidades en la universidad para continuar sus estudios).
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Las ganas de superarse y el análisis de su flujo de caja le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Paula studies at Our Lady of La Paz University; in her free time, she sells perfumes and cosmetics. Her husband is employed at a clinic. She lives in the Alto Obrajes zone of the city of La Paz, in her grandparent’s house. The loan would be used for education (to pay for university tuition and monthly expenses to continue with her studies). This is the first time she requests a loan in Impro. Her desire to get ahead and the analysis of her cash flow give her the opportunity to access this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay tuition and monthly expenses for Our Lady of La Paz University, where she is studying.

loans.name: Adejoke

texts.en:
Adejoke is 30 years old. She is married with 2 children.

Adejoke is a fashion designer. She also sells tailoring materials. She owns 2 sewing machines.

Adejoke is a client of LAPO. She needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She is very happy with Kiva lenders and prays that God will continuously bless them.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Sanata

texts.fr:
Madame   Sanata T.  a 25 ans, elle réside avec son époux et leurs trois (3) enfants (1garçon et 2 filles) à Wayerma II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame  Sanata T. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente des  friperies et des vêtements.
Elle mène son activité au grand marche de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de quinze (15) ans. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel, tous correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 2 balles de friperie de qualités différentes 
(T-Shirt, chemises, napérons, serviettes, etc.). Elle achète ses marchandises sur place avec les grossistes avant de les revendre en détail.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Sanata T., age 25, resides with her husband and children (one boy and two girls) Wayerma II, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having done many kinds of work unsuccessfully, she got started buying and selling used clothing and such. She works at the grand marketplace of Sikasso, where she is in great demand because of the quality of her products.

To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso over fifteen year ago. After three solidarity loans (group loans) in a women’s association in her district, she is on her second individual loan. All preceding loans have been correctly repaid. She plans to use this loan to buy 2 bales of used goods (T-shirts, blouses, place mats, napkins, etc.) of different grades. She buys locally from wholesalers and then makes her sales at the retail level.

With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her working capital, to help with family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing and such

loans.name: G.s Reyna Group

texts.es:
El Grupo de Nombre G.S Reyna esta conformado por 2 personas con los siguientes nombres Doña Reyna Isabel S. O. y Luis Alberto M. su edad es de 78 años y su amiga Doña Reyna tiene la edad de 44 años, el estado civil de Doña Reyna es soltera y tiene 3 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 22 años de edad que trabaja por cuenta propia su hija de 20 años de edad y cursa el 5 año de secundaria y un niño de 18 años que cursa el 5 grado de primaria ya que estudia por la noche en el caso de su amigo Don Luis su estado civil es casado y tiene 5 hijos su hijo mayor de 40 años cursa el 2 año de secundaria y trabaja por cuenta propia su otro hijo de 38 años cursa el 3 año de secundaria su otro hijo de 32 años cursa el 5 año de secundaria su otra hija de 26 años cursa el 3 año de secundaria y su hijo menor de 26 año cursa el 4 año de secundaria todos están trabajando y estudiando ya que no tuvieron la oportunidad de estudiar y ahora quieren hacerlo, su esposa labora como ama de casa,  los propósitos de Don Luis son de mejorar su vivienda para su familia  en sus deseos esta el comprar una camioneta para darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes y vender mas leña su deseos son de mejorar su propiedad en cuanto a la construcción los propósitos de Doña Reyna son de mantener activo su negocio para que este le siga generando mas ingresos para su familia que lo necesita sus sueños son de  ampliar el negocio con tres trabajadoras que le ayuden y así ofrecerles mas productos a sus clientes en sus deseos esta el ser la propietaria del negocio mas productivo de la comunidad para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

La actividad económica de ambos es diferente Don Luis se dedica a la venta de leña y Doña Reyna es la venta y elaboración de tortillas, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación y el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 14 años, en cambio la ubicación del negocio de Don Luis es de manera ambulante y el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 15 años el inicia este negocio con otro tipo de negocio ya que al principio el contaba con 8 cerdos y mas tarde los vendió y  reunió el dinero para la  compra de un carretón y su caballo mas tarde uno de sus hijos le facilito el dinero que fue con el que inicio el negocio de leña cuando obtuvo las ganancias reunió el dinero nuevamente  de sus ganancias y le pago a su hijo y este negocio le gusto ya que le dejaba ingresos para su familia y además sus clientes le compraban lo suficiente en cambio su amiga Reyna inicio con dinero propio por lo que gano laborando como domestica y el negocio de la tortilla le gusto y así fue que decido mantener este negocio y las ganancias las ocupo para la inversión de su negocio  y es así como llega establecer su negocio en su casa de habitación el financiamiento que solicita Doña Reyna es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que realizar la compra de leña, maíz y cal por lo que el precio del maíz esta muy elevado en el caso de Don Luis el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y esta destinado para la compra de una motosierra ya que esta herramienta le facilitara el trabajo y también necesita darle mejoras a su carretón y las medicinas para su caballo que son necesarias para su negocio y necesita darle el medicamento.
texts.en:
The G.S. Reyna group consists of two members: Reyna Isabel S. and Luis Alberto M.. Luis is 78, and his friend Reyna is 44. Reyna is single and has 3 children: her oldest, 22, works for himself; her daughter, 20, is in her 5th year of high school; and her son, 18, is in the 5th grade of elementary school and works nights. Luis is married and has 5 children: his oldest, 40, is in his 2nd year of high school, and works for himself; his son, 38, is in his 3rd year of high school; another son, 32, is in his 5th year of high school; his daughter, 26, is in her 3rd year of high school; and his youngest son, 26, is in his 4th year of high school. All of Luis's children both work and study; they didn't have the opportunity to go to school before and now they want to. His wife is a homemaker. Luis's plans include improving his house for his family. He would like to buy a pickup truck so he can better serve his customers and sell more firewood. He would also like to upgrade his construction equipment. Rosa's goal is to keep her business active so she can continue to generate more income for her family. She would like to expand her business by hiring three women to help her out. She also wants to offer more products to her customers. Rosa wants to run a business that is more useful to her community so she can meet her customers' needs. Luis and Reyna are in different lines of work. Luis makes his living selling firewood, while Reyna makes and sells tortillas. She works from her home and has been in business for 14 years. Luis travels around, and has been in business for 15 years. He had started out in a different business: he had 8 pigs, which he later sold, and used the money to buy a horse and wagon. Later, one of his sons gave him the money to start his firewood business, and he paid his son back with his earnings. He liked this business since it gave him income for his family and his customers bought plenty from him. Reyna, on the other hand, started with her own money, which she earned working as a domestic. She liked her tortilla business and she decided to stay with it. She invested her earnings into her business, enabling her to start doing business from her home. Reyna is seeking a loan to use as working capital, as she has to buy firewood, corn, and lime, and the price of corn is very high. Luis is seeking a loan for working capital. He plans to use the money to buy a power saw, to make his work easier. He also needs to make improvements to his wagon and buy medicine for his horse. The horse and wagon are necessary for his business, and he has to give his horse medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin is 42 years old. She is married with 4 children.

Toyin has a unique business. She sells blocks of ice in the market. She has two deep freezers that can carry 75 pieces of ice blocks each.

Toyin is a client of LAPO. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase another deep freezer so she can increase the number of ice blocks she can sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy a third deep freezer

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabali (composé de 4femmes  mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans avec en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles résident dans le quartier  Babemba de la ville de sikasso.
Elles  exercent des activités commerciales différentes (vente de : condiments, chaussures, savons et friperie).
Elles collaborent avec  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  pour satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Les prêt précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 2 balles de friperie, 3 sacs de100kg de savons traditionnels (gros morceaux), 2 douzaines de paires de chaussures et 4paquets de condiments. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso et environnants..
Les produits sont vendus en détail et  au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso  et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 19 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Sabali are composed of four married women who average 31 years of age and three children. They reside in the Babemba district of the city of Sikasso and do various commerce in: condiments, shoes, soaps, used clothing and such.

They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. They are on their third solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding ones have been correctly repaid. They plan to use this loan to buy two bales of used clothing, three 100-kg sacks of traditional soaps (big pieces), two dozen pairs of shoes, and four packets of condiments. Supplies are gotten locally in Sikasso and surrounding areas. The goods are sold retail for cash in the marketplace of Sikasso and in the districts to customers composed of women and men.

With this loan, the group members each hope to realize a monthly profit of 19,000 francs CFA that will be used to provide for the family and to invest the rest in their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Mrs. Marcelina C., 42 years old, a residence of barangay Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and blessed with 4 children, three of them are in High School. In order Marcelina to make her dream come true for her children to be able to get a degree, she said to herself, “I must strive hard”. 


Marcelina is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 for her to purchase materials and equipment needed for fishing and a fishing boat of course. The loan is enough for any possible and positive outcome that she is striving for the future of her children and family.

loans.use: additional capital for fishing

loans.name: Ojeleye

texts.en:
Ojeleye is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Ipaja, Lagos state, Nigeria.

She has a business where she sells kerosene, wholesale and retail. Ojeleye has been in this business for the past 5 years. Now, she needs a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more kerosene to sell.

Ojeleye is a client of LAPO. She hopes to expand her business with this loan. She says thank you to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline S. (the lady in white shown in the picture) is a resident of barangay Danao, municipality of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Caroline is 27 years old, married and blessed with 3 children. 


Barangay Danao is located near the sea . Mostly, people living in Danao survive by fishing and so is Caroline and her husband. Fishing is one way to earn a good income if only one has a good set of equipment.


Caroline and her husband need PhP20,000 to purchase such things needed for fishing like, fish net and a fishing boat which will help a lot to improve their fish catch. 


“Not just to survive” as Caroline said, she wanted her children to be able to finish school and give what her children need.

loans.use: to purchase addtional fishing equipments

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en:
Folashade is 50 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria.

She has a business where she produces and sells soap. The demands for her soap are high; she has many customers. She has been in the soap business for long time.

Now, Folashade needs a loan of N50,000 so she purchase more material to produce soap. This will increase the amount of soap she can sell.

She is very grateful to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase materials to produce more soap

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Gloria Maria tiene 49 años de edad, habita en villa reconciliación, tiene  cuatro hijos mayores que son independientes, su esposo trabaja como guionista, ella se dedica a la costura desde hace siete años, que inicio con prestamos de Afodenic que ha sido de mucho beneficios para su superación en su negocio, con esta solicitud es la quinta la cual va invertir en  materiales de construcción para construir un porche y poder gozar de sus esfuerzos de trabajo junto con su familia. Sus planes es poder comprar una maquina overlook para hacer mejor los trabajo de costura, y sastifacer al cliente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria is 49 years old and lives in Villa Reconciliación. She has four grown children who are independent and her husband works as a scriptwriter. She has been a seamstress for seven years. She began her career as a seamstress with a loan from Afodenic, which has been of much benefit to her business. This is her fifth loan, which she will invest in construction materials to build porch on her house so that she can enjoy the benefits of her hard work with her family. Her future plans include the purchase of a sewing machine to do her job better and satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a porch on her house

loans.name: Zoila Del Socorro

texts.es:
La microempresaria Zoila del Socorro E. tiene 36 años de edad, es  madre soltera de 5 hijos de los cuales 3 estudian y 2 son menores de edad, desde hace 20 años se dedica a la actividad de costura haciendo principalmente lo que son uniformes de estudiantes y de algunas instituciones como la policía nacional.

Con esta profesión la señora E. a podido sufragar los gastos de alimentación y educación para sus hijos ya que su marido los abandono desde hace varios años viajando fuera del país.

Esta actividad la microempresaria Zoila la realiza comprando la tela y entregando la prenda de vestir terminada, para tal fin ella no cuenta con un capital suficiente para la demanda actual que tiene de pedidos, por tal razon esta solicitando se le financie para comprar los siguientes materiales:

80 Yardas de tela Sincatex la cual compra a US$ 3 dólares cada yarda, 80 yardas de tela gabardina Strech la cual compra a US$ 1.50 dólares cada yarda, 50 yardas de tela Dacron Tico la cual compra a US$ 1.40 dólares cada yarda y 50 yardas de tela burbuja (colores variados) la cual compra a US$ 1.40 dólares cada yarda.
texts.en:
The small-business woman Zoila del Socorro E. is 36 years old and is the single mother of 5 children. Of her 5 children, 3 are students and 2 are younger in age. For 20 years, she had dedicated to the work of sewing, making mainly student uniforms and some institutional uniforms such as the national police. With this profession, Ms. E. has been able to provide food and education for her children since her husband abandoned them many years ago, traveling outside the country. Her job involves buying fabric and turning in the finished clothing garment. She doesn't end with enough capital for the actual pending demand. For this reason, she's asking for a loan to buy the following materials: 80 yards of Sincatex fabric which can be bought at $3 per yard, 80 yards of stretch raincoat fabric which can be bought at $1.50 per yard, 50 yards of Dacron Tico fabric which can be bought at $1.40 per yard and 50 yards of fabric in a variety of colors which can be bought at $1.40 per yard.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 80 yards of Sincatex fabric, 80 yards de stretch fabric, 50 yards of Dacron Tico fabric and 50 yards of fabric in a variety of colors.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabougnouma (composé de 3 femmes  mariées et d’une célibataire) ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans avec en moyenne 1 enfant. Elles résident dans le quartier  Médine de la ville de sikasso.
Elles  exercent des activités commerciales différentes respectivement : la vente  d’oignons, du charbon de bois, du savon et des pagnes wax et real.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 10 pièces de pagne wax et real, une trentaine de carton de savons importés, 14 sacs de 100kg de d’oignons  et 70 sacs de charbon de bois. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso et environnants.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et la plupart au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso (Médine et le grand marché de la ville) et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 17 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt,subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Sabougnouma is composed of three married women and a one who is unmarried who average 25 years of age and one child. They reside in the Médine district of the city of Sikasso and do various kinds of commerce: onions, charcoal, soap, and “pagnes” (colorful West African cloth).

They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. They are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding ones have been correctly repaid. They plan to use this loan to buy ten lengths of WAX and REAL brands of pagnes, thirty boxes of imported soap, fourteen 100-kg sacks of onions, and seventy sacks of charcoal. Supplies are gotten locally in Sikasso and surrounding areas. The goods are sold retail and mostly for cash in the marketplace of Sikasso (Médine and the grand marketplace of the city) and in the districts, to customers composed of women and men.

With this loan, the group members each hope to realize a monthly profit of 17,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay the loan interest, provide for the family, and to invest the rest in their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy onions, charcoal, soap, and cloth

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Barangay Danao is a place where the primary source of income is fishing, it is because it is located near the sea. Barangay Danao is in the municipality of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental Province, Philippines. 


Lucia P. is a resident in this beautiful village of Danao. She is 57 years of age, married and a mother of 6 children. Unlike most of the residents there, Lucia is also engaged in hog raising, aside from fishing. Lucia is quite new in this kind of business, so, she still have to consider that there are things she needed. She needs a loan of PhP15,000 to purchase feeds for hogs and materials for a pig sty.


With her perseverance, she hopes that her hog raising business will generate income to meet the needs of her family and send her children to school.

loans.use: Purchase feeds for hogs and materials for a pig sty

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing I. is 30 years old and married with 4 children. Her husband is a commercial driver.

She has a business selling fish. Among other items, she sells crayfish and prawns along with palm and vegetable oil.

Now, she needs a loan of N70,000 to purchase more fish to sell. She says thank you to all who will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Adeleke

texts.en:
Adeleke runs a shop where she sells many items, like native pots, eggs, cowries, herbs and the ingredients to make pepper soup. The demands for her goods are high because Nigerians love native pots. Native pots in Nigeria are used in the preparation of local soups and herbs.

Now, she needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more native pots and pepper soup ingredients to sell.

Adeleke is 36 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria.

Adeleke is a client of LAPO. She is very grateful to all who will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more native pots and pepper soup ingredients to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia se fue a radicar a la Republica de Argentina para poder buscar mejor nivel de vida como costurera de prendas de vestir, pero lamentablemente le fue mal y sufrió muchas injusticias; es por esa razón que retornó a Bolivia para poder emprender su propio taller de costura juntamente con su esposo. Tiene un hijo de dos años de edad y  viven en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de una maquina Overlock que le ayudará mucho para poder trabajar en su taller de costuras.
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación de préstamo solicitado por Lidia.
texts.en:
Lidia left to settle in the Republic of Argentina to be able to find a better way of life as a clothing seamstress but unfortunately the move went badly and she suffered many injustices. For this reason, she returned to Bolivia to be able to launch her own sewing workshop together with her husband. They have a 2 year old son and live in their parents' house located in the Pasankeri zone of the city La Paz. The loan money will be used to purchase an Overlock sewing machine that will help her a lot in her sewing workshop. This is her first loan with IMPRO; the completed evaluation qualifies Lidia for the approval of her requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her sewing workshop

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Ángel C. es padre de familia, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos que están estudiando.
El está solicitando un préstamo porque tiene un problema de salud, en su trabajo tuvo un accidente y se lastimó la cintura, debido a esto tiene que realizarse unos análisis médicos y comprar un medicamento que le recetaron, el cual es muy costoso. Por el momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder solventar estos gastos.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel Ángel C. lives with his wife and two children, who are attending school. He is requesting a loan because he has a health problem; at work he had an accident and injured his lower back. The loan will be used to pay for medical care and medications that he is prescribed. At this time, he does not have the money to cover these expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Cette dame a pour activité la vente de bouillie, la bouillie est une nourriture très consommée au togo pour le petit déjeuner, certains le consomment aussi les soirs. Elle fait donc ses recettes dans la matinée et aussi les soirs. Elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES et demande son premier crédit de 150000Fpour pouvoir acheter le sucre, la farine de maïs et le charbon qui sont indispensables dans la fabrication de bouillie. Elle est mariée et a 04 enfants, son mari est un retraité, elle aide beaucoup son qui n’a plus d’activité dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
This lady works selling porridge. Porridge is a dish that is frequently eaten in Togo for breakfast; some also eat it in the evening. She makes sales both morning and evening. She has never had a loan from WAGES and is requesting her first loan in the amount of 150,000 F to buy sugar, maize flour, and charcoal which are indispensable in preparing porridge. She has married and has 4 children; her husband is retired and has no business activity, so she helps him a lot in supporting the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of corn, sugar, and charcoal

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabougnouman (composé de 6 femmes  mariées) ont en moyenne 32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles résident dans le quartier  Bougoula Ville de la ville de sikasso.
Elles  exercent les activités commerciales: condiments et du savon. Pour mener à bien leur activité et de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle, ils sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 5 paniers de tomate 10 sacs de 50 kg d’oignon et 10 cartons de savon. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso ville (3eme Région administrative du Mali) et les villages environnants.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et la plupart au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso (Médine et le grand marché de la ville) et dans le quartier à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 18 000 FCFA par mois qu’elles  comptent utiliser pour soutenir un peu la famille en aidant leur mari et investir le reste dans les activités..
texts.en:
The members of the group Sabougnouman is composed of six married women who average 32 years of age and two children. They reside in the Bougoula Ville district of the city of Sikasso and do commerce in: condiments and soap.

To carry out their work and satisfy the needs of their customers, they are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding ones have been correctly repaid. They plan to use this loan to buy five baskets of tomatoes, ten 50-kg sacks of onions, and ten boxes of soap.

Supplies are gotten locally in Sikasso City (third administrative region of Mali) and in surrounding areas. The goods are sold retail and mostly for cash in the marketplace of Sikasso (Médine and the grand marketplace of the city) and in residential districts, to customers composed of women and men.

With this loan, the group members each hope to realize a monthly profit of 18,000 francs CFA that will be used to provide a little for the family by helping their husband and to invest the rest in their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap and condiments

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: T. Akossiwa est une dame qui habite le quartier de yokoé, elle a pour activité génératrice de revenus la vente de charbons de bois, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2005 et ça marche bien pour elle, elle vend en gros et en détail ; elle est une cliente de wages qui a déjà obtenu un crédit de 150000F qu’elle a bien et convenablement remboursé, maintenant elle sollicite un autre crédit de 300000F pour pouvoir acheter des sacs de charbons de bois. Madame akossiwa est marié et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
Akossiwa T. is a woman who lives in the Yokoé neighborhood. As a profit-earning enterprise, she sells charcoal. This has been her occupation since 2005, and it is going well for her. She sells both wholesale and retail. She is a client of WAGES and has previously received a loan of 150000F, which she paid back properly. Now, she is requesting a further loan of 300000F to buy sacks of charcoal. Mrs. T. is married with three children.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabougnouma (composé de 4 femmes  mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans avec en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles résident dans le quartier  hamdallaye la ville de sikasso.
Elles  vendent des articles différents vente : de condiments, de pomme de terre et d’encens).
Elles collaborent avec  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  pour satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Les prêt précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 5 paniers de pomme de terre, 2kg de (Mayon ciseni) 5kg de (guenien) plus 2 bouteilles de parfums et 4colis de condiments. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso et environnants (3eme Région administrative du Mali).
Les produits sont vendus en détail, sur commande et  au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso (Médine et le grand marché de la ville) et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 20.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.  
Elles souhaitent continuer leur collaboration avec SORO YIRIWASO, afin de pouvoir devenir chacune d’elle une grossiste et renforcer leur bonne rénommée.
texts.en:
The members of the group Sabougnouma are composed of four married women who average 38 years of age and four children. They reside in the Hamdallaye district of the city of Sikasso and sell different goods: condiments, potatoes, and incense.

To satisfy the needs of their customers, they collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding ones have been correctly repaid. They plan to use this loan to buy 5 baskets of potatoes, 2 kg of “Mayon ciseni”, 5 kg of “guenien” plus 2 bottles of perfume, and 4 packages of condiments. Supplies are gotten locally in Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali) and in surrounding areas. The goods are sold retail, by special order, and for cash in the marketplace of Sikasso (Médine and the grand marketplace of the city) and in the districts, to customers composed of women and men.

The group members each hope to realize a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the family, and to invest the rest in their businesses. They would like to continue their collaboration with SORO YIRIWASO in order to become wholesalers and to strengthen their good reputations.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments, potatoes, incense, and various other goods

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
El señor Genaro tiene el privilegio de contar con tres hijos y su esposa, es una gran familia, ellos tienen viviendo 6 años en su hogar.
Su desempeño laboral es como técnico mecánico desde hace 7 años, de aquí obtiene los ingresos que permiten mantener a su familia.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para construir una barda y elaborar un piso de concreto en el patio porque cuando llueve se ensucia mucho. (En la fotografía no aparece el señor Genaro, su trabajo se lo impidió, solamente lo hace su esposa). 
Esta mejora a la vivienda va a permitirán que él y su familia tengan un hogar más seguro y cómodo para vivir.
texts.en:
Mr. Genaro G. Garcia lives with his wife and three children. The family has lived in their current home for six years. Genaro has worked as a mechanic for the past 7 years, which has provided him with the necessary income to support his family. He is requesting a loan to pay for the construction of a concrete wall and floor in his backyard because when it rains it gets very dirty. These improvements to his home will allow Genaro and his family to have a safer and more comfortable place to live. (The picture is of Genaro's wife)

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a concrete wall and fence

loans.name: Sinjiya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sinjiya (composé de 6 femmes  mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans avec en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles résident dans le quartier  Babemba de la ville de sikasso.
Elles  exercent des activités commerciales différentes mais la plus dominante est la vente de condiments à laquelle s’ajoutent les ventes d’habits  pour enfant, du savon et de pagnes wax et real.
Elles collaborent avec  l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso  pour satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 2 douzaines de vêtements   pour enfants, 8 pièces de pagnes wax et real, 10 cartons de savons importés et 3  colis de condiments. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso et environnants.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso (Médine et le grand marché de la ville) et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 17.500 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.  
Elles souhaitent continuer leur collaboration avec SORO YIRIWASO, afin de pouvoir devenir chacune d’elle une grossiste de bonne renommée.
texts.en:
The members of the group Sinjiya are composed of six married women who average 35 years of age and three children. They reside in the Babemba district of the city of Sikasso and work in various kinds of commerce, but the most predominant is the sale of condiments, plus children’s clothing, soap, and “pagnes” (colorful West African cloth).

To satisfy the needs of their customers, they collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding ones have been correctly repaid. They plan to use this loan to buy 2 dozen pieces of clothing for children, 8 lengths of WAX and REAL brand pagnes, 10 boxes of imported soap, and 3 packages of condiments. Supplies are gotten locally in Sikasso and in surrounding areas. The goods are sold retail and for cash in the marketplaces of Sikasso (Médine and the grand marketplace of the city) and in the districts, to customers composed of women and men.

The group members each hope to realize a monthly profit of 17,500 francs CFA that will be used to pay the loan interest, provide for the family, and to invest the rest in their businesses. They would like to continue their collaboration with SORO YIRIWASO in order to become reputable wholesalers, each one of them.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments, children's clothing, soap, and cloth

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is forty years old. She is married and has a child, a girl who is currently in elementary school. She lives with her daughter and husband in a rented apartment at Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a farming and commercial town. The majority of the inhabitants are either farmers or buy and sell farm produce. Few dwellers of Offinso are in official occupations.

Grace’s husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops such as maize, cassava, plantains, etc. Grace buys and sells maize. She buys bags of maize from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She says retailers come from Accra to buy it. She also distributes it to food vendors in her community. She has been in business for over twelve years. She wants a loan to buy maize on a large scale so that she can supply it to the increasing number of customers and increase her profit margin. She aspires to improve the living conditions of the family. It is also her desire to give her only daughter the best possible education.

loans.use: To procure maize in bulk

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El microempresario José Q. M. tiene 57 años de edad, es viudo con dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando en nivel secundario tiene una pulpería desde hace 25 años en un barrio periférico de esta ciudad de Bluefields.

Este negocio tiene la ventaja que en ese sector existen pocas pulperías lo que hace que el negocio sea bastante visitado por sus clientes que le compran productos para el consumo diario. Este negocio le ha permitido poder mantener a sus hijos ya que es el único ingreso que tiene en la actualidad. Sin embargo necesita tener variedad de productos para que sus clientes no deban comprar en otros negocios.

Para tal fin requiere se le financie para comprar los siguientes productos: 100 libras de pollo las que les toca comprar en US$ 1 dólar cada libra, 2 quintales de arroz americano que compra a US$ 56 dolares el quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar que compra a US$ 30 dolares el quintal, 2 bidones de aceite que compra a US$ 28 dolares cada bidón, 2 cajas de huevos que compra a US$ 50 dolares cada caja, 2 quintales de frijoles que compra a US$ 56 dolares el quintal y 6 cajas de jabón de lavar que compra a US$ 15 dolares cada caja .
texts.en:
Small-businessman José Q. M. is a 57 year old widow with 2 children who are studying in the second level. For 25 years, he's had a local store in an outlying neighborhood of the city of Bluefields. This business has the advantage of being one of only a few local stores, so the business is frequently visited by its clients that buy products for daily consumption. This business has enabled him to care for his children now that he is the sole wage-earner that they have. Nevertheless, he needs a variety of products for his clients so that they don't have to buy at other businesses. For such purpose, he will use the loan to buy the following products: 100 lbs of chicken which cost $1 per pound, 2 kg of American rice which cost $56 per kilogram, 2 kg of sugar which cost $30 per kilogram, 2 containers of oil which cost $28 per container, 2 boxes of eggs which cost $50 per box, 2 kg of beans which cost $56 per kilogram and 6 boxes of laundry soap which cost $15 per box.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 100 lbs of chicken, 2 kg of American rice, 2 kg of sugar, 2 containers of oil, 2 boxes of eggs, 2 kg of beans and 6 boxes of laundry soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construct a wall.

loans.name: Adjété Kokuvi

texts.fr: Monsieur A. kokouvi vit dans le quartier de sagbado à adjidogomé, il a pour activité génératrice de revenus la vente d’huile à moteur à Adjidogomé, il fait ce commece depuis 2005.il n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES et il demande son premier prêt pour acheter de  en grande quantité de l’huile à moteur. Il est célibataire mais il a un enfant à sa charge
texts.en:
Mr. Kokuvi A. lives in the Sagbado neighborhood of Adjidogomé. To earn money, he sells motor oil in his neighborhood. This has been his occupation since 2005. He has never had a loan from WAGES, and is requesting his first one to purchase a large quantity of motor oil. He is a bachelor, but he has a child to support.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of motor oil

loans.name: Tienkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Tienkadi (composé de 4 femmes  mariées) ont en moyenne 28 ans et  2 enfants. Elles résident dans le quartier  Hamdallaye de la ville de sikasso.
Elles  exercent les activités commerciales: condiments alimentaires et du bois de chauffe. Pour mener à bien leur activité et de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle, ils sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Le prêt précédent  a été correctement remboursé.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 5 paniers de tomate 10 sacs de 50 kg d’oignon. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso ville (3eme Région administrative du Mali) auprès des producteurs fréquentant le marché de Sikasso.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et  au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso  et dans le quartier à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 19 000 FCFA par mois qu’elles utilisent pour soutenir un peu la famille en aidant leur mari et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Tienkadi (composed of 4 married women) have an average age of 28 and on average, 2 children. They live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of the town of Sikasso.

They are engaged in commercial activities: selling condiments and firewood. In order for their businesses to succeed and to satisfy the needs of their clientele, they collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loan was correctly reimbursed.

They intend to use this loan to buy 5 baskets of tomatoes and 10 sacks of 50 kg of onions. They buy their goods right in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali) from producers who come to the Sikasso open-air market. They sell their items retail and for cash in the markets of the town of Sikasso and in their own neighborhoods from their homes to a clientele composed of women and men.

They each hope to make an average profit of 19,000 F CFA per month which they will use to help their husbands with family expenses while investing any remainder back into their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy condiments for re-sale

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa B. is thirty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to three children – two girls and a boy. Two of her children are in the basic school at the moment. The last-born is still being breast-fed. She lives together with her children and husband in Offinso, a business and farming community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Theresa’s husband is a commercial driver. He conveys goods and passengers between Offinso and Kumasi, the regional capital. Theresa works to help her husband provide for the family. She is a fish-monger. She sells on a small table top in the market square. She procures her goods from big-time fish-mongers in Kumasi who sell at wholesale prices.

Theresa has been in business for four years. According to her, most of her customers are food vendors in her community. She wants a loan to buy smoked fish in bulk to make more profit. She hopes to expand her business by trekking to nearby towns to do business.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora es socia del Bancomunal Los Viñedos
Flora es casada,  tiene 54 años, dos hijos D. 26 y 22 años que estudian en la universidad.
Tiene su negocio D. video juegos para niños, y alquila una parte D. su  casa, empezó con una tienda D. abarrotes en la casa D. su suegra, la cerro por que se mudo a otro distrito, se fue a argentina a trabajar por un año, cuando regreso puso su salón D. video– juegos, empezó con dos maquinas, ahora tiene siete maquinas para video juego, Flora administra su negocio sola. 

En  Finca, encontró la oportunidad para crecer en el negocio, y tener capital para los tiempos difíciles, un tiempo no podía pagar la mensualidad del colegio D. sus hijos y con los ahorros que tenia en el Bancomunal pudo  pagar. 
Necesita  un préstamo D. 1000 soles, para comprar un disco duro para su play station y comprar nuevos juegos y surtir salón D. video juegos. 
El sueño D. Flora es construir el cuarto piso D. su casa y vivir D. sus rentas, esta pensando en su vejez  por que no tiene seguro.
texts.en:
Flora is a member of the Los Viñedos Communal Bank. She is 54 years old and married. Her children are 26 and 22 years old and attend college. She has a videogame business for children and rents out a part of her house. She began with a grocery store in her mother-in-law’s house. Flora closed that business because she moved to another district and went to Argentina to work for a year. When she returned she established a videogame room. She began with two videogame consoles and now she has seven. Flora runs her business alone.

Through FINCA she found the opportunity to build her business and to have capital for the difficult times. Once she could not pay the monthly installment for her children’s schooling but with the savings that she had in the bank she was able to pay.

Flora needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy a hard disc for her Play Station and to buy new games for her videogame room. Flora’s dream is to construct a fourth floor onto her home and live from the rent that she would collect. Flora is planning for her old age because she does not have health insurance.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a hard disc for her Play Station and to buy new games for her videogame room.

loans.name: Ségla

texts.fr: A. ségba habite le quartier de logoté à adjidogomé, il fait du commerce de produits d’alimentation générale dans le quartier sagbado et ce depuis 2001. il n’arrive plus à satisfaire la demande qui est élevée c’est pour celà qu’il demande à WAGES un premier crédit d’un montant de 150000F pour pouvoir satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle. Il est marié et sa femme est une revendeuse, ils ont 04 enfants à charge
texts.en:
Ségla A. lives in the Logoté neighborhood of Adjidogomé. He deals in foodstuffs in the Sagbado neighborhood, and has done so since 2001. He can no longer satisfy increased demand, and for this reason, he is requesting his first loan from WAGES--a sum of 150000F--in order to be able to suitably meet the needs of his clientele. He is married; his wife is a retailer, and they have four children to support.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of assorted foodstuffs

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena P. M. es madre soltera, ella vive con sus 2 hijos, ellos tienen viviendo 4 años en su hogar, ella trabaja como camarera en un motel desde hace 4 años y este empleo le proporciona los ingresos necesarios para mantener a sus hijos.
La señora Magdalena está solicitando un préstamo para construir acabados interiores en su casa, para que de esta manera ella les pueda ofrecer a sus hijos un hogar más cómodo para vivir.
texts.en:
Magdalena P. M. is a single mother. She lives with her two children. They have lived in their home for four years. She has worked as a maid in a motel for four years and this job provides her the necessary income to support her children. Magdalena is requesting a loan to construct interior finishes in her home so that she may offer her children a more comfortable home in which to live.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct interior finishes.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia T. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all girls. All of her children are currently in school. Some are in junior high school while the last born is currently in the elementary stage. She lives with her husband and family in a business/farming town called Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants are engaged in commercial and farming activities.

Lydia says her husband is a farmer who cultivates maize, cassava and other foodstuffs. Lydia deals in cooking utensils. Lydia says she procures her goods from big shops in Kumasi. She sells in a small shop in the local market and also hawks house-to-house in her community. She has been in business for fourteen years. Lydia desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying utensils in bulk to be able to trek to nearby markets to do business. She aspires to send her children all the way to the university level of education.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils for re-sale

loans.name: Yankadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Yankadi (composé de 6 femmes  mariées) ont en moyenne  32 ans et  3 enfants. Elles résident dans le quartier  Hamdalaye de la ville de sikasso.
Elles  exercent les activités commerciales : la vente de légume, du savon, de l’arachide ; du sucre et du sucre. 
Pour mener à bien leur activité et de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle, ils sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Le prêt précédent a été bien dénoué.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de 50kg de légume, 5 sacs de 100 kg de sucre, 10 charrettes de bois de chauffe et 15 sacs de 10kg d’arachides. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso ville (3eme Région administrative du Mali) et dans  les villages environnants.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et la plupart au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso (Médine et le grand marché de la ville) et dans le quartier à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
