Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 15 000 FCFA par mois qu’elles utilisent pour soutenir un peu la famille en aidant leur mari et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Yankadi (composed of 6 married women) have an average age of 32 with, on average, 3 children. They reside in the Hamdalaye neighborhood of the town of Sikasso.

They are engaged in commercial activities: selling vegetables, soap, peanuts, and sugar. In order to have their businesses succeed and satisfy the needs of their clientele, they collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loan was repaid in a timely manner.

They intend to use this loan to buy 10 sacks of 50 kg of vegetables, 5 sacks of 100 kg of sugar, 10 wagonloads of firewood, and 15 sacks of 10 kg of peanuts. They buy their goods right in Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali) and in the surrounding villages.

The products are sold retail and mostly for cash, in the markets of the town of Sikasso (Médine and the big open-air market of the town) and out of their own homes to a clientele composed of women and men.

They each hope to make an average profit of 15,000 F CFA per month which they will use to help their husbands out a little bit in supporting their families, while investing any remainder back into their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for their businesses

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa T., 50 years old, is the mother of seven children - three boys and four girls, some of whom are out of school and living independently, while others attend junior and elementary schools. Her husband is a maize farmer.

Residing with her family in Offinso, a farming/commercial town in the Ashanti Region of Ghana, Adwoa has been a trader for 10 years, dealing mainly in plantains and bananas. She buys her produce from the farmers in her community and those in nearby villages and sells to community restaurant operators and retailers. When plantains become scarce, she buys and trades whatever other produce is available.

Adwoa is now requesting a loan to buy plantains on a larger scale to meet customer demand and increase her profit margin, her greatest desire being to help her children attain higher education.

loans.use: To procure more plantains and bananas.

loans.name: Maria Gregoria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Los Viñedos.  
Maria es de Palpa departamento de Ica,  conviviente, tiene 46 años y dos hijos de 26 y 10  años  el mayor trabaja y él ultima esta en el colegio. 
Maria no termina de estudiar  en el colegio por la mala influencia de sus amigas, se quedo en el tercer año de secundaria  y empezó a trabajar en casas, limpiando y cocinando, siempre le gusto la cocina y con el tiempo puso un  restaurante en su casa  que  funciono seis años, después lo cerro por que era mucho trabajo, decidió descansar por un tiempo, aproximadamente hace dos años se le presento una oportunidad de dar menús, en el trabajo de su esposo, el es maestro de obras, desde entonces ella lleva menús a los trabajadores, todos los días.

Maria sabe bordar y ha conseguido un trabajo de bordados de chompa para exportación, le llevan a su casa las chompas. 
Desde que esta en Finca a prendió a ser puntual en sus pagos, ha no endeudarse, ha recibido  charlas de cómo manejar su negocio. 
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de una campana extractora para su negocio de comida. 
El sueño de María es surgir en su negocio de comida, que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Los Viñedos Communal Bank. She is from Palpa Departamento de Ica. She is 46 years old and has two children aged 26 and 10. Her eldest child works and the youngest attends school.

Because of the bad influence of her friends María did not finish school. She left in her third year high school and began cleaning and cooking in houses. She has always liked to cook and with time she opened a restaurant in her house, which she ran for six years. She closed the restaurant because it was such difficult work. She decided to rest for a time and approximately two years ago she was presented with the opportunity of making lunches at her husband’s workplace where he is a master builder. Since then she has brought lunches to the workers everyday. Also, Maria knows how to embroider and has obtained a job embroidering jackets for export in her home.

Since she has been involved with FINCA she has been punctual with her payments and she has not gotten herself into debt. She has also attended talks on how to run her business. She needs a loan of 1000 soles for the purchase of an extractor hood for her food business. Maria’s dream is to continue with her food business and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of an extractor hood for her food business.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le crédit d’awatamé à adjidogomé, elle a pour activité la vente de chaussure et elle fabrique aussi des nattes pour revendre, ce commerce marche bien pour elle c’est pour celà qu’elle voudrait l’agrandir en demandant à WAGES son premier prêt d’un montant de 150000F pour acheter des chaussures et des matériaux pour la fabrication de nattes. Elle est mariée et son mari est un photographe, ils ont ensemble 02 enfants, elle aide beaucoup son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Awatamé district in Adjidogomé. Her business is selling shoes and she also makes woven mats to sell. This business is going well and so she would like to expand it by asking for her very first loan from WAGES in the amount of 150,000 F to buy shoes and materials for weaving mats. She is married and her husband is a photographer. They have 2 children. She helps her husband support the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shoes and material for weaving mats

loans.name: Ajara

texts.en:
Ajara I. is the 35-year-old mother of three girls and a boy, two currently in junior high and the youngest in elementary school. She lives with her children and husband, a fitting mechanic, in a rented apartment in Offinso, a business and farming community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Ajara helps her husband provide for the family by working as a textile dealer, selling a variety of fabrics – fancy, java and wax prints - from a shed in the market square as well as door to door, procuring her goods from wholesalers in Kumasi. Ajara has been in the business for six years, with the majority of her customers preferring to buy on credit and paying by installment, thus requiring her to maintain a large working capital to be able to order the textiles in significant quantities.

Ajara hopes to expand her business by trekking to nearby towns to conduct business, and is therefore requesting a loan to purchase more textiles. She hopes to help her husband put up their own house with the small profit she makes.

loans.use: To buy textile fabrics.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is the 35-year-old widowed mother of two girls and three sons; one of her children has completed senior high school while the others are currently in junior high and elementary school. She and the children reside in a rented apartment in Offinso, a farming and commercial community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Theresa works very hard to provide for her children, selling fresh yams in the local market square as well as to local food vendors. The sole support for her family, Theresa has been in business for six years, and sometimes treks to Kumasi to sell fruits. She is now requesting a loan to buy larger quantities of yams in order to expand her customer base. It is her heart’s desire to sponsor her five children in the pursuit of university education.

loans.use: To buy yams to sell.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier  yokoé, elle a pour activité la vente de produits alimentaires, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2005 et elle le fait de façon ambulante, elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES, elle sollicite ce premier crédit  d’un montant de 300000f pour acheter des produits alimentaires, elle s’approvisionne au marché local d’adidogomé, elle est  marié et mère de 04 enfants, le surplus de revenu qu’elle gagne lui permet d’aider son mari.
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Yokoé neighborhood. She sells foodstuffs. She began this business in 2005 and she goes from door-to-door to make her sales. She has never received a loan from WAGES, so now she is requesting her first loan in the amount of 300,000 F to buy foodstuffs. She does her buying in the local market of Adidogomé. She is married and the mother of 4 children. The extra income she earns allows her to help her husband.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary O. is the 36-year-old married mother of six boys and two girls, two of whom are in senior high school while the rest attend basic and elementary schools. The entire family lives in a rented room in Offinso, a farming and commercial community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Her husband is a farmer who cultivates cassava, plantains, etc., while Mary has sold cassava in the local market square for the last 12 years to help support the family. Her customers are mostly restaurant operators who use the cassava to pound ‘fufu,’ a pounded cooked cassava and plantain dish served hot with soup.

Mary procures the cassava from the farmers in the surrounding villages, and she is now requesting a loan to buy the vegetable on a larger scale in order to increase her customer base and profit margin. It is her dream to ultimately send her children to university.

loans.use: To buy cassava in bulk

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Los Viñedos.
Maria es casada, tiene 58 años, estudio en al escuela D. policías y trabajo por veintisiete años, al servicio D. la patria, hasta que se jubilo, decidió emprender algo diferente, algo que le gustara, empezó a estudiar como hacer manualidades en la municipalidad D. su distrito y en otras municipalidades donD. dictaran el curso D. manualidades y cada verano tomaba cursos para especializarse en bordados en cinta y Pintura en tela, venD. las manualidades a sus amigas en su casa, tiene una vitrina donD. exhibe sus trabajos, para esto organiza lonches en su casa.

DesD. que esta en Finca ha recibido charlas muy importantes para ella, por que no sabia cómo llevar su negocio y sobre todo como hacerlo crecer.  
Necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles para la compra D. materiales como cintas, linos, cierres, telas. 
Uno D. sus sueños es tener su bazar y poder exhibir y vender todo lo que hace.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Los Viñedos” Communal Bank. Maria is married, 58 years old, she studied at police school and worked for 27 years serving her country until she retired. She then decided to start something different, something that she would enjoy. So she began to study how to make handicrafts in the town in her district and in other towns where they could proviD. handicraft courses, and each summer she would take courses to learn how to embroider with ribbon and paint on fabric, then sell the handicrafts to her friends from her home. She has a showcase where she displays her work, and in order to sell she organizes lunches in her home. Since she has been with Finca she has attended talks that have been very important to her, because she didn’t know how to run her business and above all, how to make it grow. She needs a loan for 1000 soles to buy materials such as ribbon, linen, fasteners, and fabric. One of her dreams is to have a bazaar and be able to display and show everything she makes. One of her dreams is to have a bazaar and be able to display and show everything she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials such as ribbon, linen, fasteners, and fabric.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia A. is the 40-year-old mother of two girls and five boys, five in school, one a commercial driver, and one of preschool age. Olivia’s husband is a farmer cultivating plantains, cassava and cocoa, and they live in a rented apartment in Offinso, a farming and commercial town in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

For the past eight years Olivia has traded in maize, purchasing bags from the farmers in her community and nearby villages and selling to vendors in her community. She says some of her customers come from the cities to buy in the local market where she sells, and she is now requesting a loan to purchase maize on a larger scale in order to increase her customer base and profit margin.

Olivia aspires to improve upon her family’s standard of living and help her children ultimately attain higher education.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize.

loans.name: Fuseina

texts.en:
Married with one child, 26-year-old Fuseina I. has been a trader of maize and beans at the Offinso community market for the past six years, purchasing her stock in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Offinso, with a population of about twelve thousand people, is a community of Moslems and Christians who work together with love in building their community.

Fuseina is requesting this loan to buy a larger supply of maize and beans in order to better serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the country’s current food crisis. Additional profits accruing from this loan will help her to better support her husband in taking care of their child’s educational needs.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of maize and beans.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is the thirty-year-old mother of three children, a daughter and two sons, two of whom currently attend school. Mary’s husband is a farmer who cultivates plantains and vegetables, and the family lives in a rented apartment in Offinso, a business and farming community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Mary has traded in fried fish for over 10 years, procuring fresh fish and vegetable cooking oil at wholesale prices from big store operators in nearby cities. Frying and then selling her product on a table in the local market square, she also sells to food vendors in her community.

Mary is requesting a loan to buy fresh fish and other materials in bulk in order to supply to more customers. She also desires to acquire refrigerators to store some of the fresh fish she procures, and hopes eventually to own a family house.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish in bulk

loans.name: Ajara

texts.en:
Ajara F. is a 45-year-old mother of two girls and four boys, some of whom have completed senior high school, while the three youngest attend junior high. She lives with the family in Offinso, a commercial/farming town in the Ashanti Region of Ghana, where her husband is a cassava and plantain farmer.

For the past three years Ajara has owned a provisions shop that sells groceries such as milk, milo, sugar, and biscuits, and she also vends vegetables from a table top in front of her shop, her customers being community members who otherwise must walk all the way to the market to purchase produce.

Ajara buys some of her goods, especially the vegetables, from the small towns nearby, but travels to the bigger towns to procure her groceries. If granted, her loan will enable her to increase the quantity of goods that she buys on each excursion, thereby reducing the frequency of her trips and allowing her to sell to more people in her neighborhood and even beyond.

Ajara wants to save more money to help her husband put up a house of their own.

loans.use: To procure more provisions for her store.

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor José Alfredo M. G. es casado, vive con su esposa y por el momento no tienen hijos, el trabaja como operario desde hace 10 años y su esposa también trabaja como operaria desde hace 1 año, entre los ingresos ellos 2 solventan los gastos del hogar.
El señor José está solicitando un préstamo para construir una barda y colocar enjarres en su casa por que se humedece en tiempo de frío. (En la fotografía no aparece el señor José, sino aparece su esposa). 
Estas mejoras a la vivienda permitirán que él y su esposa tengan un hogar más seguro y cómodo para vivir.
texts.en:
José Alfredo M. G. is married. He lives with his wife and, at the moment, they have no children. For ten years, he has worked as an operator and his wife also has worked as an operator for one year. Between their two incomes, they are able to pay the household expenses. José is requesting a loan to build a wall and put plaster in his home because it gets damp during cold weather. (In the photograph, José does not appear, however his wife does.) These improvements to their home will permit he and his wife to have a home that is more safe and comfortable in which to live.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall and put up plaster.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena M. is the 43-year-old mother of six children, three of whom are attending elementary school in Abofour, a town in the Ashanti region where they live. Abena has been selling food items such as maize for over six years, having begun the business when demand for cereals became very high. Purchasing her goods from the farmers in her town, she markets them both locally and in the surrounding communities.

Abena is requesting a loan to increase her working capital in order to buy in bulk, a measure that will expand both her customer base and her profit margin, her goal being to save more money to better assist her husband in meeting their children’s educational needs.

loans.use: To buy cereals such as maize in bulk.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia S., 46, a resident of Abofour, a farming community in the Ashanti region, is the married mother of four children, all currently attending school.

To support her family, Afia has been selling yams for five years, having previously been a farmer. She treks to farming communities such as Kintampo to buy her yam stocks, sometimes spending days in the villages just to secure sufficient quantities, thereby eliminating the need to purchase from higher-priced middlemen.

With this loan request, Afia plans to secure yams in bulk to better serve her customers and increase her profits, thus enabling her to better support her husband in funding their children’s education.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina O., a 28-year-old resident of Abofour, a city in the Ashanti region of Ghana, is the married mother of two children, both elementary school students. A vendor of both fresh and cooked eggs, she balances her stock on her head as she sells in the neighborhood. Since egg prices have almost doubled over the last few months due to the discovery of bird flu on some poultry farms, she is requesting a loan to buy more crates of eggs to avoid the constant price hikes.

Ernestina recently added plastic bowls to her inventory so that when demand for one product declines, she can at least rely on the other for income. She sells the eggs in the morning at the market center and in the afternoon hawks the plastic bowls throughout the community.

Ernestina hopes to earn more income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy a supply of fresh eggs and plastic bowls for her business.

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de klinkamé non loin d’agoè à lomé, elle a pour activité la vente des articles de mercerie, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2004 et s’approvisionne au marché de hedzranawoé, elle a une boutique qu’elle a appelé « EL SADAI ». Actuellement la demande de sa clientèle a beaucoup augmenté, elle est une cliente régulière de wages qui a déjà obenu 03 prêt de 500000F qu’elle a bien remboursé, pour satisfaire ses clients, elle demande à wages un crédit de 300000F. Pour acheter 40 fils à broder, 25 rouleaux de sortie, 100 boutons. Elle est mariée et a 03 enfants, son mari est un commerçant
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Klinkamé district, not far from Agoè in Lomé. She sells sewing notions, a business she began in 2004. She does her buying in the market at Hedzranawoé. She has a shop that she calls « EL SADAI ». Presently the needs of her clientele have grown a lot. She is a regular client of WAGES and has already received 3 loans of 500,000 F which she has correctly reimbursed. In order to satisfy her customers, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 300,000 F to buy 40 spools of embroidery thread, 25 rolls of sortie, and 100 buttons. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a merchant.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sewing notions for re-sale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica O., a 56-year-old married mother of eight, lives with her husband and three of their children in Abofour, a town in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil, produced from palm nut fruits, for twenty years now, supplying area food vendors and sometimes even trekking to other villages when demand warrants.

Veronica is requesting the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts, containers in which to store the oil, and an electric milling machine to enable larger scale production. She believes this will help to expand her business and thus increase income to support her husband’s efforts to provide food for the family and finance their children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts and an electric milling machine to produce palm oil in larger quantities.

loans.name: Ayawa Paul

texts.fr: Monsieur A. ayao paul est revendeur de gravier,il habite à agoè nyvé, et fait son activité à agoè depuis 1999, à agoè il y a beaucoup de chantier, les gens construisent beaucoup les maisons ce qui fait que son commerce marche bien, il n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de wages, il sollicite donc ce premier crédit de 300000F pour pouvoir se faire livrer par 03 camions des graviers. Il est marié et a 02 enfants, sa femme est revendeuse
texts.en:
Mr. Ayao Paul A. is a retailer of gravel. He lives in Agoè Nyvé and has been working in Agoè since 1999. In Agoè, there are many construction sites. People really build a lot of houses there, which means his business is doing well. He has never been the recipient of a WAGES loan and is therefore requesting this initial loan of 300,000 francs to have three truck-loads of gravel delivered to him. He is married and has two children. His wife is a shopkeeper.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gravel

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Madame A. habite Agoè, elle est veuve et travaille très dur pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de ses 06 enfants, cette dame a pour activité génératrice de revenus la vente de graviers, son quartier étant un quartier en chantier, ce commerce marche et est très florissant pour elle. Ses clients sont des entrepreneurs, la demande a augmentée ces derniers temps, n’ayant jamais eu de crédit à wages, elle demande son premier crédit de 500000F pour se faire livrer 06 camions de graviers.
texts.en:
Ms. A. lives in Agoè. She is a widow and works very hard to provide for the day-to-day needs of her six children. With her district under construction, this woman sells gravel to earn an income. This commerce is active, and business is booming for her. Her customers are entrepreneurs. Recently, the demand has increased. Never having had a WAGES loan, she is asking for her first loan of 500,000 francs to have six truck-loads of gravel delivered to her.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gravel

loans.name: Esso

texts.fr: Cette dame vit dans le quartier d’agoè démakpoè, elle est mariée avec un monsieur qui est un cultivateur, ils ont ensemble 05 enfants, elle a pour activité la vente d’étain, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1994, elle s’approvisionne au nigéria, actuellement elle a besoin d’augmenter son stock par l’achat de 02 bandes d’étain. Le crédit qu’elle demande est son premier crédit  à wages, le montant est de 300000F. elle aide beaucoup son mari dans la prise en charge du foyer.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Agoè Démakpoè district and is married to a gentleman who is a farmer. Together they have five children. Her work involves selling tin, commerce she has been doing since 1994. Her supplies come from Nigeria. Currently, she needs to increase her stock through the purchase of two strips of tin. The loan she is requesting is her first one with WAGES and amounts to 300,000 francs. She helps her husband a lot with household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy strips of tin

loans.name: Corsina

texts.es:
Corcina es agricultora y también se dedica a la producción y venta  D. leche a la Industria PIL (Planta Industrializadora D. Leche), con eso cubre los gastos D. estudio y alimentación D. su familia, tiene tres hijos, vive en casa propia ubicado en comunidad D. Chahuirapampa  sección Achacachi.  


El crédito lo destinara para la compra D. ganado ya que en esta temporada el precio ha rebajado 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Corcina is a farmer, and she also produces and sells milk to "Industria PIL" (an industrial milk processing plant). With the money she earns from this, she covers the expenses of school and food for her family. She has three children and she lives in her own house in the Achacachi section of the Chahuirapampa community. She will use this loan to buy cattle since their price has dropped during this season. This is her first loan with Impro, and a credit evaluation has been conducted which qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan tiene un minibús el cual trabaja su hijo, además trabaja en una construcción con lo que se cubre la manutención de la familia la esposa también trabaja en una construcción vive en casa propia en la zona Puerto Mejillones de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinara para el pago de ingreso a la ESBAPOL (Escuela  Básica Policial) así colaborara a su hijo Nemo M. para que pueda estudiar y tener una profesión en la vida. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Juan has a minibus which he son drives, and he also works in construction. With this money, he covers the expenses of providing for his family. His wife also works in construction. He lives in a house of his own in the Puerto Mejillones section of the city of El Alto. He will use the loan to pay for a deposit to the ESBAPOL (Basic Police School) so his son Nemo M. can study and have a professional career. This is his first loan with Impro, and an evaluation has been conducted which qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for his son's studies

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es agricultora y también se dedica a la producción y venta  de leche a la Industria PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), con eso cubre los gastos de estudio y alimentación de su familia, es divorciada tiene tres hijos, vive en casa propia ubicado en comunidad de Arasaya  sección Achacachi.  


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de ganado ya que en este tiempo es que baja  de precio el ganado. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Natividad is a farmer and she also works in the production and sale of milk for Industria PIL (an industrial milk processing plant). With the money she earns, she covers the expenses of school and food for her family. She is divorced with three children. She lives in a house of her own in the Achacachi section of the Arasaya community. She will use the loan to buy cattle since the price of cattle has dropped recently. This is her first loan with Impro, and an evaluation has been conducted that qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Jaime Roldan

texts.es:
Jaime se dedica a la producción y venta de leche a la Industria PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), además elabora sombreros los cuales vende en la feria de Achacachi,  tiene dos  hijos los cuales todavía son dependieses de Jaime vive en casa propia que esta ubicado en la comunidad de Arasaya  sección Achacachi.


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera y así podrá producir mas leche y por ende aumentar sus ingresos para la mantención de su familia. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Jaime works in the production and sale of milk to Industria PIL (an industrial milk processing plant). In addition, he makes hats, which he sells at the Achacachi fair. He has two children who are still dependent on him. He lives in a house of his own that is located in the Acacachi section of the Arasaya community. He will use the loan to pay for a dairy cow so he will be able to produce more milk and therefore increase the amount of income he'll have to provide for his family. This is his first loan with Impro, and an evaluation has been conducted which qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Qhantati Group

texts.es: En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra ubicado en el centro focal de Senkata a éste pertenece la asociación “Qhantati” (traducido al castellano significa Amanecer), grupo formado por quince miembros que trabajan con mucha responsabilidad. Este grupo ha encontrado en los alimentos una forma de generar ingresos para poder solventar las necesidades de sus familias. La mayoría de ellas se dedica al comercio de papa y verduras, productos que son comercializados en las ferias de la ciudad de El alto, también se dedican ala elaboración y venta de comida. Ahora ellas necesitan mayor capital para comprar productos al por mayor de este modo sus ganancias serán también mayores y así poder generar mayores ingresos para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
The association "Qhantati" (dawn) is located in the town of El Alto in the center of Senkata. The group has fifteen very responsible members. This group has discovered food as a way to generate income to satisfy the needs of their families. Most of them sell potato and vegetables on the markets of the town of El Alto, and they also cook and sell food. At the moment they need an increased capital to buy products in bulk in order to increase their earnings and thus generate a higher income to benefit their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital to buy products in bulk.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina es casada y tiene hijos.  Su negocio es la venta de productos de consumo diario, como arroz, maíz, jabón y aceite.  Ella tiene su puesto de venta en el mercado municipal de San Martín Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango, también en su casa se dedica a la crianza de marranos.  2 de sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio, los otros estudian todavía, su esposo también le ayuda por algunos momentos en el día, el se dedica a cortar el pelo.  Su préstamo lo necesita para invertir en más producto, ya que su negocio necesita estar bien surtido.  Su sueño es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y puedan salir adelante en la vida.
texts.en:
Paulina is married and has children. She sells daily foodstuffs such as rice, corn, soap and oil. She has a stall in the municipal market of San Martín Jilotepeque, in Chimaltenango. She also raises pigs at her home. Two of her children help her with her business, the other are still studying. Her husband also helps her sometimes during the day: he is a hairdresser. She needs this loan to invest in more goods as her business needs to be well stocked. Her dream is that her children continue their studies so that they can get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy daily foodstuffs to retail

loans.name: Joyitas De Oro Group

texts.es:
En la zona de villa tejada, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Joyitas de Oro”. Un grupo muy simpático y particular formado por 18 miembros que trabajan de manera organizada en todas sus actividades, cumpliendo mas de cinco años de trabajo junto a Pro-Mujer.  Las actividades que realiza la asociación Joyitas de Oro, son variadas; DEysi se dedican a la venta de artículos en plásticos, que los comercializa en la ciudad de Cochabamba; su hermana  costura sombreros, otras diseñan productos en miniatura (alasitas),
También se  dedican a la venta de ropa.
Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de productos al por mayor, están seguras que sus ventas aumentarían, de este modo obtendrán mayores ganancias y beneficios para sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Joyitas de Oro” group is from the Villa Tejada area. This is a very nice and particular group made up of 18 members who are very organized, having worked with Pro-Mujer for more than five years. The “Joyitas de Oro” group's members have a variety of businesses: Deysi sells plastic articles in Cochabamba; her sister sews hats; others design miniatures for the festival of Alasitas. They also sell clothing. They needs more capital in order to buy their goods wholesale; they are certain that their sales will increase, thus they will make more money and more profits for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital in order to buy goods at wholesale prices

loans.name: Chaskañawi Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Chascañawi” pertenece a la familia de  Pro-Mujer hace más de diez  años. La mencionada asociación  pertenece al centro focal Senkata, ubicada  en la carretera 6 de marzo – ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con catorce miembros que  han demostrado ser un grupo de muejres, muy organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación podemos decir que son comerciantes en su mayoría, por ejemplo venden medias, otras  se dedican a la elaboración y venta de galletas y masitas, también venden verduras, papa y chuño. La asociación Chascañawi precisa créditos para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, para poder ampliar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The “Chascañawi” association has been part of the Pro-Mujer family for more than 10 years. This association is based in the Senkata neighborhood, which is located along 6 de Marzo Avenue in the city of El Alto. There are currently 14 women who are members of the group, and they have proven themselves to be very responsible when it comes to repaying their loans and in their internal activities. The association includes various businesses, but the majority of the women are merchants. Some, for example, sell socks, some earn a living making and selling cookies and pastries, while others sell vegetables, potatoes, and chuños (freeze-dried potatoes—a specialty of the Andes). The members of the Chascañawi association need loans so they can purchase more products and thus increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing more products

loans.name: Paula Lileth

texts.es:
Paula Lileth es dueña de una tienda de productos básicos desde hace 4 años la cual la instalo debido a que la colonia donde habita no había ninguna tienda, ella inicio vendiendo frutas y verduras, las cuales con el transcurso del tiempo le generaron ganancias y fue así como decidió vender productos como café, pan, huevos etc.,y otros  artículos que la gente consumía, ella dice que inicio con 2 libras de cada artículo.

Su negocio ha crecido debido a la buena administración y al servicio que se les brinda a las personas. La tienda es atendida por toda la familia por ella sus dos hijos  y su esposo. Ahora Paula tiene necesidad de un préstamo ya que desea abrir otra tienda y solicita a FAPE  le brinde un préstamo.
texts.en:
Paula Lileth has been the owner of a general store for the past 4 years, which she established due to the fact that the neighborhood in which she lives did not have a store. She began selling fruits and vegetables, which as time passed generated profits and that is how she decided to start selling products such as coffee, bread, eggs, etc, and other items that people consume. She says that she began with 2 pounds of each item. Her business has grown due to good administration and the service that she provides people. The store is attended to by her entire family, that is, herself, her two children, and her husband. Currently Paula needs a loan given that she hopes to open another store and asks that the FAPE provide her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a neighborhood general store.

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Danelia S. es originaria de la ciudad de Masaya cuna de las artesanías de Nicaragua donde se desempeña en su negocio de elaboración y venta de hamacas típicas las cuales son comercializadas en su propia localidad donde es muy visitada por personas y en ocasiones por turistas los cuales se enamoran de las bellas hamacas que ella elabora.

Es importante destacar que Ceprodel ha sido su apoyo porque le ha brindado créditos para su desarrollo y es por este motivo que hoy en día una vez más espera que su crédito sea aprobado para así continuar su negocio de elaboración de hamacas ofreciéndolas en la ciudad de Masaya.
texts.en:
Daniela Sanchez is originally from the city of Masaya known as the birthplace of the Nicaraguan crafts. This is where she carries out her business in the assembly and sale of traditional hammocks, which are marketed in her own location. She is very visited by people and on occasion by tourists who fall in love with the beautiful hammocks that she creates. It is important to emphasize that Ceprodel has been her support because it has provided her loans for her development. It is for this reason that she currently once again hopes that her loan is approved so that she may continue in her business in the assembly of hammocks that she offers in the city of Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of materials.

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
La elaboración de calzados es un negocio que requiere de mucha entrega y gran dedicación ya que se debe tener vasta experiencia para elaborar los calzados de todo tipo, estilos, tamaños y para ambos sexos.

En la ciudad de Masaya, el señor José Galan se dedica a su negocio de elaboración de calzados los que son comercializados en su propia casa de habitación y también son enviados a diferentes lugares para ser vendidos. Es importante destacar que él ha sobresalido como un excelente comerciante y esto gracias al apoyo de Ceprodel por medio de la entrega de los créditos. Hoy en día espera que su solicitud le sea aprobada para obtener el dinero para la compra de materia prima y continuar en la elaboración de los calzados.
texts.en:
Shoemaking is a trade that requires much hard work and dedication because one needs to have a vast amount of experience to make shoes in all types, styles, sizes and for both genders.

In the city of Masaya, Mr. José Galan makes shoes for living. He sells some from home while others are sent to different places to be sold. It is important to note that he has excelled as an entrepreneur thanks to support from Ceprodel via loans. He now hopes that his loan request will be approved so that the can purchase raw materials and continue making shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Willie Wilson

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Masaya, el caballero Willie Wilson U. se dedica a su actividad de venta de ropa y cosméticos ofrecida en su propio tramo donde atiende a sus clientes todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

La razón por la cual su negocio se ha venido desarrollando grandemente es gracias a Ceprodel ya que le ha brindado créditos que los ha utilizado para la compra de la mercadería. La razón por la cual hoy en día una vez mas espera en Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito ya que requiere comprar la ropa y los cosméticos de sus proveedores y le urge obtener esta mercadería para ofertarla de inmediato en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the city of Masaya, Mr. Willie Wilson U. sells clothing and cosmetics in his own business space, where he serves his customers everyday from early in the morning until dusk.

His business has been developing greatly thanks to Ceprodel, which has given him loans that he has used to purchase merchandise. The reason why he once again hopes to have a loan from Ceprodel is that he needs to purchase clothing and cosmetics from his suppliers. He urgently needs to obtain this merchandise in order to offer it immediately at his store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
el Sr. Julio tiene 46 años de edad, es una persona que se dedica al servicio de transporte, el tiene 25 años de realizar esta actividad, el vive en la colonia las Mercedes de la ciudad Capital, vive con su esposa y su madre, junto a su esposa sacan adelante su hogar, tienen un hijo el cual esta estudiando.
el tiene malo su taxi y necesita comprarle el motor (usado) para poder ponerlo en marcha ya que el motor que tiene el carro esta fallando mucho. por tal razon el solicita credito para reparar su unica fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio G. is 46-years-old and has been providing transportation services for 25 years. He lives with his wife and mother in the Mercedes neighborhood of the capital city. He and his wife help the family move forward. They have a son who is currently in school. He needs to purchase a used engine for his taxi cab so that he can get it running smoothly again because it is having problems. For this reason, he is requesting this loan in order to have his sole source of income repaired.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase used engine for taxi cab

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adriana Yonary

texts.es:
La señorita Adriana Yonary G., tiene bajo su responsabilidad a su mamá, y ambas viven en una casa de renta pero el costo de la renta se ha incrementado, es muy difícil para ella cubrir ese gasto. 
 Es por eso que adquirió una vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental, pero le esta haciendo falta los protecciones en puertas y ventanas, desea hacer está mejora lo mas pronto posible y así dejar de pagar renta y vivir en su propiedad.
 Esta solicitando un préstamo para ponerle las protecciones a su casa y así estará más segura y protegida para ella y su mama.
texts.en:
Adriana Yonary G. is responsible for her mother. Both live in a rented house, but the cost of the rent has increased. It is difficult for her to cover this expense. It is for this reason that she has acquired a home through a government loan. However, it lacks the protection of doors and windows. She wishes to improve this as soon as possible and stop paying rent and live at her property. She is requesting a loan in order to put these safeguards on her house so that she and her mother will be safer and more protected.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installing doors and windows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional capital for dress making

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Watch Repair is the business that Anabelle and her husband have now. Sometimes Anabelle’s husband goes fishing if there is no client coming in for watch repair. Going fishing helps them to cater for their daily needs but their main business is watch repair because it will take just a couple of minutes to fix a watch and make a big sum rather than spending hours fishing.

Anabelle T. and her family are residents of barangay Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is the mother of 2 children and helps her husband in the business. Like any family who lives at Danao, they want to live and survive.

Having such business as Watch Repair, it also takes a lot of consideration for details such as parts for watches, spare parts, accessories, gadgets. As of now, Anabelle and her husband needed PHP 7,000 to add up capital for their business and to purchase peripherals needed.

loans.use: additional capital for watch repair services

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
A single and a hardworking mother, that is Elmira C.,  26 years of age, residing at barangay Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Elmira is determined to earn money for her only child. While her child is still young, she looks forward to a simple life with enough resources for living and surviving. 


Elmira has been into several micro-businesses before, like garland-making and hog-raising, selling her goods to her neighbors and residents in the  the neighboring village. But as she could see around her community, she realized that fishing is still the most profitable business. So, she decided to switch to fishing   hoping to earn more than the usual income that she gets in garland-making and hog-raising. 


For Elmira able to realize her plan,  she needs PHP 15,000. WIth that amount, Elmira can purchase materials needed for fishing. Being such a hardworking person she would believe that she can make it with a little help from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.

loans.use: purchase needed materials for fishing

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Mrs. Janet A. as shown in the picture is a resident of barangay Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and blessed with three children. Like any other people who live in barangay Danao, her primary source of income is fishing.  Her fishing business  sustains everyday needs and  meet the rising cost of  education for her children. 


While her children are still young, Janet wants to insure her children’s future. Janet also wants to raise her children well. To make her dream come true, Janet and her husband need an amount of PHP 50,000 to be used as additional capital for fishing and to purchase their own fishing boat. 


As Janet looks forward to have a good life, able to send her children to school until they  finish college, to have enough to sustain their everyday needs to make improve their way of living. All of these will hopefully be realized if they improve their fishing business..

loans.use: to purchase new pumpboat  to be used as a fishing boat

loans.name: Rio

texts.en:
Mrs. Rio B. is 27 years old, married and lives at Lao Proper, Plaridel, Mismais Occidental. Her husband is a driver and at the same time a businessman. Rio desired to help her husband, so she decided to become an active member of Paglaum MPC. The cooperative offers various programs and services. Loan windows for instance to fund their capital needs have been a good venue for the couple.

Without delay and taking risks, they have ventured into mango production. They have applied to Paglaum for the much needed capital for fertilizer. They find that their business runs smoothly and though there are difficulties, they are able to manage. Rio decided to get into business expansion slowly and with caution. For 4 years of being a member, she has enjoyed the add-on benefits of the cooperative. What she dreams of for the future is that her 2 children would finish their studies and have good life ahead.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Pov Srei Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan, which is located in Tep Archun village in Kandal province, consists of nine people, and they will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Pov S. owns a small store where she sells grocery products. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Soy Ant, helps her in the current business. Mrs. Pov S. is 42 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are laborers, while the youngest one is enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 38 años, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos Franz de 15 y Paul de 2 años en su propia casa la cual le costó mucho adquirir. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de móviles de segundo uso y sus accesorios, los cuales vende de forma ambulatoria por la ciudad de Puno. A ella le gusta su trabajo ya que le permite disfrutar de sus hijos y disponer de su tiempo según sus necesidades, pero eso no descuida su trabajo, todo lo contrario, Susana es muy dedicada y siempre trata de dar lo mejor de ella, su carisma y forma de tratar a la clientela han hecho que tenga muchos clientes los cuales la buscan para adquirir sus accesorios. Este es su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma y está comprometida a ser muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más celulares de segunda mano y los refaccionará para poder venderlos.
texts.en:
Susana is 38 years old; she lives with her partner and her two sons: Franz, aged 15 and Paul, aged 2. She owns her own home although it was very expensive to buy it. She is a hard-working woman who sells used cell phones and their accessories. She is a street vendor in the city of Puno. She enjoys her work because it allows her to enjoy her children and dispose of her time based on her needs; she does not neglect her work, on the contrary! Susana is very dedicated and always tries to give her best. Her charisma and customer service have brought her many clients who look to her to buy cell phone accessories. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prima and she is committed to paying on time. She will use the loan to buy more second-hand cell phones and will refurbish them so she can sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene 20 años, es soltero, vive alquilado en una casa de adobe que pertenece a sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de artefactos de 2do uso, más conocido como venta de chatarra en la ciudad de Puno desde hace  un año, ya que al no tener acceso a estudios superiores se dedica netamente al trabajo como su única fuente de progreso. Aún así a Luis le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le permite tener cierta libertad e independencia y puede elegir que es lo mejor para él. Lo difícil de su trabajo es adquirir las cosas de segundo uso que venderá y refaccionarlas, ya que muchas de ellas están en mal estado, haciendo más difícil su trabajo. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de artículos de segundo uso y los refaccionará para venderlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Luis is 20 years old; he is single and is renting an adobe house owned by his parents. He sells second-hand goods and is well known as a scrap seller in the city of Puno, having been in this business for the past year. Because he did not have access to study past high school, he has focussed on work as his only avenue for progress. Luis very much enjoys his work as it gives him a certain amount of freedom and independence and he can decide what is best for himself. What is hard about his work is acquiring second-hand goods to sell and fix as many of these are in bad shape, making his work more difficult. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. He will use the loan to buy more second-hand goods, to fix them for resale at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more used goods for resale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 52 años vive sola en una casa alquilada ya que es soltera y no tuvo hijos. Se dedica a la venta D. artículos plásticos desD. hace 10 años, los compra para luego venderlos en una D. las plazas donD. se venden artefactos D. segundo uso más conocidas D. la ciudad D. Puno.
Gracias a su trabajo ha podido mantenerse todos estos años es por eso que quiere seguir creciendo y progresando en él, ya que hoy en día las cosas no están tan fáciles pero felizmente el esfuerzo D. Juana da buenos resultados ya que las ventas son buenas. Este es su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad D. artículos D. plástico y así incrementar su capital para lograr mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Juana is 52 years old and lives alone in a rented house as she is single and has no children. She has been selling plastic goods for the past 10 years. She buys these items to resell them in one of the best-known used goods markets in Puno. Because of her work she has been able to support herself all these years and she wants to continue growing and building her business as things are not so easy these days. Happily, Juana's efforts have had good results and her sales are good. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma; she has always been very punctual with her payments. She will use this loan to buy more plastic goods and thus increase her capital to make more money.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Mrs. Sreng S. is a villager in Chress village in Kampong Speu province. She and her husband, Mr. Im Tom, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Even though they try to work hard, they still do not have much money to support their family. In order to improve the living, Mrs. Sreng S. decided to ask for a loan to buy palm sugar to start a new business. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family. She is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy palm sugar to start a new business.

loans.name: Sroeun

texts.en: Mrs. Sroeun S. was born in 1974, and she now lives in Chress village in Kampong Speu province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Svay Horn, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar or wine. Since his career is going well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more bamboo to make palm juice containers for his current business. Thus, Mrs. Sroeun S. decided to ask for a loan for to buy more bamboo for her husband's business. She hopes to increase her income and improve the living conditions. She has three children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan for to buy more bamboo for her husband's business.

loans.name: Lot

texts.en:
Lot P., 47, who lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, has owned a plot of land since 1999 upon which she grows both rice and vegetable crops, planting twice a year, the dry season and the rainy season.

Lot is the widowed mother of six children, three single and three married, the latter living away from the family home. Two of her single children are employed, her son as a construction worker and her daughter as a vendor of desserts, gasoline, vegetables, and some groceries.

To reduce the family's transportation costs, Lot is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle to serve in the business activities and for family rides.

Mrs. P.'s daughter appears in the picture because Lot was not available.)

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for business activities and family rides.

loans.name: Inocente

texts.es: El señor Inocente T. labora para una empresa de bebidas muy conocida en la cual tiene una antigüedad de 6 años tal que brindo muy buenas referencias laborales ya que explican que es una persona muy responsable dentro y fuera de su trabajo, el señor inocente esta tramitando este crédito para el pago de la colegiatura y uniforme de su hija ya que el le quiere brindar un mejor futuro mediante una buena profesión.
texts.en:
Inocente T. has worked for a well-know refreshments company for six years. He has good work references who state that he is a very responsible person both at work and in his personal life. Inocento is asking for this loan to pay his daughter's high school tuition and uniform as he wants her to have a good career so that she will have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for his daughter's high school tuition and uniform.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es: El señor Carlos Eduardo es supervisor de unas gasolineras de la ciudad, el y su familia están solicitando este crédito para la colocación de protecciones y la construcción de una barda lateral para proteccion de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Eduardo is a supervisor for a gas station in the city. He and his family are asking for this loan to place security devices and to build a wall to protect his family.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To place safety devices and build a wall to protect his family.

loans.name: Moth

texts.en: Mrs. Moth C. is a villager in Ra village in Kampong Speu province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She needs more income to support her family. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to increase her income. Mrs. Moth C. is a 57-year-old widow with two children who are construction workers.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to increase income.

loans.name: Gloria Irma

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, ella tiene su propio negocio de abarrotes el cual tiene 6 años establecido y con mucha clientela, 
Ella tiene un proyecto que es la colocación de un techo de madera en el patio de su vivienda.
Es por tal motivo que ella esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de materiales y de mano de obra.
texts.en:
Gloria is a very responsible and hard-working person. She has owned her own grocery store for the past six years and has many customers. She has a plan to build a wooden roof over the patio of her home. To accomplish this, she is asking for a loan to buy the building materials and pay for the labour.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wooden roof over her patio.

loans.name: Mrs. Chhum Chhorn Village Bank Group

texts.en: Ten people living in Preak Treing village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Chhum C., the 41- year-old village bank president, is a fish seller. Her husband, Mr. S. Savorn, is a fisherman. In his fishing, he faces a problem because he does not have enough fishnets. Thus, Mrs. Chhum C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband. She hopes to increase their income and improve the living conditions with this loan. She has four children, two of whom are printing house workers, while another helps the father work, and the remaining one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband's fishing.

loans.name: Chun

texts.en: Chun M., 57, lives in Kampong Cham province, where she raises pigs and grows yams on her farmland. From these activities, she earns approximately $4 a day, while her husband, Hang Heng, 66, pictured here, is a carpenter, making different kinds of furniture. On average, he makes $5 per day. Chun M. would like to take out a loan to purchase a sawing machine for her husband, and use the rest of the loan to purchase a tractor. The tractor will used to transport yams to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a sawing machine, as well as a tractor.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Thavin's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thavin T. is the group leader of five, who all live in Ta Reab Doun Sar village in Kandal province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Keo Sophary, is employed in a casino club. Even though they try to work hard, they don't earn enough income to support their household. In order to improve their living, Mrs. Thavin T. decided to ask for a loan to buy phone boxes to start a phone service provider.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy phone box to start a phone service provider.

loans.name: San

texts.en: T. was born 1975 and lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is married with four children; all of them are single. Three of her children are employed selling souvenirs for tourists, while her husband, Mr. Ry, 37, is a motorcycle taxi driver. Lately he has not been able to attract as many clients as before because his motorbike often has problems. Ry talked with his wife and they have decided to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to replace an old one problem

loans.name: Usmonjon

texts.en:
Usmonjon N. is married with three children. This is an average family from Khujand, Tajikistan. However, Usmonjon is a unique entrepreneur. Together with his wife he has been selling women's underwear in the central city market for about 8 years. The secret of his success is simple: he tries to not only let their customers know the benefits of their products – he also gives them a sense of belonging which brings them back again and again.

However, Usmonjon doesn’t want to stop where he is with his venture. Usmonjon is seeking a loan of 1000 USD to replenish the merchandise in his store. We believe that Usmonjon’s desire to excel by pleasing his customers will determine his further success and encourage new customers to buy from him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing underwear for women for re-sale

loans.name: Ochaoi

texts.en:
Ochaoi G. is 49 years old. She and her husband, a taxi driver, have raised 4 children. Ochaoi sells clothing for women such as knitted jackets, skirts and sweaters. She has been in this business for 12 years already. As a rule Ochaoi travels to Bishkek which is located in the neighboring country Kyrgyzstan to purchase new goods. She tries to choose varied styles of good quality and attractive prices which allows her to keep her clientele.

Today Ochaoi is requesting 1000 US Dollars for a term of 6 months. In February Ochaoi is planning her next trip to Bishkek. She will spend the loan purchasing new goods such as knitted jackets, skirts, and sweaters for women for re-sale. This is Ochaoi's second loan from Kiva. She said that she got the first loan from Kiva just in time and she used her market advantage and made good profit. She promises to repay her second loan from Kiva on time as she did with the previous one, and she thanks everyone for support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing her range of goods for re-sale

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.en:
Bahriniso Z. is 53 years old. She is a very wise and hard-working woman. She is married, with three children. This entrepreneur dedicates herself to the sale of clothing for women: jackets, sweaters, suits, skirts, etc. She started her business 5 years ago. Little by little, she has expanded her inventory, and thanks to the good service she offers, her business is growing rapidly. She says that with income from her business she is able to provide education and food for her children.

Now Bahriniso needs a loan of 1200 USD which she will use to buy clothing in order to fulfill her customers' orders. She is committed to paying back this loan in 12 months. This is the time to help someone who needs it. Please do not hesitate to help improve the quality of life of this family!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seasonal clothing for teenagers for sale

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.en:
Abdumalik is 30 years old. He is married with 4 kids who are all going to kindergarten. Abdumalik has a small restaurant where he sells breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Prior to opening his own business, he worked at a restaurant where he learned the ins and outs of the trade. When he first started his business, he only opened to sell breakfast because he worked at night. Once his place became more popular, he was able to dedicate his whole time to the business.

Abdumalik wants the loan so he may invest in tables, chairs, and utensils, and in that way he proposes to expand his business. He is asking for 800 USD with a term of 6 months. With this money, Abdumalik will be able to expand his business, to earn more profit and in turn help his children move forward to attend school and university and in future become well-educated persons. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Contribute to the growth of Abdumalik’s business and they will be grateful!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. loans.use: Purchasing tables, chairs, and utensils to expand his cafe

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie has a dry goods business located in the public market of Tumauini, Isabela.  She sells different kinds of clothing but she also wants to sell other kinds of products to increase her income.  She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to realize her plans. At the moment, her focus is on the maintenance and development of her business because it is their source of income.  She believes that hard work, good attitude and wise strategies are some of the keys for her to become successful.

She is already married and they have a three year old daughter named Kyana.  Her husband is a farmer who also assists her in their store when he is not busy in the farm.

loans.use: purchase additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Mukhtor

texts.en:
Mukhtor U. is 34 years old. He has been married for about 10 years. His wife is a teacher in the local school. Currently Mukhtor does not work within his profession, but he tries to feed his family by being a merchant. Mukhtor has been running his business for about 2 years. He rents a retail store where he sells different kinds of housewares. His business is the main source of income for the family.

Mukhtor is trying to have a wide range of goods with good quality to meet the requirements of his customers and to satisfy the needs of customers with different levels of income. Today, Mukhtor requests 800 USD for a term of 6 months. This is the first time that Mukhtor has asked for a loan through IMON International and Kiva. It will be used to buy more housewares in order to increase the range of his goods. Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro-entrepreneur, and his experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan.

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for re-sale

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith and her family are living in Barangay Moldero, Tumauini, Isabela. She is married to a man who  works as a passenger van driver.  They have a three year old daughter named Kate. The couple is helping one another in improving their lives and for the future of their child.  

Judith manages her dry goods business located in the public market of Tumauini, Isabela.  She sells different types of locally made clothes for men and women.  She wanted to buy more stocks for her business so she would like to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 12,000.00. The said amount will assist her financial needs.  She hopes that her business will grow for them to have a better life and for them to support the education of their child and future children.  For Judith, she considered hard work and patience as some of the keys in reaching her dreams in life.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for her store

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
Malohat D. is 39 years old. She is a married mother with a daughter age 16 who is enrolled in school. Malohat started her business because she needed extra income to be able to pay for household and personal expenses, and she also needed her own income in order to afford her home. She began 10 years ago selling teenagers' clothing and shoes. As she had always liked sales, it went well after the business was started, and she has continued selling clothing since then. With the purpose of expanding her business, she is requesting a loan of 1000 USD, which she is promising to repay over 3 months. This way, she wants to earn more and to meet all her only daughter’s expenses.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing new goods to expand the business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta and her husband Cesar are both farmers.  Later on, Violeta decided to engage in the vending business that sells root crops coming from their own harvest.  She and her husband are blessed with five children, however, due to lack of financial resources, they were not able to send most of their children to school to pursue their studies.  Their children are: Cherry Rose – 27 years old, high school graduate; Charita – 20 years old, elementary graduate; Debot – 18 years old, elementary graduate; Krisel – 17 years old, high school graduate and John, the youngest is 8 years old, an elementary student studying in a public school.  

Violeta is requesting for a loan of PHP9, 000.00 which she will use to purchase farm inputs like seed variety and fertilizer.  She will also use some of the loan to maintain her vegetable vending and root crops planting business where she gets most of her vegetable products.  She is hoping that someday, she can develop their farming and vending business for them to meet the needs of their family.  She and her husband are helping one another in the farm.  She hopes that their continuous earnings will continue to sustain their business.  Violeta prays that their children will all have a better life compared to what they have at the moment.

loans.use: purchase farm inputs and to maintain her vegetable business

loans.name: Kuisun

texts.en:
Kuisun has very good sense of humor and her jovial spirits help her face difficult times. She’s been immersed in raising animals since her childhood and for that reason she decided to remain in this business. She works very hard to obtain the income that will satisfy her family’s necessities. The immense love that she feels for her children and her faithful husband motivates her to keep working hard. She wishes to buy more animals and in this way to increase her income.

loans.use: Purchasing feed for her animals

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita B. is a “balut”(a boiled fertilized duck egg with a nearly developed embryo inside) vendor.  "Balut" is the most popular street food in the Philippines. She used to roam in their village thrice a week every afternoon to sell “balut” and earns a weekly net income of PHP250.00.  She carefully budgets her income in providing their family needs since all her six children are all married.  Her husband, Cayetano, is in charge in cultivating their farm.  

For the continuous operation of her business, Nenita wanted to request a loan amounting to PHP 6,000.00.  Her balut vending business has been her partner for almost 20 years.  The business assists her in providing her family financially.  She still wants to improve and sustain the business.  Despite her age, she never gets tired of her business and in fact it is one of the things that makes her happy.

loans.use: To purchase duck's eggs to be processed into "balut" - Filipino popular delicacy

loans.name: Rebelita

texts.en:
Rebelita is 46 years old and married to Villamor.  Farming is their main source of income since their area is rich in agricultural land.  They have five children: Romel – 23 years old, high school graduate and now working in a factory; Amilyn – 16 years old, fourth year high school; Ramil – 14 years old, second year high school; Christian – 11 years old, grade four and Redento – 9 years old, grade three. She and her husband are working hard  to send their children to school where hopefully they will earn a college degree.  

Rebelita is in the rice vending business.  Aside from rice vending, she is also engaged in hog raising.  However, the capital in her two small businesses is limited. She would like to borrow $125 that she can use for maintaining her enterprises.  She will use the loan to purchase sacks of feed for her hogs and one or two sacks of rice that she will sell at a retail price in their village.  Rebelita strives hard for she believes that through hard work they can be successful.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of feed for her hogs and sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mullojon

texts.en:
Mullojon S. is 36 years old. He is married with two children. His wife looks after the house and the kids. Mullojon supports his family by breeding cattle, which he sells for meat. He started his business in 2003. Cattle-breeding is the main source of income for the family and generates the income necessary to allow Mullojon to support his family and improve their living conditions. Now he has applied for a 400 USD loan, which he is planning to use in purchasing one milk cow.

loans.use: Purchasing a milk cow to expand his business

loans.name: Sharifabonu

texts.en:
Sharifabonu Z. is 30 years old. She is married with 3 adorable kids. Sharifabonu has been able to combine her love of children with a successful business selling kids' clothing at a busy market in Khujnad called “Panjshanbe”. Sharifabonu currently has one sales place at the market. Eventually, she would like to open a store in a permanent facility. She has requested a loan of 300 USD to help purchase new inventory. She promises to repay the loan within 12 months. She will be able to help many kids keep dry and warm through the cold winter months and hopes to make a good profit by having the right inventory in stock.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing  new clothing for teenagers

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.ru: Мирзошарифова Шаъмигуль проживает в районе Гиссар. Возрас 25 лет, замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Кроме них самих с ними живут родители мужа. Семья большая и им с мужем приходится много работать для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью. Поэтому уже 3 года она работает на рынке. Торгует продуктами питания. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы сдеать товарный запас продуктов с длительным сроком хранения. Это поможет ей реже выезжать за товаром , а так же сохранять цены на данный товар.
texts.en:
Shamigul M. lives in Gissar region. She is 25, married, and has one child. Her in-laws live together with Shamigul's family. This is a big family, and Shamigul and her husband work hard to provide for it. For 3 years, Shamigul has been selling food at a local market. She plans to use this loan to create a reserve of non-perishable goods. Having the reserve will help Shamigul travel to suppliers less frequently as well as keep her prices stable.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Create a reserve of non-perishable goods

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.en:
Abdusamad D. is 59 years old. Together with his wife, he has raised 6 children. Abdusamad is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 10 years. He bakes the national bread “lepeshka” at home. His children and wife help him with his business. Having many customers Abdusamad sells the majority of his loaves just from his place. However, he is also running a sales point in the central market where he sells ”lepeshka”. Now Abdusamad is requesting 500 USD for a term of 6 months. He is planning to purchase flour wholesale, as required for his business. Abdusamad is grateful for all supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.
