loans.use: Purchasing  flour wholesale

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a proud mother of two: Heidi Rose – 23 years old, a graduate of Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and Jomar – 25 years old, Commerce graduate and already working.  Her husband is Lucinano who works as a company driver for 24 years.  Rose, as she is fondly called is very proud that through their income they were able to send their children to school and finish their studies.  Their family has been living in the village for 27 years.  

Rose is presently engaged in the hog raising business.  She would like to avail a loan of PHP 14,000.00 which she will use to pursue her plan of renovating her pig pen and to purchase feeds supply for her hogs.  She wanted to maintain this type of business because she believes that hog raising is a good business if managed well.  She wanted to improve it for it will help her family and children when they decided to get married.  She is also encouraging her relatives and neighbors to start raising at least one piglet that they can sell after 3-4 months.

loans.use: Purchase of feeds for her hogs and renovation of pig pen

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita G. is  50 years old. She is married to Arturo who is 52 years old and a farmer. They are blessed with two children who are now both married; Richard – 30 years old and graduated with an education course and Joan – 27 years old who serves as a church minister. 

Aside from their rice/corn farming and computer/video game business, Angelita also wants to add a poultry business as an alternative source of income which they will use to support their needs in farming and their daily needs at home.

Angelita is asking for a loan of $125 as additional business capital to build her poultry business. Angelita would be very grateful for it will really be of great help to her family.

loans.use: For additional capital in the expansion of her poultry business

loans.name: Mavriya

texts.ru: Рахмонова Маврия проживает в районе Гиссар. Студентка Таджикского Национального Университета пятого курса. Кроме того обеспечивает семью  занимаясь бизнесом. Имеет магазин рядом с домом. Торгует продуктами питания и парфюмерией. Хочет увеличить ассортимент , путем получения кредита и ввоза нового товара. Планирует закупить одежду к весне. Погашать кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mavriya R. lives in Gissar region. She is a senior-year student at Tadzhik National University. In addition, to provide for her family, Mavriya R. runs a grocery store near her home. She wants to use this loan to increase the assortment of goods sold. The money will be spent to purchase spring clothing. Mavriya R. plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Tagainazar

texts.en:
Tagainazar Z., age 33, is a cattle breeder and a responsible father of 4 children who has always watched over his family’s financial security. He accomplishes this by caring for his animals on a daily basis. He clearly remembers the time when he decided to become independent, with a small number of animals and a small patch of land.

Tagainazar has more than 6 years of experience. Cattle-breeding is the main source of income for his family and generates the necessary income to allow Tagainazar to support his family and improve their living conditions. Now he has applied for a loan of 2000 Somoni, which he is planning to use in purchasing cattle.

loans.use: Purchasing  cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy R. is married to Celso, a tricycle passenger driver and operator. They are blessed with a one year old son named Novem Jay. She hopes to have two more children in the future.  They live in a peaceful place were camaraderie among the residents is present.  

Daisy is asking for a loan of $175 that she will utilize to open a village store so she can help her husband financially for additional income. Daisy and Celso believe must help one another to fulfill their dreams and hope that through their business, they can avoid asking for credit from other people.

loans.use: Forstart-up capital for a village store

loans.name: Lyutfiya

texts.en:
Lyutfiya S. is 37 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 4 children. All her children are in school. Lyutfiya's husband is a builder and his income is not very high; that is why she decided to start her own business so that she could help him cover their living expenses. She is selling teenagers' clothing in the local market of Dushanbe city. She is trying to have wide range of goods so as to be able to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of the customers with different levels of income.

Today Lyutfiya is requesting 600 USD with the purpose of purchasing additional merchandise to increase the range of her goods. She promises to repay the loan within 6 months. Be an important part of the growth of Lyutfiya’s business!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new underwear for women

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Курбонова Нигина жительница Гиссарского района. озраст 35 лет , незамужем , детей. не имеет. Уже 12 лет занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин , где торгует парфюмерией. Имеет хороший товарооборот , но почти вся прибыль уходит на обеспечение семьи. Она живет с родителями и семьей брата. Кредит решила получить для того, чтобы сделать небольшой ремонт помещения. Это поможет ей улучшить имидж магазина и привлечь новых клиентов.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nigina Q. lives in Gissar region. She is 35, single, and has no children. Nigina Q. has been in business for 12 years. She owns a perfumes store. The business brings a good profit, but almost all the money goes to provide for Nigina's family: Nigina lives with her parents and her brother's family. Nigina Q. plans to use this loan to renovate her store. This will help her to attract new customers. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Store renovation

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano U. is 44 years old. She is married and has three children. Rano is a woman determined to search for the best things in life and offer them to her dearly loved children. This eagerness means that she is always on the lookout for profitable new activities. She is accompanied and helped by her sister, who encouraged her to do this 15 years ago, when she moved to settle in her home town. She has devoted herself to selling women’s clothing, and now she is satisfied as her business has provided her with sufficient income to cover the cost of primary education for her four young children. Today Rano is requesting your help in getting a loan of 600 USD for the term of 6 months to add a new stock to her merchandise. Your support means a great deal to Rano. Please offer her your help!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing her working capital

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Курбонова Дильбар проживает В Гиссарском районе. Возраст 36 лет , замужем и имеет двоих детей. Имеет среднее образование. Муж не работает , но помогает ей в ее деле. А занимается она торговлей. Имеет подарочный магазин . Он помогает ей поставлять товар и упаковывать подарки. Занимаются они этим бизнесом уже 12 месяцев. Планируют получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот , так как скоро наступают весенние праздники и свадебныйсезон . Погсить кредит сможет втечение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilbar K. lives in Gissar region of Tajikistan. She is 36 years old and is married with two children. She is a high school graduate and owns a store where she sells presents. Dilbar's husband does not have a job but he helps her with her business by supplying products and packing presents. The couple has has this business for a year. They are applying for a loan in order to expand their business, before the spring holidays and the wedding season. They are planning to pay off the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Urozali

texts.en:
Urozali is 20 years old. Despite his young age, he has been raising sheep already for three years. He tries to invest as much time as possible in his animals. He tries to bathe and vaccinate his animals, which is very tedious, because there is only one place to bathe the rams and it's not easy to reach. But without a doubt, the results please him: to be able to see clean and healthy animals is a great source of satisfaction. Now he plans to invest the money that he is requesting in the purchase of a good breed of livestock to improve the quality of his animals. He will then generate more income, and with it, improve his quality of life.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Курбонова парвина проживает в районе Гиссар. Возратс 32 года , не замужем. Имеет среднеспециальное образование. По профессии медсестра. Но работает вмагазине . Торгует парфюмерией и подарками. Кредит планирует получить и использовать для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Parvina K. lives in Tajikistan's Gissar region. She is 32 years old and is single. She is a high school graduate. She is a nurse by training but she sells perfumes and presents in a store. Parvina is applying for a loan in order to increase cash flow. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin N. is 25 years old; she lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She stays at home doing housework and cooking for her family. Her husband, Thai Den, 29, is a mechanic repairing motorbikes. On average, he makes about US$ 9 in revenue every day. This couple has two children. One is at home and one is at school. Rin N. would like to take out a loan to purchase mechanic's tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase mechanic's tools

loans.name: Chiv

texts.en: Chiv S., 21, pictured with her husband and children, is married and lives with her family in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband have had a business recharging batteries since 2001 to earn a living and are able to make US$ 15 in revenue every day. People who live in the country usually depend on batteries to power their lighting. This couple has two young children. They would like to request a loan from KIVA via Credit to replace an old generator.

loans.use: To replace an old generator

loans.name: Anorbi

texts.en:
Anorbi K. is 49 years old. She is married and the loving mother of five children. She lives in Dushanbe and owns a small store in the local market. Anorbi has been selling kids' clothing for about 3 years. Her store is well known in the market for having a nice variety of assorted kids' clothing at affordable prices. Her profit from the business has increased extensively since she started her business.

Anorbi has a unique ability to analyze a merchandise market and find her niche. This is something that helped her start her business and make it successful. Today she is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni for the term of 9 months to increase the assortment of her inventory and her sales and profits as a result. With your help this will be possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing her working capital

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Man S., 32, lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a true entrepreneur who has a business selling seasonal fruit and vegetables. She always changes her inventory according to seasonal fruits, crops, or vegetables. She has been operating this business since 2005 and is able to make US$ 15 in revenue every day. Her husband is disabled; he lost his right leg. He works as village council chief. On average, he makes US$ 2 per day. This couple has two young children. Mrs. Man S. is asking for a loan of US$ 250 to purchase pepper from individual growers to sell to market-wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase pepper from individual growers

loans.name: Some

texts.en: Some K., 40, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She has three children of whom two are growing rice and vegetables to help with the family’s expenses. Every day she sells porridge and rice noodles from her home and is able to make US$ 4 of profit each day. Her husband Hem Chhaily, 37, is a farmer and makes about US$ 6 per day as well. Some K. is asking for a loan to make a new investment in opening a grocery stand.

loans.use: To open a grocery stand

loans.name: Savri

texts.ru: Курбонова Саври жительница Гиссарского района.Незамужем  , работает в парфюмерном магазине. Занимается бизнесом уже около 5 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Savri K. lives in Gissar. She is single and she's been working at a perfume store for the past five years. Savri is applying for a loan because she would like to increase cash flow. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Gulrukhon

texts.en:
Gulrukhon K. is 45 years old. She is married with three children. A friend of Gulrukhon's invited her to help sell clothing at the marketplace and Gulrukhon jumped at the offer. This is how she learned the vitals skills needed to manage a store in the marketplace. She decided to open her own business. She put some money together and bought some clothing and started her business 15 years ago with these items.

Gulrukhon has been able to help her husband with their living expenses and to provide for her children. However, Gulrukhon thinks it is imperative to buy new merchandise to have more variety of items, which in turn will attract more customers. Gulrukhon is requesting a loan of 600 USD which will be paid off in installments over the course of 6 months. With this loan, Gulrukhon will be able to buy the necessary merchandise, to earn more and in that way will be able to support her family with your help.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing her working capital

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena S. manages a dry goods (clothing) business.  Her clothing business is located in the public market of Baligatan Ilagan, Isabela.  She is  44 years old and married to Gerardo who works in a financing corporation. They are blessed with two children Germalyn – 13 years old and in second year high school and Angelo - 7 years old who is now in the elementary grades.  According to Elena, their living conditions are quite good and happy.  

Business expansion is her reason for asking a loan of $300. Her hardships and sacrifices are for the future education of her children.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino is 56 years old and married to Constancia, his partner in his hog raising and farming business.  They have seven children: Jonathan, 35 years old, high school graduate; Jenny, 32 years old, elementary graduate; Jemalyn, 28 years, old college graduate; Marijane, 22 years old, high school graduate; Robin, 19 years old, a graduate of a two year course; Romel, 16 years old, elementary graduate and Jeraldine, 14 years old, a high school junior.  

As the head of the family, Avelino wants to provide a better way of living for his family.  For him to do this, he would like to request a loan of $225 to purchase an additional hog and to buy sacks of fertilizer to support their farming needs and have a good yield this harvest season. He hopes that through his business he can support the needs of their family and provide the daily school expenses for his youngest child. Avelino considers their village  a poor area because of its poor road conditions especially during the wet season when transportation is rare. Avelino says that he must work hard for the welfare of his family in order to attain his ambition in life.

loans.use: To purchase an additional hog and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.ru: Халимов Абдуманон проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 32 года , женат и имеет троих детей. Имеет лепешечную. Выпекает лепешки  для реализации оптом на рынке , а так же на заказ. Хочет получить кредит , для того, чтобы сделать запас мук. Это поможет бесперебойно работать . Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdumanon H. lives in Gissar. He is 32 years old and is married with three children. He owns a bakery. He sells bread wholesale at the local market. In addition, his bakery accepts orders. Abdumamon would like to receive a loan in order to be able to create flour reserve. This would allow him working without interruption. Abdumamon would pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Ehtibor

texts.en:
Ehtibor K. is 43 years old. She is married with 4 children. Nine years ago, Ehtibor began selling shoes in the market, since her husband’s income was not enough to cover her children’s expenses. That was how she got a taste for the business and was convinced that it left her sufficient revenue. Currently, she works in this business full-time, and thanks to her enthusiasm, she has made a name for herself in the market. However, her clients request more and more things each day, which is why Ehtibor is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni, which she is willing to repay in a 7-month term. With this money, Ehtibor will be able to purchase more goods and therefore give her business a boost. With your help, Ehtibor will be able to help her children prosper so that they may one day go to college.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new shoes to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Tserennadmid

texts.en:
Tserennadmid S. lives with her husband and two children. She has borrowed money from Kiva partner XacBank on two previous occasions, once as a business loan and once to help build a home. 

She has been a reliable client who entered into a relationship with the bank 572 days ago and didn't exceed the credit term. Since 2003, she has been running a secondary raw material buying center which is located opposite the Khuchit Shonkhor market at Denjiin Myanga. 

The high school educated entrepreneur buys all types of bottles, plastic bags, and plastic containers from individuals. She sells the bottles to bottle-buying centers of appropriate factories or sometimes directly sells them to the factories. She typically will resell 5,000 to 6,000 bottles twice a month.

She makes a profit of between 20 to 50 per bottle (14,000 togrog=$1 USD). She also buys plastic containers and  plastic bags at 100-150 togrogs a kilo and sells them for 200 togrogs a kilogram, mostly to Chinese companies. She has been running this business for a long time, so she has many permanent clients and suppliers.

This photograph of Tserennadmid is taken at the recycling center. The sign over her head says in Mongolian that it will take 100 years for a single littered plastic bag to decompose.

loans.use: Buying and selling bottles and plastic bags

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa U. is a rice vendor in the remote and mountainous area of Cabisera 27, Hacienda, San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela.  She is married to Edwin and they have eight children: Edna – 24 years old, elementary graduate; Lorna – 23 years old, high school graduate; the twins Edwin and Francisco – 20 years old, high school graduates; Harold – 15 years old, currently in fourth year high school; Jennie Rose – 13 years old, second year high school; Herson – 10 years old, grade four and Erica – 8 years old, grade two elementary student. 

Jesusa and her husband are helping one another in making a living for their family.  Jesusa decided to request a loan of $225 for them to have additional capital that they can use in their rice vending business. They want to expand the business for it is their major source of income in sending their children to school and in helping them to cope up with their daily needs.  Through the business, they will also provide the necessary farm inputs needed in their farming activity.  Like any entrepreneur, Jesusa and her husband are working hard to reach their goals.

loans.use: For additional capital to be used in their rice vending business

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia L. and her family are living a simple life in the village of San Manuel Naguillan, Isaebla.  She is married to Rodolfo, a tricycle driver.  Their three children are all married: Precy, the eldest is 34 years old, a midwife graduate and now working as a domestic helper in Dubai; Efren, 32 years old, vocational course graduate, working in Qatar and Roden, 30 years old, a graduate of Police Technology. 

In order to earn  their daily living, Rodolfo works as a tricycle driver while Ignacia is working as a calamansi vendor. Calamansi is a citrus fruit native to the Phillipines.  They strive to work to sustain their daily needs because they do not want to depend on their children financially since they all have their own families.  Some of their income from their tricycle operation and vending business was invested in their piggery business as an alternative source of income.  

Ignacia is asking for a loan of $275 that she will use for the continuous operation of their small businesses.  They have been in business for 25 years and it has assisted them in sending their children to school.

loans.use: for additional capital

loans.name: Bibisoro

texts.ru: Рахмонова Бибисоро проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 24 года , замужем и имеет двоих детей. Работает в торговле уже 6 лет. Тогует на рынке детской и взрослой одеждой. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12  месяцев.
texts.en:
Bibisoro R. lives in Gissar. She is 24 years old and is married with two children. For the past six years she has been selling clothes for childrens and adults. Bibisoro is applying for a loan in order to increase cash flow. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en: D., 27, who lives Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, earns a living selling groceries from her house, selling items such as cooked food and sweets for kids. She has had experience in this business for a long time. D. is married and currently takes care of three children, all of whom are single and also attend school, whilst her husband is a local motorcycle taxi driver. D. works hard every day and is very responsible with regard to her family. Currently, the family is suffering from pollution surrounding their house, which is harmful to their health. Therefore, Mrs. D. is requesting a loan to purchase another piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase another piece of land

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Туракулова Шарофат житель Гиссарского района. Возраст 29 лет , замужем и имеет двоих детей. Занимается торговлей. Опыт работы в данной сфере уже 8 лет. Торгует разными тканями и другими товарами народного потребления. Кредит запрашивает для того, чтобы закупить  новый товар. Погасить кредит может втечение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharofat T. lives in Gissar. She is 29 year old and is married with two children. For the past eight years she has sold fabric and other products. She is applying for a loan that would allow her to purchase more goods for sale. She would pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Adjoa Omaboué

texts.fr: Madame T. habite le quartier d’adidogomé à Lomé, elle a pour activité la vente de carte de recharge, elle a associée à cette activité la gestion d’une cabine télephonique, ce commerce lui réussit bien, elle le fait depuis 1997, elle  a déjà obtenu de wages un crédit de 300000F qu’elle a bien et régulièrement remboursée, actuellement elle a besoin de satisfaire la demande grandissante, elle demande alors à wages un prêt de 500000F. Elle est mariée et a eu 04 enfants, son mari est un architècte
texts.en:
Mrs. T. lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood in Lomé. Her business is selling rechargeable phone cards. She also manages a phone booth and these businesses are working well for her. She has been in this line of work since 1997. She has already had one loan from WAGES in the amount of 300,000 F which she reimbursed correctly. Now she needs to satisfy the growing demand of her customers, so she is requesting a loan of 500,000 F from WAGES. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is an architect.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rechargeable phone cards for re-sale

loans.name: Murodbek

texts.ru: Зияев Муродбек житель города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 24 года. Холост . Имеет высшее образование. По профессии экономист. Но занимается бизнесом. Открыл свой диллерский центр, где обслуживает клиентов денежными переводами и продажей припейд карт. Планирует получить кредит и купить компьютер. Кредит необходим на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Murodbek Z. lives in Tursunzade. He is 24 years old and is single. He is a university graduate in Economics and a businessman. He has a call center where he provides money transfer services and sells prepaid cards. Murodbek is applying for a loan that would allow him to purchase a computer. He would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a computer

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мирзоева Мухаббат жительница города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 50 лет. ивет со своей семьей. Она замужем и у нее пятеро детей. Домохозяйка , занимается земледелием. Планирует получить кредит для посева. Купить на полученные деньги семена пшеницы и удобрения. Погасить креди сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhabbat M. is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and five children in Tursunzade. Muhhabat is a homemaker and works in agriculture. She would like to get a loan that would allow her to buy seeds and fertilizers. She would pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Shokirjon

texts.ru: Муротов Шокирджон живет со своей семьей в городе Турсун-Заде. Ему 45 лет и всю жизнь он занимается земледелием. Сеет пшеницу и другие злаковые культуры. Получаемый урожай продает на рынке , а частично оставляет себе. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закуить семена пшеницы и удобрений. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Shokirjon M. lives in Tursunzade with his family. Shokirjon is 45 years old and all his life he has worked in agriculture. He grows wheat and other grains and sells the harvest at the local market. He keeps part of the harvest for his family. A loan would allow him to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers. He plans to pay it off within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Hezu

texts.fr: Ce monsieur de 26 ans travaille dur pour pouvoir vivre, pour cela il fait comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente en gros et détail de cartes de recharges, il est célibataire, il a même des employés de bureau comme clients, cette activité marche bien pour lui. Il n’a jamais obtenu de crédit et demande ce premier crédit pour acheter des cartes de recharges chez la société de téléphonie mobile TOGO CELLULAIRE et MOOV. Ce crédit va lui permettre de rentabiliser son activité.
texts.en:
This 26-year-old gentleman works hard to survive. In order to earn a living, he sells rechargeable phone cards wholesale and retail. He is single. He even has office workers as customers and this business is going well for him. He has never before received a loan and is asking for this, his first loan to buy rechargeable telephone cards from the mobile telephone companies TOGO CELLULAIRE and MOOV. This loan will allow him to put his business on a solid footing.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rechargeable phone cards for re-sale

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia N. is forty-nine years old. She is widowed and has four children to look after, two sons and two daughters. One of them has completed senior high school and has yet to continue while the others are in junior high school.

Cecelia lives with her four children in a rented room. They live in a farming/business community called Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Cecelia says it has not been easy providing for herself as well as her four children since she lost her husband. She therefore works very hard to meet the family’s needs. She sells ‘gari’ and groundnuts, and other food products on a table top in the local market.

Gari is a local delicacy produced from cassava. The milled cassava is thoroughly squeezed of water by putting it under pressure in a sack. It is then fried in a hot metal pan over a strong fire. It is either served hot with cooked beans and oil, or cold with sugar, milk, and roasted groundnuts. She buys bags of gari and fresh groundnuts in bags from nearby towns at affordable prices. She distributes the gari mostly to the food vendors in her community. Cecelia has been in business for four years. She wants a loan to buy goods in large quantities so she can increase her profit margin to cater for her children so they can go on up to the university level.

loans.use: To procure ‘gari’ and groundnut in large quantities

loans.name: Muhtabar

texts.ru: Шахимова Мухтабар проживает в городе Турсун_заде. Возраст 38 лет . Замужем и имеет троих детей. Уже пять лет занимается торговлей . Торгует продуктами питания. Имеет свой магазин. Товар привозит из города Душанбе. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhtabar S. lives in Tursunzade. She is 38 years old. She is married and has three children. Muhtabar is a store owner. For the past five years she has been selling groceries that she purchases in Dushanbe. Now she is applying for a loan that would allow her to increase cash flow. She would be able to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul M. is forty years old. He is married and has five children, all of whom are males. He says three of his sons are currently in school, senior high and junior high schools. The last two, a set of twins, are yet to start schooling. He lives with his family in a rented house in Offinso in the Ashanti Region. Paul is a hard-working man. He runs a number of businesses. Paul is a cocoa nut/palm nut farmer, and a professional carpenter as well as a trader. He treks in oranges to the Northern parts of the country. Paul buys oranges from farmers in his community and from the surrounding villages. He distributes to retailers, mostly women. He wants a loan to procure oranges in bulk to be able to distribute to more customers. Paul’s dream is to sponsor his sons in the university and put up a family house.

loans.use: To procure oranges in bulk

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa A. is forty five years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, all of whom are girls. The first three children have completed school. Some are currently in the junior high school while others are in basic school. Theresa’s husband is a cocoa farmer. He cultivates food crops such as plantain, cassava, maize, etc. Theresa lives with her husband and children in a family house in Offinso. Offinso is a farming as well as a commercial community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

She trades to support her husband with taking care of the family. She trades in tomatoes and other vegetables on a table top in the local market. She buys boxes of tomatoes, pepper, and other vegetables from farmers in the surrounding villages at affordable prices. She sells mostly to the food vendors in her community. Theresa has been in business for ten years. She wants a loan to buy vegetables in larger quantities so she can increase her profit margin. She is working hard to support her husband to providing their children's education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in larger quantities for resale

loans.name: Tith's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four people. Its leader, Mrs. V. is 50 years old and a window. She currently earns a living by working with her daughter as temporary workers. She now has seven children; six are single and the other is married. To help support the family's needs a little, her son is employed as a local fisherman. Currently, the family living conditions is not good because their old house is too small for them. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. V. would like to ask for a loan to combine with her savings to build a new house.

The other three members are:

B., a local fisherman, needs a loan to buy nets and traps for fishing.

R. earns a living catching fish for sale. She requests a loan to buy more tools for fishing.

T. is working as a temporary worker and she is asking for a loan to repair her old house. The borrowers live in Chong Khneas Commune in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Тилакова Робия проживает в городе ТУрсун-Заде. Возраст 46 лет, вдова и имеет двоих детей. Одна  растит детей. После смерти мужа пришлось заняться бизнесом . Торгует на центральном рынке обувью. Бизнес довольно таки большой. Но для того , чтобы улучшить  работа она планирует получить кредит и увеличить товрооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Robiya T. lives in Tursunzade. She is a 46 year old widow and a mother of two children. After her husband passed away, Robiya started her own business. She sells shoes at the central market. Her business is quite big but she would like to increase cash flow. She is applying for a loan that she plans to pay off within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.ru: Тохиров Садулло житель города Душанбе.Женат и имеет шестерых детей. Возраст 53 год. Работает водителем в строительной организации.Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы провести свадьбу своей дочери. Погашать кредит будет из своей заработной платы в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sadullo T. is 53 years old. He lives in Dushanbe. He is married and has six children. Sadullo works as a driver for a construction company. He is applying for a loan that would allow him to cover the cost of his daughter's wedding. He plans to pay off the loan from his salary within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to cover the cost of his daughter's wedding

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en:
Khosiyat is a lovely 54 year old woman, who lives with her 3 children. She runs a small fabric selling business where she offers to the market, a variety types of fabrics for different tastes and ages. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of goods. The extra capital will enable her to expand her merchandise and thereby improve her business and increase her profits. Her dreams are to have her own large store one day, but most importantly, enable her children to have a better future, one where they can continue to study at the university, become professionals, and lead healthy and comfortable lives. On behalf of Khosiyat and everyone here at IMON International, thank you for your support!
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase new fabrics to increase the range of goods for resale

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en:
Inobat N. is 31 years old. She is divorced and the mother of three children. Inobat works hard to ensure the best future for her children and has been running her own small business for two years. She has a place in the central local market for selling foodstuff such as macaroni, sugar, tea, sweets, detergents and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. The business is stable and has allowed her to improve the living conditions of her family. Now Inobat needs a loan to increase the variety of the goods she sells. She is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni for the term of 8 months. Inobat and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To increase the level of inventory and variety of goods for resale

loans.name: Zainura

texts.ru: Хайруллоева Зайнура проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 45 лет, замужем и имеет четверых детей. В центре района имеет свой магазин. Торгует продуктами питания. Опыт работы в данной сфере составляет 15 лет. К нам обратилась за кредитом , для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zainura H. lives in Varzob. She is a 45 year old mother of four children. For the past five years she has sold groceries in her store in the city center. Zainura is applying for a loan that would allow her to increase cash flow. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat A. is 33 years old and married with 5 children. From a young age, he dedicated himself to working the land, having inherited a perseverance for this type of work from his parents. He plants different types of vegetables like: potato, onion, carrot, corn and etc. Shuhrat has constant clients to his crops, which means his crops have an assured sale. Besides farming, he also engaged in the business of making wooden doors and windows, together with his son. At his home, he has his own small workshop. The funds that he requests are for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. Shuhrat is a hard worker and he believes that it is important to work very hard on his land, to enable him to get maximum results, to improve his family's living, to put away savings and also to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Nusratullo

texts.ru: Дониеров Нусратулло житель района Турсунзаде.Возраст 59 лет, женат,имеет 6 детей.Образование среднее.Клиент занимается животноводством,имеет опыт в этой деятельности более 17 лет.На данный кредит хочет купить дойную корову для семьи.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nusratullo D. lives in Tursunzade. He is 59 years old and is married with six children. Nusratullo is a high school graduate and has seventeen years of experience in livestock farming. Nusratullo is applying for a loan that would allow him to purchase a dairy cow for his family. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Solijon

texts.en:
E. Solijon is 36 years old and is married. Together with his wife they have four children, all of whom are still young and attending school. They are farmers who own a plot of land in their village and grow different kinds of crops like, wheat, potato, onion and other vegetables. They have been in this business since 2003. These crops are the main source of income for their family. To reduce the hard physical labour and to expand the business, Solijon would like to apply for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Abdulvahob

texts.en:
Abdulvahob is 33 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children. He has been a farmer for the past 5 years, with the goal of supporting his household and satisfying the needs of his children. For Abdulvahob, agriculture is an activity that he likes to do. Vegetable production is what he enjoys the most as it is easier to cultivate these plants, and the produce, when harvested annually, is profitable. The earnings are greater when buyers purchase the production in large quantities reducing the expense of transporting the produce. There is also saving in transportation when buyers come to harvest and take the produce away themselves. 

This is Abdulvahob second loan with IMON International, and to date he has had no problems with his payments and all have been punctual. Abdulvahob wishes to invest the money in seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.use: Purchasee of the seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Yunus

texts.en:
J. Yunus is an active 38 year old. He is a talented farmer, and his crops are sought after by many of the local women who would like to sell them. The income he earns from this business allows him to take care of his large family of a wife and 7 children. He would like to increase his harvest in order to maximize his income, and to do so he needs to buy fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. As he lacks the financial means for this, he is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni to help him with this purchase.

loans.use: Purchase of  seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Mukhtor

texts.en:
Mukhtor has been farming since he was a young boy and now has 3 years of experience of farming by himself. He has been able to support himself by learning how to take care and manage his crops in the short growing season. Mukhtor would like to use this loan to purchase more farming implements such as herbicides, fertilizers and other necessities in order to appropriately manage his crops and in the end make a profit. Mukhtor is 21 years old and he is a hard worker. He is single with no children. Mukhtor aspires to have more farming equipment and tools so that he can work his land much more productively since due to lack of funds has not been able to do.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Khairullo

texts.en:
N. Khairullo is a fighter that has not allowed the passage of years to diminish the value of his work and as such has always set a solid example for many youths of today. He was born in a agricultural family that taught hard work of tilling the land and also the joint effort of an arduous work. He has been dedicated for 5 years to agriculture; sowing corn, potatoes, onion and etc. together with his children and wife (pictured). At harvest time he works at the    wholesale market in his locality in order to maximize the profits. Khairullo requests a loan to acquire a greater quantity of fertilizer with the objective of improving the quality of his products. Support Khairullo and his desire to work hard.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing vegetables

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Гафуров Фарход житель города Душанбе. Возраст 32 года , женат , детей не имеет. Работает в строительной организации. Жена занимается пошивом национальных платьев. И он решил получить кредит для того, чтобы купить швейную машинку. Таким образом его жена сможет зарабатывать деньги и помогать ему обеспечивать семью. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Farhod G. lives in Dushanbe. He is 32 years old and is married. Farhod works for a construction company, and his wife is a seamstress who specializes in national costumes. Farhod is applying for a loan that would allow him to purchase a sewing machine for his wife, so that she can also earn money. Farhod is planning to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Abdurayim

texts.en:
A. Abdurayim is a 43 year old man who runs his small farm. He raises sheep and sells them to the local market traders for meat production. Abdurayim says that people in his community like meat very much, especially mutton. He works very hard to raise sheep and raise them as healthy animals. He has 11 years of experience in breeding animals and now he needs more funds to continue to improve conditions for his sheep. He asks a loan of 1500 Somoni in order to purchase more sheep. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of the sheep

loans.name: Munisakhon

texts.en:
Munisakhon is a very shy woman, but also very hardworking as a farmer and as a mother of 4 young children. She and her husband cultivate potatoes and corn. At the same time they are engaged in raising cattle. What they urgently need right now are fertilizers and other chemicals for the care of their crops so that they can produce a product that is in line with the demands of the market. She needs your help to buy the fertilizers, which are the most expensive and most necessary inputs for the cultivation of her crops. Her goal is to achieve better profits and benefits in the market. Munisakhon doesn’t just need good land; she also needs a friendly hand to help her out.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita G. is 52 years old and has been a resident of San Manuel Naguillan, Isabela since she was born.  She chooses to remain single and has adopted a child.  Through her small business of managing a village store, she has been able to send her son to school to pursue his vocational course as an electrician.  However, due to life difficulties, she was not able to maintain her store business.  

Angelita has been engaged in a buy and sell business for six years in the public market.  She is asking for a loan of $200 as additional capital for her buy and sell business and to help her to re-open her village store.This would  further increase her daily income. She hopes to maintain the good relationship she has with her adopted son.

loans.use: For additional capital

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Нарзиев Фуркат проживает в районе Бохтар. Живет в центре района. Возраст  24 года . Работает в магазине. Торгует запчастями для мобильных телефонов. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.Он молодой , но очень амбициозный молодой человек. Работает с большим рвением , и планирует раскрутить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Furkat N. lives in the center of Bohtar. He is a very zealous and ambitious 24-year-old man whose goal is to expand his business. He sells spare parts for mobile phones. He is applying for a loan that would allow him to increase cash flow. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Туйчиева Назира живет в городе Турсун-Заде.Возраст 25 лет , не замужем и имеет 2 детей. Занимается производством сундуков. кредит планирует получить для закупки жести и досок . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Этот бизнес помогает ей обеспечивать своих двоих детей.
texts.en:
Nazira T. lives in Tursunzade. She a 25-year-old single mother of two children. She makes traditional dower-chests and is applying for a loan that would allow her to purchase tin and wood, and to make a living for herself and her two children. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase tin and wood

loans.name: Roquelito

texts.en:
Roquelito is 30 years old and married to Jema Elena.  Being the head of the family, he must do his best to earn a living for his family.  He operates a passenger tricycle in their village at San M., Naguillan, Isabela while his wife stays at home and takes good care of their two children: Jerome – 4 years old and Jerus – 2 years old. 

Aside from operating a passenger tricycle, Roquelito sometimes works as a delivery boy of crackers in Isabela and Cagayan Province for additional income.  Since they have no other source of livelihood, Roquelito is asking for financial support amounting to $225 that he will use to purchase motorcycle equipment.  If there is extra money left, he is planning to use it as starting capital for a soap making business to be managed by his wife.  According to Roquelito, he learned the skills and knowledge in soap making through a training conducted by ASKI – the MFI providing the loan last year.  He thinks that it will be a good business so he wants to try it.  

He is hoping that if he started the soap making, they can maintain it and become stable for the future of their children.  Roquelito believes that a man of patience will someday become successful.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for his motorcycle and starting capital for a soapmaking business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 44 years old and married to Conrado, a farmer in their village.  They have four children: William, 19 years old, college student; Conrado Jr., 17 years old, also a college student; Noemilyn, 16 years old, third year high school and Jean, 15 years old, a second year high school. Her family lives in Barangay San Juan Ilagan, Isabela located along the national highway going to Tuguegarao City. 

Cecilia's dry goods business is located in the public market of Tumauini, Isabela. She sells clothes for children, adults and teenagers. Cecilia is requesting for a loan of $225 that she can use to purchase stocks of clothes for her business. She always puts in mind that she needs to persevere to achieve her goals in life. She also believes that helping other people is a treasure that can be kept in everybody’s heart.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothes to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma Vereceles is 31 years old and mother of three children; Juvil – 12 years old, high school freshmen , Jovelyn – 10 years old grade five student and Judy Jr – 8 years old grade three student. Vilma is married to Judy, a farmer assists her in maintaining their eggplant production.  She said that in their family, they experience difficulties but most of the time they just ignore them and try to be happy.  

For three years, her vegetable production business has been their main source of income. Vilma is now asking for a loan of $125 that she can use to sustain and expand her business.  She is also hoping that she can have other types of vegetables that she can add to their harvest or engage in the hog raising business which will contribute to the financial benefit of their family.  Vilma's business also helps her in supporting the educational needs of their children.

loans.use: To be used in sustaining and expanding her business

loans.name: Robiya

texts.en:
Robiya is a brave married woman who works hard for the good of her two children. The training and discipline that she uses with her children allows her to support her husband with working the fields. Robiya’s children’s grateful attitude continues to encourage her, and they have gathered many lessons from her that they will use when they form their own households. What Robiya urgently needs right now are fertilizers and other chemicals for the care of their crops so that they can produce a product that is in line with the demands of the market. Robiya needs a friendly hand to help her out.

loans.use: Purchase of the seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Annette Nabukenya  ‘S Group

texts.en: Annette is a leader of 5 members of a loan group.  She is 40 years old and married with 5 children, aged between 4 and 22 years. All her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members. She resides and rents a one roomed house where is staying with six people. They have electricity and no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day . She works in a semi urban area, which is on the outskirts of Kampala.   She sells second hand shoes in the Kalerwe Market, near Kampala city. Annette works seven days a week and uses public transport to and from the market. She buys from Owino Market, one  the busiest markets in Kampala. Annette sells to an average of 10 customers a day and sells to all categories of people.  Annette has been in the retail business since 2005. She has been a member with MCDT for two and half years and is servicing her fifth loan, with the same loan group mates. Annette monthly expenses include rent for her business and accommodation, school fees and feeding the family. She wants to use this loan to buy a supply of more shoes .

loans.use: To stock more shoes

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel Ángel E. vive en un barrio cercano a la capital, en la ciudad de Lambaré, el se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas. Cuenta con un carrito equipado con parrilla, plancha y congeladores, para la elaboración de sus comidas, lo cual le permite sustentar a su familia.

 El mismo se dedica a ese rubro hace cuatro años, trabaja principalmente de noche vendiendo comidas varias como asaditos (carnes asadas), panchos (perros calientes), además de bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas. Anteriormente trabajaba como chofer de colectivos pero por problemas de salud tuvo que abandonar y dedicarse a su actividad actual.

 Este rubro le resulta bastante rentable, a pesar de los riesgos que corre al trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche. El Sr. Miguel Ángel solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, ya que por el intenso calor de la temporada ha aumentado en gran medida la demanda de bebidas heladas.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel E. lives in the city of Lambaré, a suburb of the capital, Asunción. He earns his living selling street food. He has a cart equipped with a barbeque, grill, and freezers, which he uses to prepare meals, allowing him to support his family. He's been in business for four years, selling a variety of asaditos (grilled meats) and panchos (hot dogs), as well as drinks, including sodas and beer. Previously he had worked as a bus driver but health problems forced him to leave that job for his current work. His business is very profitable, despite the risks involved with working until late at night. Mr. Ángel is seeking a loan to purchase drinks, as the intense heat of the season has greatly increased the demand for ice-cold beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise including: sodas, beer, flavored waters, and other drinks

loans.name: Agnes  Nabubiro ‘S Group

texts.en: Agnes is a leader of 4 members of a loan group.  She is 48 years old and married with 3 children aged between 28 and 32 years. All her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members. She resides and rents a one room house where is staying with six people .They have electricity and no  piped water at home The family gets three meals a day . She works in a semi urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.   She sells tomatoes in Ndeeba Market near Kampala city. Agnes works seven days a week and doesn’t incur any additional transport because she buys from her place of work. Agnes sells to an average of 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people. Agnes has been in this retail business for the last twelve years .and has been in MCDT for seven years servicing her fourteenth loan and for three years working with the same loan group mates. Agnes' monthly expenses include rent for accommodation. She wants to use this loan to stock more tomatoes and also buy some bananas.

loans.use: To buy more more vegetables

loans.name: Grace Nampewo  ‘S Group

texts.en:
Grace is a leader of  5 members of a loan group.  She is 36 years old and married with 6 children aged between 4 and 20 years. All her children go to school.  She takes care of additional family members. She resides and  rents a one roomed house where is staying with six people. They have electricity and no piped water at home The family gets three meals a day. She works in a semi urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.  

She sells Airtime and phone accessories at her home in Mengo Mackay, near Kampala city. Grace works seven days a week and uses public transport to and from shopping because there are no telephone outlets near her place of work. Grace sells to an average of 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people.  Grace has been in this business since 2004. She has been in MCDT for one and a half years and is servicing her third loan, with the same loan group mates. Grace's monthly expenses include rent for her business and accommodation, school fees and feeding the family. She wants to use this loan to stock more Airtime and phone accessories. Grace is aspiring to open up a permanent outlet shop.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories and air time for resale

loans.name: Sindiya (Fraternité Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sindiya (composé de 4 femmes  mariées et d’une célibataire) ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans avec en moyenne 1 enfant. Elles resident  dans le quartier  Ouayerma II dans la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mal).
Elles  exercent des activités commerciales différentes mais les plus dominantes sont la vente du bois de chauffe, la vente d’habits  auxquelles s’ajoute la vente d’oranges et divers petits articles.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle de plus en plus croissante les membres de ce groupe ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle, ils sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 5 chargements de charrettes  en oranges, 2 chargements de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 2 douzaines de vêtement  pour enfants, 2 balles de friperie et 3 paquets d’articles divers. Elles s’approvisionnent soit à Bamako (capitale du Mali),  ou sur place à Sikasso et dans les villages environnants auprès des paysans producteurs.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et  au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso  et à domicile  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 15 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the group Sindiya (composed of 4 married women and one single woman) have an average age of 32 with, on average, one child. They reside in the Ouayerma II neighborhood of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali) .

They are engaged in different commercial activities, but especially selling firewood, clothing, and also oranges and various small items. In order to satisfy the needs of their ever-growing clientele, the members of the group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their fifth solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loans have all been repaid correctly.

They intend to use this loan to buy 5 wagon loads of oranges, 2 truckloads of firewood, 2 dozen outfits for children, 2 bales of used clothing, and three packs of various small items. They buy their goods in Bamako (capital of Mali) or right in Sikasso and in the surrounding villages, from the farmers who produce the foodstuffs.

The products are sold retail and for cash, in the markets of the town of Sikasso and out of their own homes to a clientele composed of women and men.

They each hope to make an average profit of 15,000 F CFA per month which they will use make repayments on the loan and support their families.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of firewood, children's outfits, used clothing, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Finesse Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Finesse (composé de 5 femmes toutes mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans avec en moyenne 1 enfant. Elles resident dans le quartier  Médine de la ville de sikasso(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles exercent différentes activités commerciales mais la plus dominante est la vente du bois de chauffe puis la vente de  savon de fabrication locale et de l’huile alimentaire. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle de plus en plus croissante les femmes de ce groupe collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 1 an. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Le prêt précédent a été correctement  remboursé.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 1 chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 4 bidons de 20 litres d’huile alimentaire et 3 sacs de 100 morceaux de savons traditionnels. Elles s’approvisionnent soit à Bamako (capitale du Mali),  ou sur place à Sikasso auprès de grossistes. Les produits sont vendus en détail et  au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso, dans le quartier et à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et de quelques hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 19 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt,subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
All the members of the group Finesse are married women who average 30 years of age and one child. They live in the Médine district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They do different commerce-related work, but predominating is the sale of firewood and then locally-made soap and cooking oil.

To satisfy their burgeoning customer base, the women of this group have been collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for a year now and are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loan has been correctly repaid. They plan to use this loan to buy one truck-load of firewood, four 20-liter drums of cooking oil, and three 100-piece sacks of traditional soaps. Supplies are gotten either in Bamako (capital of Mali) or locally in Sikasso from wholesalers. These goods are sold retail for cash in the marketplaces of Sikasso, in the district, and at residences, to customers composed of women and a few men.

The group members each hope to realize a monthly profit of 19,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the family, and to invest the rest in the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, soap, and cooking oil

loans.name: Aisha Nansamba's Group

texts.en: Aisha is a leader of 5 members of a loan group.  She is 29 years old and married with 2 children, aged 8 and 10. Both of her children go to school .She  takes care of additional family members She resides and owns a five  roomed house where she is staying with four people. They don’t  have electricity or piped water at home The family gets two meals a day with tea. She works in a semi urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She operates a restaurant in Nakawa Market which is one of the markets near Kampala city. Aisha works seven days a week and doesn’t incur any extra transport costs because she buys from her place of work. She also owns two pay phones near her business.  Aisha sells to an average of 100 customers a day and sells to all categories of people. Aisha has been in this business since 2003. She has been in MCDT for two years and is servicing her fourth loan, working with the same loan group mates. Aisha monthly expenses include rent for her business and accommodation, school fees and feeding the family. She wants to use this loan to stock more food items in her restaurant and also buy Airtime.  Aisha aspires to open up a retail shop along with her business

loans.use: to buy items for her restuarant and airtime

loans.name: Ynocencia

texts.es:
La Sra. Ynocencia R. es casada, vive en casa propia en la ciudad de San Antonio. La misma cuenta con un minimercado y una pollería  (venta de pollos asados a la parrilla), los cueles se encuentran muy bien ubicados. 

Inició con un capital de Gs. 5.000.000 aproximadamente,  que fue ampliando con el correr de los años ya que cuenta con una amplia clientela, siendo su negocio uno de los mas conocidos de la zona.

La Sra. Ynocencia R.,  retira el préstamo para la compra de  mercaderías: pollos, bebidas, productos de limpieza y otros.

Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente su negocio, en lo que se refiere  al equipamiento y mobiliario para  poder ofrecer  un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ynocencia R. is married, and lives in her own house in the city of San Antonio. She owns a mini market and a poultry store where she sells roasted chicken prepared on the grill. Both the market and poultry store are very well located. She began with approximately $5,000,000 PYG of capital, which she expanded as the years passed given that she counts on a wide client base since her business is one of the best known in her neighborhood. Mrs. Ynocencia R. requests the loan for the purchases of merchandise: chickens, beverages, cleaning supplies, etc. One of her aspirations is to be able to presently expand her business, in which she is referring to equipment and furnishings to be able to offer a pleasant and more comfortable environment to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens, beverages, cleaning supplies, etc.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.es:
La Sra. Iluminada vive en un barrio bajo de la capital, denominada barrio de la Chacarita, allí cuenta con una despensa la cual es su fuente de ingresos económicos. La despensa esta surtida con varios tipos de mercaderías, siendo especialmente su punto fuerte la venta de bebidas bien frías. 
 
Empezó con un pequeño Kiosco, después gracias a sus ganancias empezó a crecer y se animo a quitar créditos con nuestra entidad. El crédito actual es para la compra de más mercaderías, tales como frutas, verduras, carne, pollos, productos no perecederos y otros tipos de mercaderías.

Vale la pena destacar que ha crecido mucho comercialmente, con ayuda de la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Mrs. Illumindada lives in a neighborhood below the capital, a neighborhood named La Chacarita, where she relies on her provisions shop for economic improvement. The provisions shop has a selection of various types of merchandise, of which the strong point is the sales of well-chilled drinks. She began with a small kiosk, after which, thanks to her earnings, the shop began to grow, and she was encouraged to take out a loan for the shop. The actual loan is for buying more merchandise, things like fruits, vegetables, meat, chickens, nonperishables, and other types of merchandise. She thinks it worthwhile to point out that the shop has been growing with the help of the Paraguayan Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Misty McNally, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to resell such as: meat, chicken, cheese, flour, canned food, drinks, rice, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia K. is thirty six years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, a daughter and two sons. She says two of her children are in school at the moment. The other one has yet to start school. Lydia’s husband is a commercial driver. She lives with her family in a rented apartment at Offinso, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a business/farming community. Lydia trades in fresh fish. She procures fresh fish from the big cold store operators in nearby cities at wholesale prices. She sells the fresh fish on a table, in the local market square. She distributes mostly to food vendors in her community. Lydia has been in business for over ten years. She wants a loan to buy fresh fish in bulk to be able to supply more customers. She would like to acquire refrigerators to store some of the fresh fish she procures and to help her husband to put up a building of their own.

loans.use: To procure a larger supply of fresh fish

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilú es socia del Bancomunal  Los viñedos
Marilú es casada, tiene 46 años, y tres hijos de 19,15 y 8 años todos están estudiando. 

Empezó hace veinte años en surquillo alquilando un taller, pero tuvo que mudarse a San Juan, ella tuvo que involucrarse en el negocio por que su esposo sufre de asta crónica, eso le impide que hable y salga a trabajar dejando el negocio a cuidados de otras  personas que se aprovechaban de su ausencia, ella tuvo que entrar en el negocio e aprender, hace los rebinados del arrancador y alternador  con al ayuda de su esposo que es electricista, entre otras cosa le gusta la cocina y cuando la llaman a cocinar ella esta siempre lista. 

Necesita un  préstamo de 2800 soles, para comprar repuestos de carro, armaduras, automáticos, alambre de cobre.  
Desde que esta en Finca, se siente respaldada por que  es una ayuda muy grande para ella, ha podido lograr comprar muchas cosas, para su negocio aprendió a una cultura de ahorro, trata de no endeudarse, si no, ha invertir.
El sueño de ella  es   tener un local  propio  para su mecánica.
texts.en:
Marilú is a member of the "Los viñedos" community bank. She is married, 46 years old and has three children ages 19, 15 and 8 who are all studying. Twenty years ago she opened a workshop in Surquillo but had to move to San Juan. She had to get involved in the business because her husband suffers from chronic asthma because of which he has trouble speaking. He had to go out to work leaving the business in the hands of others who were taking advantage of his absence. Marilú had to go into this business and learn about it: she makes starter and alternator rewinds with the help of her husband who is an electrician. Among other things, she enjoys cooking and is always ready to cook when asked to do so. She is asking for a loan of 2,800 soles to buy spare car parts, car frames, circuit breakers and copper wire. Since joining Finca she has felt supported as they have given her a lot of help. She has been able to buy many things for her business, has learned to save money, to try not to accumulate debt but to invest. She dreams of having her own locale for her mechanics business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare car parts, car frames, circuit breakers and copper wire

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia K. is thirty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, a girl and two sons. She says two of her children are in school at the moment. The other one is yet to start school. Lydia’s husband is a commercial driver. She lives with her family in a rented apartment at Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Offinso is a business/farming community. Lydia trades in fresh fish. She procures fresh fish from big cold store operators in the nearby cities at wholesale prices. She sells the fresh fish on a table in the local market square. She distributes mostly to food vendors in her community. Lydia has been in business for over ten years. She wants a loan to buy fresh fish in bulk to be able to supply more customers. She desires to acquire refrigerators to store some of the fresh fish she procures. She hopes to help her husband to put up a building of their own.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish

loans.name: Jesus Es Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Cecilia V. C. is the leader of the Bank of Hope called "Jesus es Nuestra Esperanza" or in English, "Jesus is our Hope."  Cecilia has six children, whose ages range from 17-37.  She lives with her husband Monserat who is 61 years old.  Some recent problems she has faced were the deaths of her father and a sister.  Her dreams for the future are to make progress in and expand her business and continue to live with her family.  

Thank you for your interest in Cecilia!

loans.use: To replenish supplies and grow business

loans.name: Noyma Edid

texts.es:
Noyma es socia del Bancomunal Los viñedos
Noyma es de Ancash, tiene 38 años, casada tiene dos hijos de 10 y 3 años  que están en el colegio, 
Noyma estudio para asistenta dental como no conseguía trabajo, se fue a provincia a trabajar por un tiempo, pero tuvo que regresar por que es casada, con su esposo decidieron poner un taller de soldadura y mecánica en el garaje de su casa, “Auto Servicio Anthony “ ya tienen ocho años en el negocio, ahora han entrado en el negocio de compra y venta de autos usados, ya vendieron dos carros.
Desde que esta en Finca, siente un respaldo y trabaja tranquila por los prestamos, ha aprendido ha ser responsables.
