Necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para  la compra de aceites para autos, pinturas para carro entre otros cosas.
El sueño que tiene es ella y su esposo es poner su laboratorio dental, ambos son mecánico dental, está programando dentro de un año alquilar un local.
texts.en:
Noyma is a member of the "Los viñedos" community bank. She is from Ancash, is 38 years old, married and has two children aged 10 and three who attend school. Noyma studied to be a dental assistant but because she could not find work, moved to the country to work for a short time but then had to return because she is married. She and her husband decided to open a welding and auto repair shop in the garage of their home; they called the business "Auto Servicio Anthony". They have owned this business for eight years and are now starting a business buying and selling used cars: they have already sold two cars. Since joining Finca she has felt their support and is able to work without worrying thanks to the loans; she has learned to be responsible. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 soles to buy car oil and car paint among others. She dreams that she and her husband will be able to open a dental laboratory: both are dental technicians. She has plans to rent a location within the next year.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy car oil and car paint among other items.

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en:
Agartha N. is fifty-three years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to six children, two boys and four girls. She says three of her children are out of school; three are currently in the basic school. Agartha’s husband is a pupil teacher. He teaches in the elementary school in their locality. He farms as well. Agartha and the family live at a family house at Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Offinso are either into farming or trade in farm products. Very few people run different types of business. 

Agartha trades in second-hand textiles. She buys textile fabrics and all kinds of second-hand clothes including bed spreads, ladies’ wears and men’s wears, etc from Kumasi, a nearby city, and sells in the market square in her community. She says she also treks to nearby markets to sell. Agartha has been in this business for eight years now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy textiles in bales. She hopes to help sponsor the children to further their education.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand textiles

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, proviene de la comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos, posee estudios secundario incompleta (tercer año).
Trabaja desde hace un año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio de compra y venta de ganado engorde; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, que los utilizó en comprar semillas de alfalfa, y comprar medicamentos para su ganado.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, podrá ampliar su negocio y poder adquirir mas semillas de alfalfa, cebada, concentrado para la alimentación de su ganado y de tal manera sacar a los animales con un buen peso y en menor tiempo posible al mercado. Ello le permitirá obtener mejores ingresos y agradece a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo y se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Eusebia is a member of the "Sacuyo" community bank. She is from the community of Sacuyo, in the district of Acora, Province and Department of Puno. She is 32 years old, a single mother of three who studied to her third year of high school. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year: she has a business buying and selling livestock for market. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used to buy alfalfa seed and medication for her animals. With this loan of 500 soles she will be able to expand her business and buy more alfalfa seed, barley and concentrate to feed her animals and thus sell her animals at market at a good weight in the shortest time possible. Thus she will make more money. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for their support and is committed to repaying her loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more alfalfa seed, barley and concentrate to feed her animals.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose S. is thirty–three years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are males. The first two children are already in school. The last born is yet to start school. Rose’s husband is a commercial driver. He conveys goods and people, mostly market women from Offinso to Kumasi and other market centers. Rose lives with her husband and children in a rented house in Offinso. Offinso is a farming and commercial community in the Ashanti region of Ghana.
She trades to support her husband and take care of the family. She trades in vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, etc on a table top in the local market. She buys boxes of tomatoes, pepper, and other vegetables from farmers in the surrounding villages at affordable prices. She sells mostly to the food vendors in her community. Rose has been in business for ten years. She wants a loan to buy vegetables in large quantities so she can increase her profit margin. She is working hard to support her husband to sponsor their children to the tertiary level.

loans.use: To procure vegetables

loans.name: Carmen  Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Bancomunal Los Viñedos. 
Carmen es casada, tiene 45 años, vive en casa de sus padres, estudio enfermería y para maestra de educación primaria, de joven lo ejerció, pero decidió cambiar de trabajo y entro a trabajar en un taller de costura por quince años, hasta que renuncio,  pero esta vez quiso tener algo propio ya no trabajar para otros, y hace un año  se matriculo en un curso de  zapatería, donde empezó hacer pantuflas y zapatos valerinas, empezó confeccionando una docena de pantuflas y en menos de una semana las vendió, todo lo que hace lo ofrece a sus amigas.
                              
Desde que esta en Finca  se siente segura por los prestamos que recibe, tiene para invertir y compra los materiales al por mayor, le gusta las reuniones del banquito por que comparte experiencias de negocio, nuevas ideas., Las charlas le han ayudado ha  saber como llevar su negocio
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para compra de materiales como terocal micro-poroso, telas, plantillas  para la confección de  zapatos, y lleva a bordar sus diseños a gamarra.  
El sueño que Carmen tiene es tener  local donde vender sus trabajos y sus manualidades.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the “Los Viñedos” Communal Bank. Carmen is married, 45 years old, and lives in her parent’s home. She studied nursing and to be an elementary school teacher, and when she was younger she worked in this field but she decided to change professions and she worked in a seamstress shop for 15 years until she retired. But now she would like to have her own business and not work for others, so a year ago she enrolled in a cobbler course, where she began to make slippers and dance shoes. She began making a dozen slippers and in less than a week she sold them. She sells everything she makes to her friends. Since she has been with Finca she feels assured of the loans she receives, she uses them to invest and buy materials at wholesale. She enjoys the bank’s meetings because at the meetings strategies to grow one’s business, new ideas, etc. are shared. The instructional talks have helped her know how to run her business. She needs a loan for 1000 soles to buy materials such as fabrics and insoles to make shoes, and embroider her designs. Carmen dreams of having her own locale to sell her products and handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy materials such as fabrics and insoles to make shoes, and embroider her designs

loans.name: Marleni Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Marleni es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, proviene de la comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 21 años de edad, conviviente y tiene un hijo, ella estudio secundaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace un año y medio con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a comprar y venta de ganado de engorde y Artesanía, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, que los utilizó en la alimentación de sus animales y compra de lana.
Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, podra comprar semilla de alfalfa para sembrar y asegurar la alimentación de su ganado. Ello le permitirá obtener mejores ingresos; de esta manera podrá solventar los gastos en los estudios de su hijo y en su hogar, finalmente agradece a Manuela Ramos por la confianza que deposita en ella  y se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Marleni is a member of the “Sacuyo” Communal Bank. She is from the Sacuyo community, Acora district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 21 years old, married, has a son, and has completed secondary school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 1.5 years. She buys and sells beef and handicrafts. Her first loan for 500 soles was used to feed her animals and buy wool. With this loan for 800 soles, she will be able to buy alfalfa seed to plant and ensure her cattle’s food. This will enable her to obtain greater income, and in this way she will be able to meet her household and her son’s educational expenses. She would like to thank Manuela Ramos for its confidence in her and she promises to punctually pay her loan in three monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy alfalfa seed

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es:
El señor Cecilio es soltero, no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres en un barrio muy populoso de la ciudad de Itá. 

Se dedica a la compra y venta de teléfonos celulares hace tres años, sus ventas las realiza al contado o a crédito. Se inició en esta actividad a consecuencia de que en el ramo de educación en el cual se recibió académicamente no contaba con rubro para ejercer sus actividades como docente.

El cliente solicita el préstamo para aumentar su stock de mercaderías, a modo de aumentar sus ventas y consecuentemente sus ingresos para así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cecilio is a single man who has no children; he lives in his parents' home in a densely populated neighbourhood of the city of Itá. He has bought and sold cell phones for the past three years. He sells both for cash and on credit. He started his business because there were no opportunities to teach the subject matter in which he had graduated. The client is asking for this loan to increase his stock as a way of increasing his sales and therefore his income in order to improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phones for resale.

loans.name: Olga Esperanza

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Bancomunal los viñedos. 
Olga es casada tiene 47 años, dos hijos  D. 29 y 23 años, ellos trabajan y  estudian.
Olga se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo, y a incorporar gente para la venta D. estos productos hace veinte años, también esta tomando clases D. bisutería, para hacer joyas D. plata.

DesD. que esta en Finca tiene más efectivo, ha aprendido a no endeudarse, y pagar todas su cuentas, ella es tesorera en su Bancomunal.  
Necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, para la comprar D. productos  D. belleza por catalogo y material D. bisutería como alambres, piedras  murano. 
El sueño D. Olga es ser directora  zonal D. Unique, tener una tienda y vender  las joyas que hace.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the "Los viñedos" community bank. She is married, 47 years old and has two children aged 29 and 23 who work and study. Olga has sold beauty products from catalogues for 20 years; she also recruits people to sell these same products. She is also taking jewelry-making courses in order to make silver jewelry. Since she has been with Finca, she has been more effective, has learned not to accumulate debt and to pay all her bills. She is the treasurer for her community bank. She needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy beauty products from the catalogue as well as material for her jewelry such as wire and glass beads. Olga's dream is to be the regional director for Unique (a cosmetics company), to own a store and sell the jewelry she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beauty products from the catalogue as well as material for her jewelry such as wire and glass beads.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama G. is sixty years old. She is widowed but has given birth to five children: four boys and a girl. Currently, Ama says two of her children have completed senior high school, while the rest are still in primary school. Ama says she also takes care of her late sister's five children. She lives with her family in a rented house in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is both a farming and commercial community.

Ama, therefore, works very hard to take care of the family. She sells fresh yams in the local market square. She procures the tubers of yam from the farmers in the surrounding villages. Ama has been in business for five years. She also distributes the yam to some food vendors in her community. She wants a loan to buy tubers of yam on a large scale so that she can distribute to more customers and thus increase her profit margin. It is her dream to give all her children and late sister’s children formal education.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam

loans.name: Mónica Eulalia

texts.es:
La señora Mónica es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, en el sector Asunción, comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; de  23 años de edad, tiene un  hijo, es casada y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja hace poco tiempo en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado de engorde, su primer préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles y se siente contenta porque le permitió adquirir alimento como comprar semillas de alfalfa, cebada, afrecho, y otros.
Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles podrá ampliar su negocio, invirtiendo en  la compra de cebada para poder realizar ensilado, sales minerales, vitaminas esto ayudara a tener ganado con un buen peso y de buena calidad, todo ello hace para ayudar en la economía en su familia; asimismo se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Mónica is a member of the “Sacuyo” Communal Bank, in the Asunción area of the Sacuyo community, Acora district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 23 years old, married, has a son, and has completed secondary school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos only recently. She buys and sells livestock. Her first loan for 500 soles and she feels happy because this enabled her to buy food such as alfalfa seeds, barley, bran and more. With this loan for 800 soles, she will be able to buy expand her business, investing in buying barley to be able to buy silage, mineral salts, and vitamins to help her livestock achieve a good weight and be good quality. All this she does to help her family’s financial situation. She promises to punctually pay her loan in three monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy silage, mineral salts, and vitamins to help her livestock achieve a good weight and be good quality

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de Maria es socio del Bancomunal Los Viñedos
Flor de Maria es casada, tiene 46 años y dos  hijos de 20 y 18 años ambos estudian en la universidad, Flor de Maria es obstetras, pero no ejerció por que se caso y se dedico a su casa.  
Su esposo inicia el negocio de bodega,  Bodega “LALO” por varios años, hasta que consiguió un trabajo en una empresa, y Flor se hizo cargo de la  bodega, antes era ama de casa ahora es la administradora, se siente realizada.
   
Necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, para invertirlos en su bodega comprar gaseosas, helados, galletas y  cerveza.
Desde que comenzó en Finca, ha recibido orientación a través de charlas de cómo administrar su bodega, se siente realizada y feliz. 
El sueño de Flor es tener su tienda bien surtida y poner una librería.
texts.en:
Flor de Maria is a member of "Bancomunal Los Viñedos." Flor de Maria is weary, 46 years old and has 2 children, who are 20 and 18 years old. Both of them study at a university. Flor de Maria is an obstetrician, but she did not practice because she got married and was dedicated to her home.

Her husband started a small grocery store, "LALO," for many years, until he got a job in a company. Flor then took charge of the store; whereas before she was a housewife, now she is the manager of her store. She feels accomplished.

She needs a loan of 1000 soles, for buying soda, ice cream, cookies and beer to put in her store. Since she started at "Finca," she has received guidance through word-of-mouth on how to run her store, and she feels accomplished and happy. Flor's dream is to have efficient store and to add a bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more items for her store

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
El señor Andres vive en casa propia con su hija en la calle León M Loza de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene un auto el cual hace trabajar como transporte publico y con esta actividad  mantiene a su familia ya que no tiene otros ingresos.
El crédito que solicita es para la reparación de su auto (nuevos frenos y mantenimiento en general) y de esta manera poder seguir trabajando normalmente.

Su antecedente histórico es bueno y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente nuestro desde Abril de 2007.
texts.en:
Andres lives in his own home with his daughter on León M Loza street in the Tembladerani area of La Paz city. He has a car with which he provides public transportation (taxi service) and with this activity supports his family as he does not have any other source of income. The loan he seeks will be used to repair his car (new brakes and general maintenance) and in this way be able to continue working normally. His credit history is good and he can access this new loan. He has been our client since April 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the brakes and general maintenance of his taxi.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El señor Luis vive en casa propia con su pareja en la calle 4 de mayo de la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí de la Ciudad de La Paz;  la actividad que el realiza es la venta de peluches los días martes y jueves en la ciudad de El Alto.  La profesión que el tiene es la de mecánico dental, esta actividad la realiza en coordinación con dentistas de la zona Buenos Aires percibiendo también otros ingresos por su trabajo con lo cual puede mantera su familia. El crédito que solicita es para comprar un motor pulidor de dientes y poder continuar con su trabajo.
 
Es cliente de impro y su historial crediticio es muy bueno y por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Luis lives in his own home with his wife, in the Villa Nuevo Potosí zone of La Paz. He works selling soft toys on Tuesdays and Thursdays in the city of El Alto. He is professionally trained as a dental technician, and works with dentists in the Buenos Aires district of the city, providing another income stream to support his family. He is seeking a loan to buy a motorised dental polisher, so he can continue with his work. Luis is an existing client of Impro, and has a very good credit history. For this reason he is eligible for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a motorised dental polisher for his dental technician business

loans.name: Juana Luisa

texts.es:
Juana  es socio del Bancomunal Los Viñedos. 
Juana es casada, tiene 44 años, tres hijos  de 16, 13 y 5 años sus hijos van a la escuela Santo Domingo, los cedros. Juana estudio Ingeniería civil, no termino por que se caso, se dedico a criar sus hijos.   
Siempre le gustaron las manualidades, y viendo la televisión aprendió   hacerlas, decidió tomar unos cursos para perfeccionarse, esta estudiando brocado en cinta y como hacer collares.  
Desde que esta en Finca tiene mas disponibilidad de dinero, aprendió ahorrar y las charlas le han ayudado a como manejar su negocio de manualidades y como sacar la ganancia, la han elegido secretaria del Bancomunal.

Necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para alquilar una tienda, y mantenimiento de sus maquinas de coser.  
El sueño de Juana es tener una tienda propia y vender todas las manualidades que esta haciendo, se ha propuesto alquilar una tienda para este año.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the "Los Viñedos" community bank. She is 44 years old, married and has three children aged 16, 13 and 5 who attend the Santo Domingo school in Los Cedros. Juana studied to be a civil engineer but did not graduate because she got married and raised her children. She has always enjoyed making handicrafts and learned to make them by watching television. She decided to take some courses to perfect herself and is now studying how to make brocade ribbons and how to make necklaces. Since joining Finca she has had more money, she has learnt to save money and the talks have helped her learn to manage her handicraft business and make an income from it. She was elected secretary of her community bank. She needs a loan of 800 soles to rent a store and maintain her sewing machines. Juana's dream is to have her own store and sell the crafts she is making. She plans to rent a store this year.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent a store and maintain her sewing machines.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is fifty years old. She is widowed but has four children to cater for: a boy and three daughters. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. One of her children is in senior high school; the rest have all completed junior high school but couldn’t continue due to financial constraints, though she had hoped to sponsor them to continue.

Agnes sells a local food called ‘kenkey.’ It is prepared from corn dough. The dough is cooked first and then balled in a plantain leaf. It is boiled again for hours. Kenkey is served hot or cold with stew or ground pepper and fried fish. Agnes procures bags of maize from farmers in the surrounding communities. She supplies to retailers in her community and also sells on a table top in the local market square. She has been in business for over twenty years. Agnes wants a loan to procure bags of maize to produce the kenkey in bulk. She needs to increase her profit to be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk, which she will use to make 'kenkey,' a local food

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El señor Raul vive con sus hijos en  casa de su madre en la calle claudio Acosta de la zona de Obispo Indaburo de la ciudad de La Paz; se dedica a la copia de llaves y venta de celulares en un puesto ubicado en la calle Sebastián Segurola, que es un lugar comercial y con esta actividad el mantiene a su familia.
El crédito que solicita es para instalar puntos de ENTEL (cabinas de teléfonos públicos) en su negocio y poder mejorar sus ingresos.

No es cliente de Impro pero por la actividad califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Raul lives with his children in his mother’s home on Claudio Acosta street in the Obispo Indaburo area of La Paz city. He duplicates keys and sells cell phone in a stand located on Sebastián Segurola street, which is a commercial area and with this activity he supports his family. He seeks a loan to install ENTEL points of access (public telephone cabins) in his business in order to improve his income. He isn’t currently an Impro cliente but his credit history qualifies him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install public telephone cabins in his business.

loans.name: Inez Del Carmen's Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Solidario G.S Seidy esta conformado por la Señora Martha Janet Menjívar y su compañera Inez del Carmen Hernández tiene la edad de 40 años y su amiga Martha tiene 48 años, el estado civil de Doña Martha es casada y tiene 4 hijos con las siguientes edades un varón de 30 años trabaja por cuenta propia una mujer de 26 años que trabaja por cuenta propia otro varón de 23 años que también trabaja por cuenta propia y su hija menor de 17 años que cursa el 1 año de secundaria en el caso de su amiga Inez su estado civil es casada y tiene 4 hijos sus edades son su hijo mayor de 20 años que cursa el 2 año de su carrera su otro hijo de 16 años cursa el 4 año de secundaria y su otro hijo de 13 año de edad cursa el 2 año de secundaria y su hijo menor de 7 años cursa el 3 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora como mecánico y el esposo de su amiga Martha trabaja como radio técnico por lo que sus propósitos son casi similares Doña Martha son de mejorar su nivel de vida y entre los propósitos de Doña Inez son mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia por lo que ya que ambas luchan por sacar adelante a sus familias los deseos de Doña Martha son de obtener su propio establecimiento y aumentar su inventario ya que así podrá ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad de los diferentes productos que tiene para ofrecer los deseos de Doña Inez son de establecer una comideria con mejores condiciones y proporcionarle al cliente la comodidad que necesita ya que así podrá obtener mas afluencias de clientes.

La actividad económica de ambas es diferente Doña Inez se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida en cambio su amiga Martha se dedica a la venta de mercadería ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 20 años su amiga Inez tiene de poseer su negocio 12 años la ubicación de su negocio es en le mercadito de Santa Ana Doña Inez inicia este negocio con fondos propios ya que en sus ideas estaban el establecerse en el mercado ya que solo así podría obtener clientes ya que tenia que sacar a sus hijos adelante para que no les faltara lo necesario y es así como decide trabajar en la elaboración y venta de comida ya que inicio con poca comida como lo fue: arroz, frijoles, huevos pero al paso del tiempo es que decide realizar la venta de comidas como: pollo, carne desmenuzada y otros, la ubicación del negocio de Doña Martha es de forma ambulante ella inicia este negocio por cuenta propia ya que siempre ha sido una persona que le ha gustado trabajar y pensó en la idea de vende ropa de forma ambulante y fue así como obtuvo este trabajo ya que al principio quería establecerse en un lugar donde pero debido a que el impuesto era muy alto decide no pagar por el ofrecer su mercadería de forma ambulante dio inicio con pocos productos como lo fue: ropa interior, camisolas y trajes para niños y  pero necesitaba obtener mas inventario por lo que se reúne con su amiga y deciden realizar un financiamiento  le ayude a las dos para sacar adelante cada uno de sus negocios por lo que Doña Inez accede al financiamiento y que este será destinado para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de granos básicos, verduras, carnes y gaseosas para ofrecer a sus clientes en cambio Doña Martha destina su financiamiento para la compra de mercadería en general que consiste en ropa, sandalias, cosméticos ya que la compra las realiza en Managua por lo que le resulta mas favorable realizar las compras.
texts.en:
The "G.S. Seidy" group is made up of Martha Janet who is 48 years old and her friend del Carmen Hernández who is 40 years old. Martha is married and has four children: a 30-year-old self-employed son; a 26-year-old self-employed daughter; a 23-year-old self-employed son; and a 17-year-old daughter in her first year of high school. Her friend Inez is married and also has four children: a 20-year-old son in his second year of studying for a degree; a 16-year-old son in his fourth year of high school; a 13-year-old son in his second year of high school; and a 7-year-old son in Grade 3. Inez's husband is a mechanic, while Martha's husband is a radio technician. Their goals are similar: Martha mentions improving her standard of living, and Inez wants to improve her families' living conditions. Both women are fighters who want to give their families a good start in life. Martha wants to have her own establishment and increase her inventory so that she can offer her customers a greater variety of products than what she now has. Inez want to open a diner with better conditions and make her customers comfortable so that she can attract more clients. The women have different businesses: Inez has been preparing and selling food for 12 years from the small market of Santa Ana while Martha has been a street vendor for 20 years. Inez started her business with her own money as she had in mind to establish herself in the market as this was the only way to get customers as she had to raise her children and so they would not lack for any necessities. Thus, she decided to prepare and sell food. Initially she sold a limited number of dishes such as rice, beans, eggs but with time she has been able to include dishes such as chicken, shredded beef and so on. Martha is a street vendor; she opened her business on her own as she enjoys working and thought of selling clothes in this manner. Initially she wanted to establish a set business locale but because the taxes were very high she decided it would be preferable to be a street vendor. She began with only a few goods, such as underwear, blouses and suits for children. She needs to increase her inventory and because of this she is joining with her friend in requesting this loan which will help them both in their businesse. Inez will use this loan as working capital to buy staple foodstuffs, vegetables, meat and soft drinks to offer her clients and Martha will buy merchandise such as clothes, sandals, cosmetics from Managua as these items will be less expensive for her to buy there.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La señora Felicia tiene 57 años de edad, es casada, tiene hijos ya mayores de edad, vive en el barrio muy cercano al centro de la ciudad de Itá. 

Se dedica a la compra – venta de aparatos celulares, los cuales adquiere de Buenos Aires (Argentina), hace más de 5 años. Sus ventas las realiza en la ciudad de Itá, Itaugua y alrededores.

La señora Felicia opera con la la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2006 en forma excelente.

Solicita el préstamo para cubrir la buena demanda de mercaderías que tiene, ya que sus clientes realizan sus compras al por mayor.
texts.en:
Felicia is 57 years old, married, and has adult children. She lives in a neighbourhood very close to downtown Itá. She buys and sells cell phones which she acquires in Buenos Aires, Argentina. She has been in this business for more than five years. She sells in the city of Itá and surrounding areas. Felicia has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2006; she is an excellent client. She is asking for this loan to satisfy the demand for her goods as her customers are buying from her in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cell phones for resale.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa vive en casa propia en la calle 27 de agosto de la zona de  Kenanipata de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y sus hijos; el esposo trabaja como albañil y ella se dedica a la confección de mandiles, los cuales los vende al por mayor y menor en la zona Garita de Lima, una zona muy popular de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito que solicita es para la inscripción y compra de material escolar para sus hijos, pues el año escolar ya comienza en Febrero.

El historial con Impro es bueno por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2000.
texts.en:
her husband and children. Her husband is a bricklayer and she makes aprons which she sells at wholesale and retail in the Lima Garita area, a very popular area of La Paz city. The loan will be used for her children’s school tuition and school supplies, as the school year begins in February. Her credit history with Impro is good so she qualifies for a new loan. She has been an Impro client since 2000.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay her children’s school tuition and school supplies

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas 
Amelia es casada, tiene 45 años,  tres hijos D. 23,18 y 13 los mayores estudian  educación superior  y él ultima esta en la escuela. 
Amelia trabaja desD. hace cuatro años  D. lunes a viernes por  las mañanas en el cafetín D. una empresa dando desayuno, ella lleva todo preparado se levanta a las cuatro D. la mañana para preparar 120 samwish  D.  queso,  huevo, palta, jamón, triples, empanadas, kekes, tiene una persona que le ayuda y por las tardes  venD. productos D. belleza por catalogo.

DesD. que esta en Finca, su capital ha crecido y ha podido comprar muchas cosas para su casa y negocio, al principio vendía 30 panes, ahora pueD. invertir mas, otra D. las cosas que aprendió es a ser puntual en sus pagos, a ahorrar y ser solidarias con las personas.    
Necesita 1600 soles, para comprar los víveres, para la preparar los sandwich, también  necesita comprar una  sanwichera y una licuadora. 
El sueño D. Amelia es trabajar por las tardes en otro cafetín y  que sus hijos terminen su carrera.
texts.en:
Amelia is a member of the Las Orquídeas community bank. She is married, 45 years old and has three children aged 23, 18 and 13. Her two eldest children are in university and her youngest is in school. Amelia has been working for the past four years in the cafeteria of a company making breakfast from Monday to Friday in the mornings. She brings everything already prepared. She is up at 4 A.M. and with a helper she makes 120 sandwiches with cheese, eggs, avocado, ham, triple sandwiches (layered sandwiches), empanadas, cakes. In the afternoons she sells beauty products from a catalogue. Since joining Finca, her capital has grown and she has been able to buy many things for her home and her business. Initially she sold 30 loaves but she has been able to invest more. Another thing she has learnt is to be punctual with her repayments, to save and to support others. She needs 1,600 soles to buy the ingredients to make the sandwiches. She also needs to buy a sandwich press and a blender. Amelia's dream is to work afternoons in another cafeteria and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy the ingredients to make layered sandwiches, as well as sandwich press and a blender.

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en:
Adiza I. is a married woman. She is forty-eight years old and a mother of six children, all male. Four of her children are currently in school. The first two have completed junior high school and are yet to continue. Adiza lives with her husband and children in a town called Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates food crops such as maize, plantains, and vegetables to provide food for the family.

Adiza enjoys trading and has been selling for over fifteen years in the town where she lives. She sells food items like beans, maize, groundnuts, and all kinds of cereals and grains. She buys her goods from the farmers in her locality and the surrounding towns. At times, Adiza travels all the way to the northern part of the country to procure goods at affordable prices. She sells to the people of her locality, most of whom are food vendors. She says she wants to buy the goods in bulk so that she can reach a larger size of the market by trekking to markets in nearby towns. She says this is possible only by increasing her working capital. Basically, this is what she aspires to use the loan for. It is Adiza’s dream to help her husband provide for their children to make it to the tertiary level of school.

loans.use: To procure cereals and grains

loans.name: Juana Carmen

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas. 
Juana es separada, tiene 51 años, un hijo D. 26 años que estudia  y trabaja. 
Juana estudió secretariado,  trabajó en una tienda D. ventas D. llantas  Lima- Caucho, por varios años, renunció al trabajo por que se casó. Su situación económica no era  buena tuvo que empezar a trabajar consigue  trabajo en  la biblioteca D. la universidad, lamentablemente dejo el trabajo por que su papá se enfermo y tuvo que cuidarlo, quedándose nuevamente sin poder trabajar. 
Sus compañeros D. trabajo la animaron a que traiga loncheras D. menú para que venda, cada día lleva veinticinco loncheras, también ella tiene un carrito sanguchero y sale por las tardes a trabajar en la puerta D. su casa con la ayuda D. su cuñada.

DesD. que comenzó en Finca, aprendió que los prestamos son para el negocio no para gastar, aprendió a ser responsable con los préstamos que piD.. 
Juana necesita 1000 soles, para comprar los ingredientes para la preparación del  menú, arroz,  menestra, aceite, azúcar. 
Su meta es tener un serví centro D. llantas, ya conoce el negocio y se gana mas, esta proyectándose para el próximo año.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of Las Orquídeas Communal Bank. Juana is fifty-one years old, divorced, and the mother or a twenty-six year old son who is studying and working. Juana studied to become a secretary, and worked in a store that sold Lima-Caurucho brand tires. She stopped working there because she got married. Their financial situation wasn’t good though, so she had to start working at the university library. Unfortunately, she had to leave this job because her father got sick. She needed to take care of him and so was unable to work. Her co-workers encourage her to bring lunches to sell; every day, she brings twenty-five lunches. She also has a sandwich cart and sells from it outsiD. her house in the afternoons, with the help of her sister-in-law. Since she became involved with FINCA, she learned that the loans are for her businesses, not general expenses, and she learned to be responsible with the loans she has requested. Juana needs S./1000 ($325) to buy ingredients – such as rice, vegetable soup, oil, and sugar -- for her lunches. Her goal is to have a tire store -- she is already familiar with the business – for, though she is making money, she is planning for the next year.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients such as rice, vegetable soup, oil, and sugar for preparing the lunches she sells.

loans.name: Eulalia Modesta

texts.es:
La Señora Eulalia Modesta M. tiene la edad de 50 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Eulalia tiene 5 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 32 años, su otro hijo de 30 años, otro varón de 26 años y su hija menor de 24 años y solo su hija             la menor depende de Doña Eulalia ya que le ayuda en el negocio, su compañero de vida labora como albañil, sus propósitos son de seguir esta humilde actividad económica con la cual ha trabajado durante años y ha sido la pauta para que su negocio se mantuviera activo sus deseos son de seguir con vida durante un buen tiempo para sacar adelante a su familia y le gustaría viajar al exterior con su esposo para que ambos puedan disfrutar de la vida mientras se pueda sueños son de que su taller sea el mejor en la fabricación de los uniformes, trajes formales para damas y trajes formales para caballeros par que sus clientes prefieran la calidad.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar los servicios de costurera, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 10 años, Doña Eulalia inicia este negocio por la por la compra materia prima y sus inicio los logra elaborando ropa para niños y así obtener sus ingresos que le ayudarían para el soporte de su familia y poco a poco continua con la inversión de su familia hasta lograr lo que actualmente tiene en su negocio y ahora pide el financiamiento para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, y sus compras las realiza en Managua por lo que tiene que recorrer en busca de los mas favorable para su negocio.
texts.en:
Eulalia Modesta Mayorca is 50 years old, married, and has five children. Her children are 32, 30, 26 and 24. Only her youngest daughter lives at home, and she helps her mother with the business. Eulalia’s mate works as a mason. Eulalia intents to continue the modest economic activity at which she has worked for years and she wishes to keep that business running. She hopes that she might continue for a good while in order that her family might prosper. She would like to travel abroad with her husband so that they might enjoy themselves while they can. She dreams that her workshop might excel at making uniforms, and ladies and men’s formalwear, because her customers prefer quality. Eulalia has been in the sewing business for ten years, working both door-to-door and out of her home. Eulalia began this business by purchasing sewing supplies, and she started out making children’s clothing. Doing so, she was able to earn income to support her family. Her family gradually plowed money back into the business until it was to the point it is today. At present Eulalia is requesting a loan for working capital in order to purchase ladies, mens and children’s wear. She makes her purchases in Managua, running around town in search of whatever is best for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan Carlos tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su pareja la señora Lorenza Rojas y sus 2 hijos menores en la ciudad de Itá.

 El mismo posee una carpintería en su domicilio hace más de 5 años, allí fabrica diversos tipo de muebles como: roperos, armarios y otros muebles sobre pedido, también fabrica marcos para puertas y ventanas, sus clientes son macateros y particulares.

Comenta que aprendió la profesión hace 15 años cuando comenzó a trabajar en una carpintería ubicada a unos kilómetros de su hogar. Años más tarde logró ahorrar un poco de dinero con el cual consiguió montar su propia carpintería; hoy día ya cuenta con todas las herramientas y maquinarias necesarias para fabricar los muebles.

El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de maderas en cantidad, aprovechando una oferta recibida a precios muy bajos.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 43, lives with his partner, Lorenza Rojas, and their 2 young children in the city of Ita. Juan Carlos owns a carpentry shop that he has operated from his house for more than 5 years. He makes furniture of various kinds: wardrobes, cabinets and other made-to-order pieces. He also makes frames for doors and windows, both for sellers of such products and people that want the frames for their own houses. He says that he learned the profession 15 years ago when he started working as a carpenter in another town. Years later, he managed to save a little money which he used to set up his own carpentry shop. Now he has all of the tools and machines necessary to make furniture. He's applying for a loan so that he can take advantage of an offer that he received to buy bulk supplies of wood at a very low price.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood for carpentry business.

loans.name: Yanira

texts.es: Yanira tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja y su pequeño hijo, en casa de su madre. Ella es una madre trabajadora, que para darle un mejor futuro a su hijo vende cueros de oveja, negocio que aprendió de su madre, lleva ya 5 años en este trabajo, el cual le arroja buenos ingresos, y piensa seguir prosperando y haciendo crecer su negocio, tiene muchas dificultades adquiriendo los cueros, pero es feliz cuando puede ayudar económicamente a su familia y evitar que les falte algo en la casa. Estando ya, en su cuarto préstamo, Yanira espera que este dinero le ayude a progresar en su negocio y pueda así mejorar su vida y la de su familia. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más cueros y tendrá más mercadería que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yanira is 29 years old, lives with her partner and small child, and runs her home. She is a hard-working mother who sells sheep leather, business which she learned from her mother. She's been working on this for 5 years. She hopes to continue the business and continue her good earnings..

She has a lot of difficulties acquiring the sheep leather but when she does she is happy because she can financially help her family. This way she is able to provide to her household. She is currently on her 4th loan.

Yanira hopes that this money helps her progress in her business and at the same time improve her family's life. With the requested loan she will purchase more leather, that way she'll have more merchandise to offer her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of sheep leather

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa Amponsah is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children: two sons. She says both of her children are in school at the moment. Adwoa’s husband is a farmer. He cultivates plantains and vegetables. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a business and farming community.

Adwoa is a food vendor. She trades fried yam and fish. She procures fresh yam and fish from the nearby cities at wholesale prices and fries them in front of her house in the afternoons. She sells on a table in the local market square and by the street. Many workers buy this as their lunch. It is served with ground pepper. Adwoa has been in business for over ten years. She wants a loan to buy fresh yam and fish and other materials in bulk to be able to increase her profit margin. She wants to acquire refrigerators to store some of the fresh fish she procures. Adwoa hopes to own a family house.

loans.use: To procure fresh yam and fish

loans.name: Alison

texts.es:
La señorita Alison vive en casa de sus padres en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja en una tienda vendiendo joyas de plata.
El crédito que solicita es para comprar billetes de alasita y armar canastitas para vender en la feria de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos. “Alasita” es una feria anual que comienza el 24 de Enero y termina tres semanas después, donde todos los productos artesanales que se venden son miniaturas, desde billetes hasta casas.

No es cliente de Impro pero por la actividad y el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Alison lives with her parents in the neighbourhood of San Martín in La Paz; she works in a store selling silver jewelry. She is asking for a loan to buy miniature money for the festival of Alasita and prepare small baskets to sell at the festival so that she can earn more money. The festival of Alastita is an annual celebration which starts on January 24 and lasts three weeks and where all sorts of products are made in miniature and sold, everything from money to houses. She is not a client of Impro but the nature of this activity and her reputation qualify her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy miniatures to sell during the festival of Alasita.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina M. is twenty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are girls. She says all her daughters are now in basic school. Augustina’s husband is a trader. He trades in second-hand gadgets such as television sets, radios, fridges, etc. She lives with her children and husband in her in-laws' house in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Augustina works very hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She is a food vendor. She cooks rice with stew. Augustina sells on a table top in the compound of the local community school. She buys bags of rice from Kumasi. She has been in business for five years. She wants to buy bags of rice on a large scale so that she can cut down on costs, such as frequent trips to procure goods. It is her dream to help her husband so that they can put up their own structure.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk, which she'll cook with stew

loans.name: Prisca

texts.es:
La señora Prisca vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; ella trabaja con costura según la temporada, confecciona buzos deportivos y como ya es época de clases ella confeccionará guardapolvos escolares (uniformes blancos).

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de tela y otros materiales necesarios.

Es cliente de impro con muy buen historial de pagos y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Prisca lives in her parents' home in Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz St, in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz. She works as a seamstress and makes different items depending on the season, for example sportswear. As it is now the back-to-school season she is making school uniforms. She is seeking a loan to buy fabric and other necessary materials. She is an existing client of Impro with a very good credit history, and is eligible for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread to make school uniforms

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
El señor Genaro vive en casa de sus padres con su esposa e hijos en la Av. Buenos aires de la zona Las Nieves de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que tiene es la confección de ternos, el trabaja directamente con su esposa y dos personas que son las que se encargan de coser ya que Genaro corta la tela.  La esposa viaja a Desaguadero (ciudad en la frontera con Perú), lugar donde tiene su puesto  de venta.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar material (telas, forros, botones, hilo) y de esta manera continuar e incluso mejorar su volumen de producción  para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Su antecedente con Impro se remontan al año 2001, con un historial de pagos muy bueno, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Genaro lives in his parents' home with his wife and children, on Buenos Aires Avenue, Las Nieves zone, in the city of La Paz. His business is tailoring men's suits, working with his wife and two other persons charged with the sewing while Genaro cuts the fabric. His wife travels to Desaguadero (a city on the Peru frontier), where he has his sales location. The credit he is requesting is for the purchase of materials (fabric, linings, buttons, thread) in order to continue and increase his volume of production to offer to his clients. His record with Impro goes back to 2001, with an excellent history of repayment, giving him access to this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, linings, buttons, and thread for tailoring men's suits in his shop

loans.name: Rosa Ana

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas.
Rosa es separada, tiene 47 años, dos hijos de 28 y 27 años ambos estudian y trabajan. 
Empezó hace veinte años a cosiendo ropa,  dando servicio de confección a talleres de costura, esto le trajo muchos dolores en su columna. Decidió cambiar de  actividad empezó a trabajaba  en casa de una señora que daba menús a varias  fabricas, la señora falleció de un momento a otro, ella se hizo cargo del negocio, pero lo traslado a su casa. También cada mes viaja al norte para traer zapatos de Trujillo.

Desde que esta en Finca tiene mas ingresos económicos, aprendió a invertir, a  ahorrar ha podido comprar su casa hace tres años. 
Necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para invertirlo en la compra de víveres, para preparar el menú, arroz, fideos, aceite y traer zapatos del norte de Perú.
El sueño de Rosa es tener un restauran y un taller de confecciones.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Las Orquídeas Community Bank. She is 47 years old, separated, and has two children who are 28 and 27 years old, and who both study and work. She started sewing clothing twenty years ago, offering her services to sewing workshops. This type of work caused her great pain in her back. She decided to change jobs, and started to work in the house of a lady who provided lunchtime meals to various factories. This lady died suddenly, and Rosa took charge of the business, moving it to her home. Additionally, each month she travels to the north to bring back shoes from Trujillo. Since she has worked with Finca she has increased her income, learned to invest and save, and was able to buy her own home three years ago. She is seeking a loan of 800 soles to buy food supplies such as rice, noodles and oil in order to prepare the meals, and also to buy shoes in the north of Peru. Rosa's dream is to own a restaurant and a dressmaking workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food supplies to prepare meals for sale, and to buy shoes in the north of Peru

loans.name: Maria Lucila

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas.
Maria es de Limeña,  tiene 64 años, se caso los veintiocho años  enamorada de su esposo de sesenta años, tienen tres hijos de 36, 34,  y 31 años, todos están casados. 
Tenia una tienda de abarrotes donde su  esposo atendió por 23 años, pero el  cerro que ya no podía seguir atendiendo, por su edad, ahora la alquila. Actualmente ella se dedica hacer chocolates finos, su hija llevo un curso de chocolatería  y ella aprendió,   también se dedica  a la venta de  set de baños.

Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para invertir en compra juegos de set para  baños. 
El sueño que tiene es vivir para ver a sus tataranietos, y ver que sus hijos progresen.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Las Orquídeas Community Bank. She is 64 years old and from Limeña. She married when she was 28 years old, and is still in love with her husband, who is now 70 years old. They have three children who are 36, 34 and 31 years old, and who are all married. They owned a grocery store that her husband ran for 23 years, but he closed the store as he could no longer continue running it as he got older, and the store is now rented out. Maria currently works making fine chocolates. Her daughter took a chocolate-making course, and Maria learned from her. She also sells sets of toiletries. She is seeking a loan of 1000 soles to buy sets of toiletries. Her dream is to live to see her great-grandchildren, and to see her children succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sets of toiletries

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La señora Laura vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Pioneros de la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que ella tiene es la elaboración de artesanías en yeso, las cuales vende en las diferentes ferias de los departamentos de Bolivia.
El crédito que solicita es para comprar material (yeso, colorantes, etc.) y de esta manera poder surtir a todos sus clientes.

Es cliente de impro y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno.
texts.en:
Señora Laura lives in her parents' home on Pioneros Street, Tembladerani district, in the city of La Paz. Her business is creating plaster handicrafts that she sells in various street markets in the states of Bolivia. The loan she is requesting is to buy materials (plaster, colorings, etc.) in order to be able to supply all her clients. She is a client of Impro and has an excellent history of repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plaster and colorings for her business of creating plaster handicrafts

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Union Fait La Force) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est un regroupement de sept femmes du premier quartier de la ville de Koutiala. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants chacune. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles polygames et traditionnelles. 
Elles se connaissent depuis des années à force de collaborer ensemble. Elles mènent differentes activités (la vente de produits cosmetiques,  des poissons fumés et la teinture etc..).
Dans leur souci d’augmenter la taille des activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis bientôt cinq ans. Après avoir correctement tous les neuf précédents prêts, elles sont à leurs dixième prêt qu’elles comptent utiliser pour acheter une quantité importante de produits cosmetiques, des poissons fumés importés de korientzé (la préfecture de Mopti), une quantité importante d’ingrédients pour la teinture.Très expérimentées dans leur domaine respectif, les produits des femmes du groupe Benkadi sont vendus dans la ville de Koutiala et les marchés voisins à une clientèle généralement constituée de femmes. 
Ainsi avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 140 000 CFA. de bénéfice. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et faire face aux charges courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi is composed of seven women of the first district of the city of Koutiala who average 37 years of age and are married mothers with at least five children each. They all live in polygamous and traditional families and have known one another for years through collaborating together. They do different work (selling cosmetics, smoked fish, dyes, etc.)

Concerned about expanding their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program almost five years ago. After having correctly repaid all nine preceding loans, they are on their tenth loan, which they plan to use to buy a sizable quantity of cosmetic products, smoked fish imported from Korientzé (Mopti prefecture), and a sizable quantity of ingredients for making dyes. The women are very experienced in their respective fields. Their merchandise is sold in the city of Koutiala and neighboring marketplaces to customers generally composed of women.

Thus, with this new loan, they intend to realize an average profit of 140,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan interest and to cope with common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Ivetti  Nelly

texts.es:
Ivetti es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas. 
Ivetti es casada, tiene 50 años, estudio industria del vestido en al universidad San Martín. Hizo su practicas en un taller de costura y se quedó trabando durante  diez años, decide renunciar  y poner un taller en su casa, pero la zona donde vive no pagan bien, entonces se dedica hacer composturas de ropa, le rinde más; ella tuvo impedimento para seguir trabajando, estuvo mal de la vesícula,  se sometió a  en tratamiento químico y pudo eliminar las piedras que tenia en la vesícula.  Ahora si puede trabajar y entregar sus pedidos a tiempo.

Desde que esta en Finca aprendió como llevar sus cuentas,  pudo comprar su remalladora, recubridora. Le gusta las reuniones del Bancomunal.
 Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para arreglar sus maquinas de cocer.
El  sueño que tiene Ivetti es, hacer ropa diseñada por ella y venderla.
texts.en:
Ivetti is a member of the Las Orquídeas Community Bank. She is 50 years old and married, and studied clothing manufacturing at San Martín University. She worked for 10 years in a dressmaking workshop, before deciding to leave and start a workshop in her home. However, she wasn't able to earn much money in the area where she lives, so she started offering mending services which brought in more income. Ivetti encountered an obstacle in continuing her work: she had gall stones, and had to undergo chemical treatment to eliminate the stones in her gall bladder. Now she is able to work and deliver her orders on time. Since working with FINCA she has learned how to balance her accounts, and has been able to buy specialised sewing machines. She enjoys the meetings of the community bank. She is seeking a loan of 1000 soles to fix her sewing machines. Ivetti's dream is to design and sell her own clothing line.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her sewing machines

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes Ankoma is forty-six years old. She is divorced but has four children to care for, all are girls. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. One of her children is married. One is in junior high school; the others are learning trade. Agnes works very hard to provide for the family. She sells maize at the local market. Agnes procures bags of maize from farmers in the surrounding communities. She supplies to retailers in her community and also sells on a table top in the local market square. She has been in business for over twenty years. Agnes wants a loan to procure bags of maize produce to retail to more customers. She needs to increase her profit to be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: To procure maize in bulk

loans.name: Graciela Maria

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Bancomunal Las orquídeas.
Graciela es conviviente, tuvo dos hijos, que lamentablemente murieron.
Graciela  estudió contabilidad, cuando empezó a trabajar, fue acosada por su jefe, renunciando, siempre le pasaba lo mismo en los trabajos que conseguía. Entonces decidió poner una tienda de abarrotes, todo iba bien hasta que la asaltaron, llevándose todo,  y quedándose sin capital de trabajo, se dedico a dar desayuno, se levanta a las tres de la madrugada, junto con su esposo,  para la preparación, de la quinua, el quaquer, los samwish, venden en San Juan, desde hace siete años, ahora tienen tres carretas y una persona mas que le ayuda. 
Desde que esta en Finca su vida mejoro, aprendió hacer responsable con sus pagos, siempre a ganado premios por puntualidad, ha hecho buenas amistades. 
Necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, para la compra de ingredientes para dar desayuno,  
El sueño de Graciela es tener un restaurante, viajar a Italia para pasear.
texts.en:
Graciela is an associate of Bancomunal Las Orchídeas. Graciela is a live-in partner, and had two kids who regrettably died. Graciela studied accounting and began working. However each time she would get a job, she was sexually harassed by her bosses, and would have to quit. So she decided to start a grocery store, and everything was going well until she was robbed. They took everything, and left her without any money. She then began to sell breakfast. Now Graciela wakes up at three every morning, together with her husband, to prepare of quinoa, oatmeal, and sandwiches. They have sold these products for seven years, and now they have three wagons and one more person that helps them. Since she has been in Finca her life has improved. She learned to be responsible in making her payments, always winning prizes for her punctuality, making good friendships at the same time. She needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy ingredients so that she can supply her breakfasts. Gracielas dream is to have a restaurant, and to backpack Italy.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Needs a loan of 1000 soles so that she may buy ingredients for the breakfast she sells.

loans.name: Nicacia

texts.es:
La señora Nicacia M. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Nicacia es productora de papa, que trae de la provincia a esta ciudad y la vende en un puesto ambulante.
Su vivienda no cuenta con el amurallado, por lo que le es peligroso dejarlo cuando viaja a cosechar.
El crédito es para la construcción del muro perimetral de su vivienda.
Esta es la sexta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Nicacia M. lives in her own home in the Pasankeri zone in the western side of the city of La Paz. Señora Nicacia grows potatoes that she brings from the farmland to this city and sells in a street stall. Her home does not have a wall, so it is dangerous to leave it when she travels for the harvest. The loan is to construct a perimeter wall around her home. This is the sixth time she has applied for a loan, and the completed socioeconomic analysis favorably qualify her to have access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of construction of a perimeter wall for her house in La Paz.

loans.name: María Ángela

texts.es:
La señora María Ángela tiene 59 años de edad, está casada con el señor Geronimo Mendoza, tienen 3 hijos, viven en el centro de la ciudad de Itá.

Ella se dedica a la confección de pantalones de vestir,  actividad que realiza hace más de 10 años, su taller de confecciones está ubicado en su domicilio, sus ventas las realiza en la ciudades de Itá y Asunción.

 Además de este ingreso económico su esposo posee un vehiculo con el que realiza fletes a distintos puntos del país.

María Ángela comenta que anteriormente trabajaba como costurera para una conocida tienda de la capital, hasta que con mucho esfuerzo, logró reunir el capital necesario para montar su propio taller de costura.
texts.en:
María Ángela is 59 years old and married to Mr. Geronimo Mendoza. They have three children and live in the city center of Itá. She makes a living making dress pants, in which she has 10 years of experience. Her sewing shop is located in her home, and she makes her sales in the cities of Itá and Asunción. Along with this source of income, her husband owns a vehicle that he charters to distinct parts of the country. María Ángela says that she previously worked as a seamstress at a well-known shop in the capital city, until with a lot of effort she was able to come up with the necessary capital to start her own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics

loans.name: Niètaga (Le Succès) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Niètaga est un regroupement de sept femmes du  premier quartier de la ville de Koutiala qui sont  des voisines de longue date. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants chacune qui vivent généralement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles mènent différentes activités (la vente de bois de chauffe, les boissons locales et  glaces, la restauration, les légumes et fruits, du sel etc.).
Dans l’objectif d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont intégré le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 100.000 FCFA pour ce troisième prêt qu’elles comptent utiliser  pour acheter, la contenance d‘un camion en bois de chauffe, des sacs de sucre, de riz pour la restauration et du sel.
Les produits des femmes du groupe Niètaga sont très sollicités dans la ville de Koutiala et elles ont de l’expérience dans leur secteur d’activité. Elles s’approvisionnent dans des localités et  marchés différents et ont une clientèle diverses et variées.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90 000 CFA. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et contribuer dans la prise en charge des dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Niètaga is composed of seven women of the first district of the city of Koutiala who have been neighbors for a long time. They average 37 years of age and are married mothers of at least five children each. They generally live in extended traditional families and do different work (selling firewood, local beverages, ice, meals, fruit and vegetables, salt, etc.)

With the goal of expanding their businesses, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program this year. Their loan amounts have gone from 50,000 francs CFA for the first loan to 100,000 francs for this third loan, which they plan to use to buy: a truck-load of firewood, sacks of sugar and of rice for making meals, and some salt. What the women offer is in great demand in Koutiala. Experienced in their sectors of commerce, they get their supplies in different towns and marketplaces and have diverse and varied customers.

With this new loan, they intend to realize an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs that will be used to repay the loan interest and to help cover common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different items for small-scale commerce

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is fifty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to nine children: three females and six males. She says three of her children are currently in school, senior high and junior high schools. Some have completed some schooling and are working for a while before they continue. Mary lives with her family in a rented house in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Mary is a hardworking woman. She runs two businesses at the same time. She treks oranges to the northern parts of the country and also distributes yams to the food vendors in her community. She buys oranges and tubers of yam from the farmers in her community and from the surrounding villages. She wants a loan to procure oranges and yams in bulk to be able to distribute to more customers. It is Mary’s dream to send her children to university and to help her husband put up a family house.

loans.use: To procure yams and oranges in bulk to be able to sell more widely

loans.name: Fuente De Paz Group

texts.en: Francisca B. is a bank coordinator for the group 8, in the Bank of Hope Fuente de Paz in El Seybo. Francisca has three children; ages 3 and 6 and a one-month old baby. Francisca sells underwear and accesories as her business; most of her customers are from nearby areas. She is applying for a fifth loan from Esperanza. With her new loan she wants to increase her business even more. Francisca hopes that she one day will be able to buy a nice house to live in. She is also very preoccupied about the future of her children; one of her biggest challenges in life was to drop out of school to raise her children. She hopes to go back to school in the future and get a better education so she can provide better for her young children. On behalf of Esperanza, Francisca and the Fuente de Paz Bank of Hope, thank you for your support!

loans.use: purchase new merchandise for clothing business

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna es socia del Bancomunal  Las Orquídeas.
Giovanna es casada tiene 50 años,  tres hijos D. 26, 21 y 18 años, ellos  estudian y trabajan.
Ella trabajó en una compañía D. seguros, era secretaria por muchos años, renunció y ahora  se dedica a la venta D. ropa D. vestir D. exportación, desD. hace diez años,  ofrecer a varias empresas, su esposo es vendedor textil y  le contacta con los clientes.  
DesD. que esta en Finca, ha podido ampliar su capital, pueD. comprar mas ropa al contado, y atender todos los  pedidos que le hacen, tiene mas clientes, le gusta las reuniones por que son solidarias, y son responsables.

Necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles, para la compra D.  pedidos D. ropa que las clientes le han hecho.
La meta que tiene es tener cada mes ventas fijas,  que le produzcan un sueldo,  mudarse D. San Juan  y comprarse un departamento.
texts.en:
Giovanna is a member of “The Orchids” cooperative bank. She is married, 50 years old, and has three children ages 26, 21 and 18 who study and work. She worked at an insurance company, having been a secretary there for many years. She resigned, and for ten years now has dedicated herself to selling clothing for export. Her husband sells textiles, and gets her in touch with customers. Since she has been with Finca she has expanded her capital base, been able to buy more clothing in cash, and fulfill all the orders she gets. She has more customers, and enjoys their meetings because of the solidarity and because they are responsible. She needs a loan of 1,600 soles to buy clothes to fill orders she has from customers. Her goals are to have steady sales each month that will proviD. her with an income, to move from San Juan and buy an apartment for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan of 1600 soles to fill clothing orders from customers.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther O. is forty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, three boys and a girl. Currently, Esther says three of her children have completed junior high school, while the last is still in elementary school. She is also taking care of her late sister's three children. She lives with her family in a family house in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a farming and commercial community.

Esther works hard to support her husband in taking care of the family. Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates maize, plantains and other food stuffs in the community where they live. Esther sells fresh yam in the local market square. She procures the tubers of yam from the farmers in the surrounding villages. Esther has been in this business for eight years now and is full of experience. She also distributes the yam to some food vendors in her community. She wants a loan to buy tubers of yam on a large scale so that she can distribute to more customers and so increase her profit margin. Esther wants to help her children and those of her late sister to further their education after completing junior high school.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya (composé de 6 femmes  mariées) ont en moyenne 29 ans et 4 enfants. Elles résident dans le quartier  Hamdallaye de la ville de Sikasso.
Elles  exercent des activités commerciales différentes mais la plus dominante est la vente des habits  pour enfant, et de savon  à laquelle s’ajoute la vente de bois de chauffe.
Pour mener à bien leur activité et de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle, ils sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Le prêt précédent a été bien dénoué.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 5 balles de friperie, 5 charrettes de bois se chauffe et 5 cartons de savon. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso ville  et les villages environnants.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et la plupart au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso (Médine et le grand marché de la ville) et dans le quartier à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 17 000 FCFA par mois qu’elles utilisent pour soutenir un peu la famille en aidant leur mari et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya Group ( composed of 6 married women) are on average, 29 years old with 4 children. They reside in the Hamdallaye district of the city of Sikasso. They operate different business, mostly in the sale of children's clothes, soaps and the sale of fire wood. To better manage their businesses and to satisfy their clients they have joined the Soro Yiriaso microbank. They are on their second group loan, with their preceding loan having been duly repaid. They expect to use this loan to buy 5 bales of used clothing, 5 loads of firewood, and 5 cartons of soap. They buy their supplies directly in Sikaooa and in the surrounding villages. Their products are sold at retail and mostly for cash at the marketplaces in Sikasso.(Medine and the city's central market) and in the housing districts, to a clientele made up of both men and women. They each expect to earn a profit of 17,000 FCFA per month, which they will use some to help their families by supporting their husbands and the remainder to invest into their businesses.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 bales of used clothing, 5 loads of firewood, and 5 cartons of soap

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La  señora Olga Ramona , domiciliada en la compañía Itá 
Potrero   de la  Ciudad  de  Itá, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, Francisco de 38 años quien es electricista y Fabio de 22 años de edad quien está cursando el tercer año de la carrera de derecho.

La misma se desempeña como costurera desde los 12 años de edad, dicho oficio aprendió de su familia, ya que la abuela y la madre eran costureras, pero no contenta decidió estudiar y terminando la Educación Básica estudió tres años Corte y Confección, 2 años manualidades y 1 año para el título de Profesora en Corte y Confección. 
Comenta que a los 16 años ya era muy conocida por sus trabajos, llegando a confeccionar a su corta edad vestidos de novia,  y tuvo que trabajar mucho ya que era la hermana mayor de 10 hermanos a quienes tuvo que mantener porque la madre fue internada en un hospital psiquiátrico.
Mediante un sacerdote Italiano pudo contactar con un comandante de las Fuerzas Aéreas de Italia, quien le ayudó a montar su fábrica de costura firmando un contrato con las Hermanas Redentoristas de Carapeguá quien tiene a su cargo vestir a niños de escasos recursos, trabajando así ya por más de 10 años.
La demanda de la confección de uniformes ha ido aumentando    es por ello que la misma ha puesto su confianza en la Fundación Paraguaya solicitando su apoyo para la adquisición de una máquina de coser nueva y telas, pudiendo así seguir realizando esta labor que con tanto empeño y dedicación lo hace a diario.
texts.en:
Olga Ramona lives in the city of Itá and is a single mother of two children. Francisco is a 38-year-old electrician and Fabio is 22 years old and in his third year of law school. Olga has been a seamstress since she was 12 years old and learned the craft from her grandmother and mother, who were also seamstresses, but she was not content. She decided to go to school and studied three years of sewing and cutting, two years of crafts and one more year to earn the title of professor of sewing and cutting. She says after 16 years she is well known for her work and has made bridal gowns.

She had to work very hard because she was the eldest of 10 siblings, whom she had to provide for because their mother was admitted to a psychiatric hospital. Through an Italian priest, she was able to come in contact with a commander of the Italian Air Force, who helped her set up her sewing shop and sign a contract with a group clothing children of scarce resources. She did this for more than 10 years.

The demand to make uniforms has increased and it's for this reason she has placed her confidence in Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya in supporting her to acquire a new sewing machine and fabrics, which will help her continue carrying out her daily work that she does with such effort and dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. S. M. es pequeña productora de arroz, el marido tiene problemas de invalidez por lo que la señora solicitante tiene que atender la produccion de arroz y el hogar, todos sus hijos son mayores y no habitan en la casa.  Diariamente asiste a sus areas de produccion; con la presente solicitud pretende incorporarse como socia de un trillo arrocero que le permitira obtener mayores ingresos de su produccion.
texts.en:
